The origin story of New Myths Press, thus-far and growing:

A Question was More than merely Gnawing at Me:
How do We Unravel the Mounting, Global Crises 
that So Few Even Want to Acknowledge?

I grew up with an awareness that pollution, deforestation, excessive human population and consumption, and a preponderance of violence and warfare (and the capacities of nuclear and other mass- destructive “options”  at the push of a button)  were looming problems which seemed to grow ever-larger on the planet in my lifetime.  Even as progress was made to “fix” an aspect of one of the diverse  problems (the lowering of pollution-levels and cleaning of rivers in formerly-industrial cities of America, for example), a global view made it clear to the informed that these “costs of progress” (largely unpaid by the “producers” of pollution) were merely shifted, as large-scale industrial production went from the U.S. to (mostly) Asia, where pollution is now more extreme than it was in earlier industrial America.  And of course, pollution knows no boundaries, does not “stay put” where it is produced.  Just because it is “out of sight,” does not mean it is not increasing vastly, spreading its effects throughout this cornerless orb.

Thirteen years ago, my daughter was born, and my existing concerns about these ever-growing problems intensified at the prospect of passing along to my daughter, her generation, and future generations a deeply damaged planet.  My feelings and concerns were no longer general, a matter of self-education accompanied by a shrug of the shoulders and “well, what can be done?”  It was not merely my own discomfort and melancholy at the prospect of a deteriorating world, the extinction of species, the razing of dense forests which are not only habitats (that is, the only available homes)  of myriad species, but also serve as the literal “lungs” of the planet itself, creating  the oxygen which all breathing species require to survive on this Sacred Gift, the Only Survivable Planet available to us—suddenly, I  had a beloved child to bring up in this damaged world!  Why weren't fellow-parents everywhere screaming from the rooftops with rage and despair, actively and rapidly dismantling the mechanisms and incentives making planetary rape profitable, thus apparently inevitable?  When I shared information about these mounting environmental and other crises, enunciated by experts on the scale and nature of the problems, as well as those suggesting and pursuing possible solutions, small/ local and large-scale—why were these expressions so often met with a deafening, soul-shattering silence? 

Were others not concerned?  

Aside from the havoc of pollution, climate chaos, and the “nuclear genie,” I learned in the decade since my daughter’s birth about peak oil, predicted by then-prominent oil geologist Marion Hubbert in the 1950s, and peak Everything (metals, minerals, “resources” of every stripe), accurately forecast in the early 1970s by the original Club of Rome Limits to Growth report.  These predicted peaks are all manifesting, as mainstream and full-on denialist media, politicians and (especially) economists condescendingly deny and ignore their clear signs and cratering effects on the global economy.  As they rapidly approach the point of irreversible undeniability, financial collapse looks likely to be the first “shot across the bow” which shocks many clinging to still-ubiquitous delusions of techno-utopia and limitless growth into an unwilling, likely devastating and worldview-shattering, “unexpected” paradigm of unremitting—well, Less.

However, and however rapidly, the impending shifts tumble forth upon us, it will be uncomfortable and paradigm-crushing for many.  Most still believe, no matter what their awareness or degree of concern, that “They'll think of something,” that the middle class lifestyle that many (though a significant minority, globally) have grown accustomed to will inexorably, inevitably continue, that these problems will, of course, be solved, and “those (evil) people” must and will  be overcome, but that “our standard of living” can and certainly will be protected and sustained, is sacrosanct and inevitable…

The phrases and terms above in quotes, and the many similar words and phrases commonplace today, are mirrored shards of this world’s myths, and even those of us not deep in belligerent, bellicose denial about the existence (much less depth) of the myriad problems and challenges facing us and the planet our species is squeezing tend to live as though the central Myth, as battered and compromised as it is and seems at times, is ultimately true:  the Myth of Progress.  “Whatever stumbles occur  and obstacles obstruct, however much the trajectory seems one step forward and two steps back, We are on a Path Toward Progress, ever upward, to the stars and beyond,” says this core myth.  “If fossil fuels become scarce [too expensive to remain ubiquitous], and pollute too much, we will switch to solar and wind to power our homes and trips to the strip malls and our commute to our cubicles”…  But fossil fuels are a very, uniquely concentrated form of energy, and are used for far more than just electrifying homes and getting to work. 

Pollution and climate change are looming, major threats, and humans have already proven committed (by actions, and lack thereof) to the Too Little, Too Late path as far as any serious address of these and so many related issues and problems—eradication of forests and species, fisheries and ocean life, rampant desertification, drought and accompanying crop failures and famine—problems related to each other inasmuch as they all tie-in to the core stories and worldview which allow us to see humans, civilized techno-industrial humans in particular, as separate and above the earth’s life forms and that which we define as “resources.”  The techno-industrial  worldview, stories, underlying agreements, many unspoken, about what is important, what goals to pursue, about participants’ purpose in life and the meaning gleaned from existence, these have a primary significance and impact upon our actions and attitudes as a species, as global techno-industrial civilization.

It was in coming to this conclusion that I had my own personal “a-ha!” moment.  Not that I saw myself as so important and wise as to be able to single-handedly make any significant shift in the momentum of destruction of “our” culture, but the epiphany allowed me to shift from despondency and a sense of futility, a sense that many commonplace forms of protest and activism have been ineffective and somehow “not it,” to a sense of identifying a powerful force within the core of us all, a seemingly unrelated but highly significant aspect of what allows and causes humanity to be so destructive, and heedless of the wastelands in our wake:  our Core Stories move us to do these things, and both motivate and justify our destructive activities, from war and colonial/cultural genocide to the outright destruction of vast swaths of the landscape which destroy habitats and drive countless species extinct. 

The Myths of Progress and Endless Growth are pervasive yet subtle.  They are a modern extension of the idea of Manifest Destiny, but we can look back with historic detachment upon those two words and their underlying beliefs with some distance and disapproval, whereas most today have no such perspective on the rigidity and staunch Faith wrapped up in the ideas of constant, ever-increasing Progress and economic Growth which most embrace today as unquestionable Truth.  Most today would not describe or accept a definition of these terms as “beliefs,” and don't accept that there is any way around the harm being done to the planet, if an alternative meant an end to, much-less a reversal of, economic growth or constant technological Progress.  Just as slavery seemed inevitable, normal and was justified in its time and context, continuing extraction of millions of barrels of substances which contribute to making the planet unfit for living things currently alive on the planet, possibly including our own species, is not seen as negotiable.  Even those who “oppose fossil fuels,” many of us, most of us, still drive cars, fly in planes, use roads and plastics and heat our homes using the energy of burned carbon.  We still use and require money, work in jobs to earn that money, and use the resources our culture and its stories make available to us, day-to-day, minute by minute.

It really hit me how influential these underlying stories are, how entwined they are with the actions, beliefs and routines of our lives.  We live IN our stories; our stories PREVENT us from taking different courses of action, however much we might oppose the harm done by those very actions.  Another aspect of story-centrality to how we relate to (or fail to) the consequences of living-out these stories is that, for those of us opposed to the idea of imposing these consequences on our children and those yet-unborn (much-less ourselves, already, Now), a consistent way to see the problems and their consequences is in terms of an Evil Enemy who is responsible and must be opposed, must be stopped.  We must Fight, we must Battle, we must Oppose the forces of Evil!  Whether we see corporate CEOs as evil, or politicians (or politicians of the Other party), or oil companies, or chemical or agribusiness or banking and finance companies; whether Wall Street or Hollywood or the Military Industrial Complex or Organized Religion—when we portray any or all of these Others as those Responsible, as those inhuman, callous and self-interested enough to have Caused the problems we wish didn't exist, we create the aggressive, dualistic, oppositional energy which tends merely to exacerbate existing problems, and which fails to take into account the mirror.  Enemies are central players in all conventional stories; battling and overcoming enemies is the way we see “our” stories—it is, though, an important reason we new new types of stories, in which endless conflict and blame and scapegoating are not the pervasive features, ineffective in laying-out new paradigms which will be necessary to have a chance of moving beyond current culture’s destructiveness.

A lifelong creative, with hands-on experience and university/ professional-level training in numerous forms of art and performance, my most consistent, lifelong creative outlet and through-line has been my love of writing.  My university BA is in English; I have written poetry since high school, consistently; I have written a one-act play which has been performed in America and at the Edinburgh Festival in Scotland; I have written multiple feature-length screenplays, one of which was independently produced; I have written and self-published a book on alternative education. 

I have also written stories, and written a few individual episodes of memoir—but over the years, I had only glanced ("too busy!"—aren't we all?) at the notion of writing a novel. 

I didn't kid myself that writing one novel was going to “save the world”—but my epiphanies about the centrality and pervasiveness of our culture’s stories to how we see, and crucially, to how we act in and upon the world, made me realize that I wanted to intentionally write with New Stories, New Myths in mind.  I began writing the novel World of Wounds with this idea in place.  I didn't have a clear map of how  I would achieve anything new or groundbreaking, much less, as I could see was so necessary, anything transformative or transcendent of today’s Core Stories and underlying Myths—but I wrote with this lodestar in my mind’s eye, with the urgency I could feel to my core about salvaging the beauty and privilege of life on this planet.  I created five unrelated characters, and followed them on journeys physical and interior which led each eventually to participate in a movement which echoes that practiced today by permaculturists, eco-villagers, homesteaders, founders of Transition Towns and many others who have made a priority of local self-sufficiency, eco-logical practice and priorities.  I finished and self-published the completed draft of the novel at the beginning of 2015, not seeing it as a perfect expression of the type of New Myths I could clearly see our culture needs, but confident inasmuch as the characters and stories unfolded authentically, and expressed what I was capable of communicating along the lines of the kind of New Story I had envisioned.  I enjoyed writing the interwoven stories, seeing how the characters and their journeys came together from very disparate starting-points to a common cause and forming the first seed, sprouting in the course of the stories’ unfolding, of a New (and Ancient) way of seeing and being on/with the earth.  It is certainly my hope that others find inspiration and enjoyment in the unfolding stories of the novel, in the characters’ growth and obstacles, mistakes and challenges, and where they arrive by the novel’s end.

The year since publishing World of Wounds last winter has been an inspiring whirlwind.  My own international network of fellows informed and concerned about the above issues and much more grew rapidly, and I began to get to know a number of those I found myself most admiring.  By May, I was being interviewed by KMO for The C-Realm, probably my favorite podcast and the "place" I first heard and learned about Charles Eisenstein among many of my favorite writers and thinkers.  Soon after that interview, I attended a day-long New Story conference featuring Charles Eisenstein and another favorite writer and podcaster, Chris Martenson, and met both of them and many other amazing, committed individuals treading this urgent path.  I was honored when I contacted Adebayo, whose writings and speaking I had first run-across through its affinity with those of Charles Eisenstein, and Bayo had responded directly and very personally right from the outset.  I developed a similar correspondence and friendship-from-afar with Jason Hine, whose insightful Facebook posts regularly impressed and pierced me, shaking me into presence and open compassion in the midst of the urgency of these times.  My own intuition and disposition led me to embrace the notion that There Is No Enemy-- Jason's writing challenges me to consistently renew this realization, and examine my own intentions and flaws in the face of the temptation to blame, complain, "force" solutions or identify scapegoats.  Shahbano's poetry was introduced to me by a Rmala al'Aalam, fellow-member of the exceptional More Beautiful World Facebook group, an international online community whose title and premise are rooted in Eisenstein's most-recent book The More Beautiful World Our Hearts Know is Possible, and a forum where Adebayo and Jason post regularly.  Rmala is a Pakistani woman who is designing the New Myths Press website and is a passionate contributor to forwarding the mission of NMP.  She knows Shahbano and her poetry, and recommended it to my attention.

I don't believe that New Myths Press is alone or unique in identifying the degree to which the stories today's culture propagates and tells itself, stories of constant Progress and Endless Growth, are an important and inextricable root cause of the destruction being wreaked upon this planet's living systems and, potentially, it's ability to support life.  We certainly need more venues attempting to identity the new and ancient, existing stories which preserve and exalt life, see the sacred privilege of life as more essential than profit or domination, "Progress" and ever-growing "resource" extraction at the expense of ecosystems and the biosphere.


We Need New Stories.


New (Ancient) Paradigms of Thinking and Living Upon this One Survivable, Precious Planet.

For A Future.

Bayo is one of three writers newly-publishing with New Myths Press.

New Myths Press

 
The World Needs New Core Stories.
New (ancient) ways of relating to nature, to each other, to notions of economics, of "enough," to our human place within a larger planetary community
...for A Future.




The planet, life on this only planet we know of which supports life, is facing great challenges and stresses at the hands of humankind.  Humans in this global culture know many of the causes, but only speak of "reducing" fossil fuel emissions and other hyperabundant pollution which techno-industrial global society produces to maintain what are considered the minimum requirements of civilization.  Carbon dioxide, methane and other forms of pollution, meanwhile, increase each year despite promises and goals to "reduce" what must actually be discontinued for the planet to avoid extreme changes already occurring, already damaging life and its future prospects.  Today's humans are flattening global forests, overfishing the oceans, driving myriad species extinct, daily.
Humans once lived within the boundaries of the ecosystems that support life; those cultures which did not live within nature's boundaries (Easter Island, the Mayan civilization) disappeared.  Those cultures which lasted tens of thousands of years without overshooting the carrying capacity of the land they lived upon, and what the land provided them to continue living, had stories which taught each succeeding generation to fundamentally respect, hold and treat as sacred the land and life around them, grateful for the sacred privilege of life and understanding their own place as co-existent strands within the fabric of life.  These peoples did not see themselves as "separate from," "above" nature and the life they saw about them.
We call the stories of these peoples "myths," frequently with a condescending tone and underlying intent.  
Today's techno-industrial humanity, which William R. Catton, Jr. called "Homo Colossus" in his important book Overshoot, do not even see the myths currently driving them (us) to destroy that which makes life on this planet possible, as quickly as its ever-"improving" machines can accomplish the task.
We need new stories.  We need New Myths, more like those of former (and still existing here and there upon the planet) humans.  We need those ancient stories, told in a way that today's humanity, those of us concerned for A Future, can reshape the destiny currently mapped-out and inexorable, unless we can imagine and pursue a new (ancient) path.  To even see that path, we need stories which point the way, and affect the actions we take, the beliefs we hold.
Humans love stories.  They are fundamental to who we are, how we see the world, ourselves, and our place within the world and life.  You might say, to use a techno-industrial metaphor, that they contain our operating system.
New Myths Press has its own origin story.  I know we live in a sound-byte, YouTube, Twitter-pated world in which few have the time to read more than 140 characters about something new, so I have included a Who? What? Where? When? Why? summary just below, and below that a breakdown of how New Myths Press will spend the funds contributed to this crowdfunding campaign.  The New Myths Press story is below these, and you are welcome to read it, or bookmark this page to read later when you have some time.

This IndieGogo campaign is designed to fund an exceptional launch to match the importance and vision of the writers about to publish with New Myths Press.  Along with their collections, a newly revised, edited version of the novel World of Wounds will also be published, all being launched soon after this campaign is complete.  We have made exciting Perks available to those who contribute— whatever you are able and inspired to contribute will greatly assist in providing these writers, and the Mission of New Myths Press as an endeavor, with the exposure they certainly deserve. Help by contributing to this campaign, and by spreading the word directly to those you know who would like and support New Myths Press. 
Thank You.
-Zack Lehtinen
Father, Author, Collaborative Publisher, New Myths Press

that of Rumi, and generations of sacred poets since.The campaign will also support the rollout and marketing of the newly revised and edited edition of Zack Lehtinen’s novel World of Wounds.  All who previously contributed to the crowdfunding campaign for that novel, or who have purchased World of Wounds in its existing form, will receive their chosen contribution “perks”  for this campaign,  and will also receive a signed copy of the newly-revised edition of the novel World of Wounds, regardless of the level of contribution.  You only have to ask.What?New Myths Press:  an independent, print-on-demand imprint collaborating to create attractive trade-paperback and Kindle eBooks.  New Myths publishes novels, collections of essays, poetry, speeches, stories and transcribed interviews/ conversations, and is open to publishing other types of writing as well.  All have in common the commitment to enVisioning ways of living in alignment with this one planet we share, seeking paradigms beyond what Charles Eisenstein has called the “space between stories” where many of us currently  reside:  the old, destructive, still-commonplace stories of infinite growth on a finite, deeply damaged planet, myths of techno-industrial utopian Progress, habits of seeing the earth and its beauties, its habitats and provisions as “resources” to exploit, even if that means polluting earth, air and oceans, razing ecosystems, driving species to extinction and compromising our own children’s ability to live on a survivable planet, much-less to thrive; and the necessary New (Ancient) Stories which embrace the beauty, resilience and sacred privilege of our place as humans, shared voices in the chorus of life, not disconnected, hubristic Masters and Conquerors of  the earth.  We have the ability, option, the sacred Privilege to live as a timeless dance with the beautiful world we have been born-into; but we require New (Ancient) Stories, new Myths, magical and sacred ways of seeing our relationship with our fellow-travelers, because the Core Stories currently being lived into existence have taken humanity and all life on this planet to a dangerous, existential brink. Stories have brought us here, and fuel the tremendous momentum of destruction which cannot be denied, and cannot be transcended from within the same stories.As Albert  Einstein famously  said, “We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.”  This simple truth is also profound, and points squarely to our culture’s core Myths.  Some might say, “Myths?  Those are ancient stories of magic, of pagan Gods, indigenous peoples and ignorant, pre-scientific times, fables and origin stories disconnected from what progress and scientific inquiry have allowed us to access in these post-Enlightenment times.”  Many cannot see, are too ensconced within the fluid of the stories they are swimming in to even acknowledge or understand that they ARE stories—they are today’s myths.  Myths of techno-industrial limitless growth and constant progress, myths of human control over the planet, a myth (to give just one specific example) which says that because our species “discovered” how to split atomic particles, that gives us the right to inflict the mass-destruction of nuclear chain reactions upon fellow human beings and other living things, to “harness” the energy of split atoms without any effective plan to protect the future from the radioactive “waste” such energy “production” manufactures…  And speaking of waste: current myths  tell us that it is a “normal” side-effect of being human to dump mountains of non-degradable plastics into the oceans, to heap carbon, methane and dioxin, synthetic “man-made” chemicals and genetically-modified life-forms  into the air and soil, water and biosphere, where their consequences are widespread, devastating and frequently last centuries in their destructive, disruptive potential.These are stories our culture tells itself, and these underlying stories support the continuing onslaught, fuel the attitudes and rationalizations which allow us to see wanton destruction of the capacity for life as the normal “business of life.” We need new stories—New (Ancient) Myths.New Myths Press is dedicated to finding, to collaborating with creators of  stories, those able to envision and describe paradigms of understanding and action required for A Future, and to sharing their writings  with you.Where?Distribution and participation are international.  New Myths Press titles are available anywhere Amazon operates (thus, can also be ordered by most physical bookstores upon request), anywhere Kindle books can be ordered and accessed.  Many New Myths Press writings will even be available free, online, but we are producing attractive trade-paperback volumes and Kindle eBooks, as affordable as we can make them, because we want you to be able to have these writings in your permanent library, available to read and re-read, share and gift.  New Myths contributors span the planet already—from the U.S. to Nigeria, from Pakistan to the U.K.—and we plan to expand this trend as we grow our community of Visionaries and eccentric communicators of unseen paradigms unfolding in our midst already, but invisible until enunciated.When?As we initiate this IndieGogo campaign, the writing described above is written, collected, being fine-tuned and edited, and should be ready for publication by the completion of the crowdfunding campaign in 40 days, or very soon thereafter.  Our goal is to publish by or before the second week in May, and by the end of this IndieGogo campaign we will likely have the publication date established and available.Why?For A Future.Breakdown of how funds will be spent:$1,000 to establish an SEO campaign using AdEdge online marketing, Westport, CT, including ad designs and upgrade to website and social media presence/ appearance/ effectiveness.I have done my research, and AdEdge is the best at what it does: they are expert at leveraging the advanced tools of SEO (search engine optimization online), targeting online marketing, in compelling but non-invasive ways, using the latest and best tools of GoogleAds, Facebook and social media generally, making sure the ads we use, our website and social media pages are designed and placed to attract those seeking exactly this sort of "product."  The expansion of New Myths Press will be in the best of hands; your contribution will make the greatest difference possible in spreading this endeavor, these great writers and their urgent words, without access to a large publisher's budget and marketing department.  $500 for a targeted online marketing campaign using AdEdge online marketing.$500 for a targeted, specialized social media campaign using AdEdge online marketing.$300/ month, first 12 months of ongoing online marketing costs:  $3,600$50 for review/ promotion services from Serious Reading:  serious reading.com$250 for business expenses, startup$500 for readings/appearances by New Myths Press writers This totals $6,400, an amount which will establish New Myths Press with all initial advertising and marketing costs for an independent launch campaign, lasting nearly a year in which the Press can establish itself, advertise its authors, expand awareness of this essential offering.  If we do not reach this goal, we will use the funds in as effective and targeted a way possible to maximize and expand existing social media and online presence, upgrading and launching the New Myths Press website and whatever GoogleAds funding achieved will allow us to make and place.  If we exceed this funding goal, all funds will go into further marketing and expansion efforts of New Myths Press, to promote the writers current and future who contribute to its crucial mission of providing urgently needed New (Ancient) Myths-- for A Future. Your ContributionNew Myths Press has reached a key state of potential to grow-into, to identify  and communicate with  its ideal audience.  We will continue finding and publishing  essential writings,  introducing more international contributors into the New Myths Press canon.  Adebayo, Jason and Aliani are exciting, richly expressive, rewarding writers who have demonstrated ongoing commitment to playing their parts in ushering-in the More Beautiful World our hearts imagine and hope to co-create. Your contribution, even of the smallest pledge-amount, will play a key, very direct role in allowing New Myths Press to expand the readership these writers deserve, as well as providing an empowering platform for bringing new writers to the attention of those seeking this sort of writing:  urgent, beautiful voices writing their hearts’ vision for A Future. New Myths Press will continue gathering an impressive cadre of further writers, poets, storytellers and philosophers, those whose words open New (Ancient) vistas of planetary healing and, just possibly, a thriving future rather than the one currently being approached headlong at maximum velocity.Supporting New Myths Press is an investment in a better Future for our kids and future generations.  They will need new stories to get through difficult times already encroaching—New Myths to frame the struggle of constructing a More Beautiful World.THANK YOU for your contribution!  These writers have created beautiful, urgent, vital writing—they deserve a large, appreciative audience.  This campaign represents a commitment to expand that audience with all the targeted, customized power that a well-designed, professional online advertising and social media campaign can provide.  If we make less than our target amount, we will economize the effort with the same intention and pursuit; the compelling opportunity of reaching or exceeding our fundraising goal is that these writers, and the expansion of New Myths Press, will have the opportunity to expand just at the moment that these exciting, important international voices are published.Support these writers.  Support the search for the New (Ancient) Stories our damaged world needs, which our children and future generations can benefit from our having brought-into the world..  Stories, poems, speeches, essays, sacred insights from everyday people who have tapped-into their concerns, their gift for words, their deepest, most honest and authentic expression of what will be required of our human generation.New Myths:  for A Future.A few related links, resonant and inspiring to the New Myths Press vision and mission:Manish Jain:  http://schoolingtheworld.org/people/manish/Charles Eisenstein:   http://charleseisenstein.netA characteristically powerful, insightful video of Charles speaking-- highly resonant with New Myths Press's vision and mission:  http://charleseisenstein.net/project/story-disruption-morphogenesis-2015/William Catton Jr., Overshoot:  William R. Catton, Jr.-- "Sociology's Neglect of Ecological Context" The origin story of New Myths Press, thus-far and growing:A Question was More than merely Gnawing at Me:How do We Unravel the Mounting, Global Crises that So Few Even Want to Acknowledge?I grew up with an awareness that pollution, deforestation, excessive human population and consumption, and a preponderance of violence and warfare (and the capacities of nuclear and other mass- destructive “options”  at the push of a button)  were looming problems which seemed to grow ever-larger on the planet in my lifetime.  Even as progress was made to “fix” an aspect of one of the diverse  problems (the lowering of pollution-levels and cleaning of rivers in formerly-industrial cities of America, for example), a global view made it clear to the informed that these “costs of progress” (largely unpaid by the “producers” of pollution) were merely shifted, as large-scale industrial production went from the U.S. to (mostly) Asia, where pollution is now more extreme than it was in earlier industrial America.  And of course, pollution knows no boundaries, does not “stay put” where it is produced.  Just because it is “out of sight,” does not mean it is not increasing vastly, spreading its effects throughout this cornerless orb.Thirteen years ago, my daughter was born, and my existing concerns about these ever-growing problems intensified at the prospect of passing along to my daughter, her generation, and future generations a deeply damaged planet.  My feelings and concerns were no longer general, a matter of self-education accompanied by a shrug of the shoulders and “well, what can be done?”  It was not merely my own discomfort and melancholy at the prospect of a deteriorating world, the extinction of species, the razing of dense forests which are not only habitats (that is, the only available homes)  of myriad species, but also serve as the literal “lungs” of the planet itself, creating  the oxygen which all breathing species require to survive on this Sacred Gift, the Only Survivable Planet available to us—suddenly, I  had a beloved child to bring up in this damaged world!  Why weren't fellow-parents everywhere screaming from the rooftops with rage and despair, actively and rapidly dismantling the mechanisms and incentives making planetary rape profitable, thus apparently inevitable?  When I shared information about these mounting environmental and other crises, enunciated by experts on the scale and nature of the problems, as well as those suggesting and pursuing possible solutions, small/ local and large-scale—why were these expressions so often met with a deafening, soul-shattering silence? 
Were others not concerned?  
Aside from the havoc of pollution, climate chaos, and the “nuclear genie,” I learned in the decade since my daughter’s birth about peak oil, predicted by then-prominent oil geologist Marion Hubbert in the 1950s, and peak Everything (metals, minerals, “resources” of every stripe), accurately forecast in the early 1970s by the original Club of Rome Limits to Growth report.  These predicted peaks are all manifesting, as mainstream and full-on denialist media, politicians and (especially) economists condescendingly deny and ignore their clear signs and cratering effects on the global economy.  As they rapidly approach the point of irreversible undeniability, financial collapse looks likely to be the first “shot across the bow” which shocks many clinging to still-ubiquitous delusions of techno-utopia and limitless growth into an unwilling, likely devastating and worldview-shattering, “unexpected” paradigm of unremitting—well, Less.
However, and however rapidly, the impending shifts tumble forth upon us, it will be uncomfortable and paradigm-crushing for many.  Most still believe, no matter what their awareness or degree of concern, that “They'll think of something,” that the middle class lifestyle that many (though a significant minority, globally) have grown accustomed to will inexorably, inevitably continue, that these problems will, of course, be solved, and “those (evil) people” must and will  be overcome, but that “our standard of living” can and certainly will be protected and sustained, is sacrosanct and inevitable…
The phrases and terms above in quotes, and the many similar words and phrases commonplace today, are mirrored shards of this world’s myths, and even those of us not deep in belligerent, bellicose denial about the existence (much less depth) of the myriad problems and challenges facing us and the planet our species is squeezing tend to live as though the central Myth, as battered and compromised as it is and seems at times, is ultimately true:  the Myth of Progress.  “Whatever stumbles occur  and obstacles obstruct, however much the trajectory seems one step forward and two steps back, We are on a Path Toward Progress, ever upward, to the stars and beyond,” says this core myth.  “If fossil fuels become scarce [too expensive to remain ubiquitous], and pollute too much, we will switch to solar and wind to power our homes and trips to the strip malls and our commute to our cubicles”…  But fossil fuels are a very, uniquely concentrated form of energy, and are used for far more than just electrifying homes and getting to work. 
Pollution and climate change are looming, major threats, and humans have already proven committed (by actions, and lack thereof) to the Too Little, Too Late path as far as any serious address of these and so many related issues and problems—eradication of forests and species, fisheries and ocean life, rampant desertification, drought and accompanying crop failures and famine—problems related to each other inasmuch as they all tie-in to the core stories and worldview which allow us to see humans, civilized techno-industrial humans in particular, as separate and above the earth’s life forms and that which we define as “resources.”  The techno-industrial  worldview, stories, underlying agreements, many unspoken, about what is important, what goals to pursue, about participants’ purpose in life and the meaning gleaned from existence, these have a primary significance and impact upon our actions and attitudes as a species, as global techno-industrial civilization.
It was in coming to this conclusion that I had my own personal “a-ha!” moment.  Not that I saw myself as so important and wise as to be able to single-handedly make any significant shift in the momentum of destruction of “our” culture, but the epiphany allowed me to shift from despondency and a sense of futility, a sense that many commonplace forms of protest and activism have been ineffective and somehow “not it,” to a sense of identifying a powerful force within the core of us all, a seemingly unrelated but highly significant aspect of what allows and causes humanity to be so destructive, and heedless of the wastelands in our wake:  our Core Stories move us to do these things, and both motivate and justify our destructive activities, from war and colonial/cultural genocide to the outright destruction of vast swaths of the landscape which destroy habitats and drive countless species extinct. 
The Myths of Progress and Endless Growth are pervasive yet subtle.  They are a modern extension of the idea of Manifest Destiny, but we can look back with historic detachment upon those two words and their underlying beliefs with some distance and disapproval, whereas most today have no such perspective on the rigidity and staunch Faith wrapped up in the ideas of constant, ever-increasing Progress and economic Growth which most embrace today as unquestionable Truth.  Most today would not describe or accept a definition of these terms as “beliefs,” and don't accept that there is any way around the harm being done to the planet, if an alternative meant an end to, much-less a reversal of, economic growth or constant technological Progress.  Just as slavery seemed inevitable, normal and was justified in its time and context, continuing extraction of millions of barrels of substances which contribute to making the planet unfit for living things currently alive on the planet, possibly including our own species, is not seen as negotiable.  Even those who “oppose fossil fuels,” many of us, most of us, still drive cars, fly in planes, use roads and plastics and heat our homes using the energy of burned carbon.  We still use and require money, work in jobs to earn that money, and use the resources our culture and its stories make available to us, day-to-day, minute by minute.
It really hit me how influential these underlying stories are, how entwined they are with the actions, beliefs and routines of our lives.  We live IN our stories; our stories PREVENT us from taking different courses of action, however much we might oppose the harm done by those very actions.  Another aspect of story-centrality to how we relate to (or fail to) the consequences of living-out these stories is that, for those of us opposed to the idea of imposing these consequences on our children and those yet-unborn (much-less ourselves, already, Now), a consistent way to see the problems and their consequences is in terms of an Evil Enemy who is responsible and must be opposed, must be stopped.  We must Fight, we must Battle, we must Oppose the forces of Evil!  Whether we see corporate CEOs as evil, or politicians (or politicians of the Other party), or oil companies, or chemical or agribusiness or banking and finance companies; whether Wall Street or Hollywood or the Military Industrial Complex or Organized Religion—when we portray any or all of these Others as those Responsible, as those inhuman, callous and self-interested enough to have Caused the problems we wish didn't exist, we create the aggressive, dualistic, oppositional energy which tends merely to exacerbate existing problems, and which fails to take into account the mirror.  Enemies are central players in all conventional stories; battling and overcoming enemies is the way we see “our” stories—it is, though, an important reason we new new types of stories, in which endless conflict and blame and scapegoating are not the pervasive features, ineffective in laying-out new paradigms which will be necessary to have a chance of moving beyond current culture’s destructiveness.
A lifelong creative, with hands-on experience and university/ professional-level training in numerous forms of art and performance, my most consistent, lifelong creative outlet and through-line has been my love of writing.  My university BA is in English; I have written poetry since high school, consistently; I have written a one-act play which has been performed in America and at the Edinburgh Festival in Scotland; I have written multiple feature-length screenplays, one of which was independently produced; I have written and self-published a book on alternative education. 
I have also written stories, and written a few individual episodes of memoir—but over the years, I had only glanced ("too busy!"—aren't we all?) at the notion of writing a novel. 
I didn't kid myself that writing one novel was going to “save the world”—but my epiphanies about the centrality and pervasiveness of our culture’s stories to how we see, and crucially, to how we act in and upon the world, made me realize that I wanted to intentionally write with New Stories, New Myths in mind.  I began writing the novel World of Wounds with this idea in place.  I didn't have a clear map of how  I would achieve anything new or groundbreaking, much less, as I could see was so necessary, anything transformative or transcendent of today’s Core Stories and underlying Myths—but I wrote with this lodestar in my mind’s eye, with the urgency I could feel to my core about salvaging the beauty and privilege of life on this planet.  I created five unrelated characters, and followed them on journeys physical and interior which led each eventually to participate in a movement which echoes that practiced today by permaculturists, eco-villagers, homesteaders, founders of Transition Towns and many others who have made a priority of local self-sufficiency, eco-logical practice and priorities.  I finished and self-published the completed draft of the novel at the beginning of 2015, not seeing it as a perfect expression of the type of New Myths I could clearly see our culture needs, but confident inasmuch as the characters and stories unfolded authentically, and expressed what I was capable of communicating along the lines of the kind of New Story I had envisioned.  I enjoyed writing the interwoven stories, seeing how the characters and their journeys came together from very disparate starting-points to a common cause and forming the first seed, sprouting in the course of the stories’ unfolding, of a New (and Ancient) way of seeing and being on/with the earth.  It is certainly my hope that others find inspiration and enjoyment in the unfolding stories of the novel, in the characters’ growth and obstacles, mistakes and challenges, and where they arrive by the novel’s end.
The year since publishing World of Wounds last winter has been an inspiring whirlwind.  My own international network of fellows informed and concerned about the above issues and much more grew rapidly, and I began to get to know a number of those I found myself most admiring.  By May, I was being interviewed by KMO for The C-Realm, probably my favorite podcast and the "place" I first heard and learned about Charles Eisenstein among many of my favorite writers and thinkers.  Soon after that interview, I attended a day-long New Story conference featuring Charles Eisenstein and another favorite writer and podcaster, Chris Martenson, and met both of them and many other amazing, committed individuals treading this urgent path.  I was honored when I contacted Adebayo, whose writings and speaking I had first run-across through its affinity with those of Charles Eisenstein, and Bayo had responded directly and very personally right from the outset.  I developed a similar correspondence and friendship-from-afar with Jason Hine, whose insightful Facebook posts regularly impressed and pierced me, shaking me into presence and open compassion in the midst of the urgency of these times.  My own intuition and disposition led me to embrace the notion that There Is No Enemy-- Jason's writing challenges me to consistently renew this realization, and examine my own intentions and flaws in the face of the temptation to blame, complain, "force" solutions or identify scapegoats.  Shahbano's poetry was introduced to me by a Rmala al'Aalam, fellow-member of the exceptional More Beautiful World Facebook group, an international online community whose title and premise are rooted in Eisenstein's most-recent book The More Beautiful World Our Hearts Know is Possible, and a forum where Adebayo and Jason post regularly.  Rmala is a Pakistani woman who is designing the New Myths Press website and is a passionate contributor to forwarding the mission of NMP.  She knows Shahbano and her poetry, and recommended it to my attention.
I don't believe that New Myths Press is alone or unique in identifying the degree to which the stories today's culture propagates and tells itself, stories of constant Progress and Endless Growth, are an important and inextricable root cause of the destruction being wreaked upon this planet's living systems and, potentially, it's ability to support life.  We certainly need more venues attempting to identity the new and ancient, existing stories which preserve and exalt life, see the sacred privilege of life as more essential than profit or domination, "Progress" and ever-growing "resource" extraction at the expense of ecosystems and the biosphere.

We Need New Stories.

New (Ancient) Paradigms of Thinking and Living Upon this One Survivable, Precious Planet.

For A Future.

story:
I am Tomás Loyola Barberis. Among other things that define me professionally, I’m a journalist and a writer. I am also gay. Being gay is an irreplaceable part of my life, of who I am. However, for a long time I wished to run away from myself and from my feelings. I locked myself in a dark place, where I remained until my thirties.

Yes, I came out of the closet as an adult man at age 33. I did this through a letter I sent to my parents explaining everything I felt. You can read it here: http://www.comingoutcampaign.com/blog/open-letter-from-a-gay-to-his-parents.

I had started this letter approximately 3 years before deciding to send it. For a long time, I continued to correct it, edit it and save it among my drafts, trying to find the courage to click Send. I pictured myself a thousand times in every possible scenario I could think of, thinking: “What if...”. None was ever as great, warm or welcoming as what I experienced with my family.

Through the letter, I was able to come to terms with myself and my family, my world and my feelings. Today, 6 years on, I can confirm this was the best decision I ever made in my life. On top of this, in this time I married a wonderful man and today I can stand proud and say that I’m gay out loud, without fear. This is a picture of our wedding!


Why am I launching this campaign?

Given the current situation of both the countries that I follow the most on the news (one being my country of origin: Chile; the other, the one I live in: Spain), I realize that there is still much work to be done regarding the rights of the LGBT community: equal marriage, civil partnership, inheritance and other rights.

More importantly, there is still much work left to be done in society to eradicate LGBTphobia and any manifestation against a person’s sexual identity, regardless of where they live. I guess this holds true for most parts of Latin America and Spain, in spite of the progress made until now.

According to the study “I won’t play this game” carried out by NGO Save the Children, presented in Spain in February 2016 and which collects bullying figures according to students across the Spanish territory, students who bully others justify their actions using, among others, the following reasons: 9.3% do so due to their victim’s race, culture or religion, while 8.6% do so based on their victim’s sexual identity and related issues.

21 men was been harassed and beated in the last 6 weeks just because they're gay... only in Madrid! And a few years ago, a young man was tortured and killed in Chile just because he loved men. We need to stop this!


What are my goals?

There are mainly three:

  • Publishing a book that presents other experiences like mine. My aim is for these stories to become social references for present and future generations, facilitating with this the process of coming out and acceptance of oneself and from the people around us.
  • Creating a website which also reflects these stories. The site will be used as a space for information and exchange between girls, boys, teenagers and young adults as well as mothers, fathers and tutors.
  • Opening an interactive exchange space where LGBT issues can be addressed from different perspectives, with an educational and awareness-raising purpose.


Therefore, the money collected will be used to:

A. Research and gather stories of men and women, their experiences, their fears and their certainties, once their coming out process has taken place. Through this, the idea is to recognize common experiences and, also, to inspire readers in their own processes. (0 euros)

B. Edit, design and publish a book with these stories, in print and as an eBook. The aim is to reach as many people as possible and to present valuable material that will help us develop a more open and fairer society. (3.000 euros)

C. Create a website with all the material gathered and also to open interactive channels with the audience addressed: girls, boys, teenagers and young adults as well as mothers, fathers and tutors. (2.000 euros)

D. Carry out continuous actions in the field of education, from Primary Schools to Universities, in order to: (1.500 euros)

    - Equip students with the tools necessary to avoid and fight harassment of any type, especially in regard to sexual identity.

    - Equip teachers with an understanding of bullying and cyberbullying and techniques to detect, identify, mediate and intervene in such situations.

    - Equip parents and guardians with guides to be used in the family sphere, making it possible to detect cases of harassment and eradicating them through educational activities that can be carried out at school and at home.


E. Work closely with other persons, organizations, foundations, associations, NGOs and local institutions whose projects or programs are related to the work we wish to carry out with the Coming Out Campaign. (0 euros)


The earlier we can gather the money projected for this campaign, the sooner I can get started with the project. Your contribution is very important to help avoid further victims of harassment based on sexual identity, whatever form the harassment takes. It will also help to avoid traumatic experiences for the new generations in their coming out process. This is especially important at a time when LGBT freedom and rights are suffering setbacks.

This project means a lot to me. I believe that it is indispensable for us to open spaces for dialogue where experiences can be exchanged and to create visible role models for girls, boys, teenagers and young adults towards the future. However, we also need to raise awareness in society about the harassment and fear and what it means for so many men and women to live inside the closet. There is no better way to do this than by sharing the experiences of those of us who have already gone through this process.

Your support is absolutely necessary to kick-start and carry out this project. That is why any help will be rewarded, not only with our personal gratitude on a special page in the book but by making it possible for you to participate actively in the creation process and in disseminating and raising awareness about this work.

We need you!

www.comingoutcampaign.com

http://www.twitter.com/comeoutcampaign.com

http://www.facebook.com/comingoutcampaign

http://www.instagram.com/comingoutcampaign

 

Background experience & challenges

I'm a writer (3 books published and another one in editing process) and a journalist. I've coordinated and edited two multi-authors book for a NGO in the last 5 years.

In this project, I'm gathering stories from LGBT people from all around the world. It's hard to find people who want to commit and show their faces, but it's nice to know that are so many others who want to help me and contribute to this cause.
 
 

How could you help?

If you don't want to give us money, you could help us providing services as:

  • Book design
  • Website design
  • Telling your story
  • Sharing this campaign
  • Writing a post or an article about us
  • Social Media
  • Becoming an ambassador of our campaign

And so many more...!

according to students across the Spanish territory, students who bully others
justify their actions using, among others, the following reasons: 9.3% do so
due to their victim’s race, culture or religion, while 8.6% do so based on their
victim’s sexual identity and related issues.
21 men was 
been harassed and beated in the last 6 weeks just because they're gay...
 only in Madrid! And a few years ago, a young man was tortured and 
killed in Chile just because he loved men. We need to stop this!

What are my goals?
There are mainly three:

Publishing a book that presents other experiences like mine. My aim 
is for these stories to become social references for present and future 
generations, facilitating with this the process of coming out and 
acceptance of oneself and from the people around us. 
Creating a website which also reflects these stories. The site will 
be used as a space for information and exchange between girls, boys, 
teenagers and young adults as well as mothers, fathers and tutors. 
Opening an interactive exchange space where LGBT issues can be 
addressed from different perspectives, with an educational and 
awareness-raising purpose.



Therefore, the money collected will be used to:
A. Research and gather stories of men and
women, their experiences, their fears and their certainties, once their coming
out process has taken place. Through this, the idea is to recognize common
experiences and, also, to inspire readers in their own processes. (0 euros)
B. Edit, design and publish a book with these
stories, in print and as an eBook. The aim is to reach as many people as
possible and to present valuable material that will help us develop a more open
and fairer society. (3.000 euros)
C. Create a website with all the material
gathered and also to open interactive channels with the audience addressed:
girls, boys, teenagers and young adults as well as mothers, fathers and tutors. (2.000 euros)
D. Carry out continuous actions in the field of
education, from Primary Schools to Universities, in order to: (1.500 euros)

- Equip students with the tools
necessary to avoid and fight harassment of any type, especially in regard to
sexual identity.
- Equip teachers with an
understanding of bullying and cyberbullying and techniques to detect, identify,
mediate and intervene in such situations.
- Equip parents and guardians with
guides to be used in the family sphere, making it possible to detect cases of
harassment and eradicating them through educational activities that can be
carried out at school and at home.


E. Work closely with other persons, organizations,
foundations, associations, NGOs and local institutions whose projects or
programs are related to the work we wish to carry out with the Coming Out
Campaign. (0 euros)

The earlier we can gather the money projected for this campaign,
 the sooner I can get started with the project. Your contribution is 
very important to help avoid further victims of harassment based on 
sexual identity, whatever form the harassment takes. It will also help 
to avoid traumatic experiences for the new generations in their coming 
out process. This is especially important at a time when LGBT freedom 
and rights are suffering setbacks.
This project means a lot to me.
 I believe that it is indispensable for us to open spaces for dialogue 
where experiences can be exchanged and to create visible role models for
 girls, boys, teenagers and young adults towards the future. However, we
 also need to raise awareness in society about the harassment and fear 
and what it means for so many men and women to live inside the closet. 
There is no better way to do this than by sharing the experiences of 
those of us who have already gone through this process.
Your 
support is absolutely necessary to kick-start and carry out this 
project. That is why any help will be rewarded, not only with our 
personal gratitude on a special page in the book but by making it 
possible for you to participate actively in the creation process and in 
disseminating and raising awareness about this work.
We need you!
www.comingoutcampaign.com
http://www.twitter.com/comeoutcampaign.com
http://www.facebook.com/comingoutcampaign
http://www.instagram.com/comingoutcampaign
 
Background experience & challenges

 I'm a writer (3 books published and another one in editing process) and a journalist. I've coordinated and edited two multi-authors book for a NGO in the last 5 years.In this project, I'm gathering stories from LGBT people from all around the world. It's hard to find people who want to commit and show their faces, but it's nice to know that are so many others who want to help me and contribute to this cause.
  How could you help?
If you don't want to give us money, you could help us providing services as:
Book design
Website design
Telling your story
Sharing this campaign
Writing a post or an article about us
Social Media
Becoming an ambassador of our campaign

And so many more...!

story:
The Project

What would happen if someone was kidnapped and forced to participate in a game of chess where she isn’t a player, but a piece? Where the board that she’s playing on isn’t a chessboard but a wilderness, filled with...unique...challenges of the wild designed to destroy those be played? This is the story of Bailey in Checkmate.

This story will be the springboard of many other stories that are all connected in an expanded universe of fantasy-adventure - The Tales of the Danann.  If I can reach my goal funds then I'll be able to pay for: 

  • Professional editing, 
  • Professional illustrations 
  • Marketing 
  • Printing, and distributing. 
Any and all extra proceed will be used for the sequel, Dream Rider.

My one concern with this project is traction. What if the book doesn’t gain as much traction as it needs to be considered a success? That is why all of the funds will go to marketing and promoting to help ensure that I can get the traction needed to get the ball rolling on my long-term writing goals.

What You Get

All contributors will be acknowledge on my website and Facebook page. Also, contributors to this project will get their own copy of Checkmate on electronic file and for those contributing a bit more will get either paperback or hardcover copies - all signed. These will be exclusive, 1st edition books that will not be regularly distributed to the market once the book takes off.

Those who get the hardcover perk will receive a letter of gratitude written personally by myself on my trusted typewriter - I do 90% of my writing on my typewriter, plus you'll know that it's a genuine letter of thanks and not a form letter copied and pasted. ;) 

Higher donations will also include chances to contribute to upcoming stories with character suggestions and exclusive previews of the entire hidden epic Tales of the Danann, visits with me and my writing partners, and I’ll even come and visit as a guest speaker to youth groups or schools.

Why This Story

There are a lot of great stories for children to read out there in the market. However, I’m noticing a frightening trend that audiences are gravitating towards stories that lack in morals, character, values, and overall appropriateness. Where are the good stories that are wholesome and fun, without the use of sex, profanity, and extreme violence? Being a new father, I want my family to know that they can find good clean entertainment in books. I hope to make a significant contribution to this by publishing my books.Checkmate will be the first of many books that I intend to write that will be simple, fun, and family appropriate.

Wanna Check It Out?

If you want to see exactly what your getting, click HERE for a free download of the first five chapters!!!! ;)

Also, to give you some assurance, check out these screenshots of actual reviews of readers who have read the whole story. ;)


Our Thanks

In actuality, any and all help given will be greatly appreciated, and I would be eternally grateful for all of it. So, to those who have contributed, who will contribute, and who will help in many other ways, from me and my family, I’d like to say thank you, so very much.

story:
• New Amsterdam was merged into New Jersey instead of becoming New York?
  • Freed slaves were given the state of Mississippi after the Civil War?
  • Aaron Burr succeeded in invading Mexico?
  • Joseph Smith and his religious followers settled in Jackson County, Missouri?

If you thought America was was strange this year, you ain't seen nothing yet. Join us as our all-star roster of science fiction and fantasy authors explore the frontiers of over a dozen different lands, in…


Russ Colchamiro, Peter David, Keith R.A. DeCandido, Debra Doyle & James D. Macdonald, Brendan DuBois, Malon Edwards, G.D. Falksen, Michael Jan Friedman, David Gerrold, Robert Greenberger, Alisa Kwitney, Gordon Linzner, Sarah McGill, Meredith Peruzzi, Mackenzie Reide, Aaron Rosenberg, David Silverman & Hildy Silverman, Ian Randal Strock, Ramón Terrell, Anne Toole, and Glenn Hauman as editor.

We the people have never been fully united states. We have had numerous divisions over the years— slave states and free states, dry counties and wet counties, urban and rural and that new beast suburbia, gold versus silver versus paper, cat people and dog people, Indians and Europeans, dirt farmers and robber barons, red states and blue states, gun nuts and gun grabbers, immigrants and nativists, Wall Street and Main Street, New England Patriots fans and everybody else. We argue. We fight. We’ve had insurrections, uprisings, and a civil war. And every time we speak of healing and unity and we come together, new divisions appear and we change again.

We want to show you how we could have gone other ways, how we could have been very different than what we are-- yet still be America.

For $2, you'll be listed as a Founding Father (or Mother, as the case may be) for helping to form a more perfect Union.
For $3 EARLY BIRD SPECIAL!  For the first 20 people, you can get an eBook of Altered States of the Union for only $3!

For $5, you get an eBook of Altered States of the Union, and you'll be listed as a Founder. EARLY BIRD SPECIAL! For the first 20 people, you can get an eBook of Altered States of the Union for only $3! (Yes, we're taking a haircut on the deal.)

For $25, you get a paperback and eBook of Altered States of the Union, and you'll be listed as a Founder.

For $40, you get a hardcover and eBook of Altered States of the Union, and you'll be listed as a Founder.

For $50, you get 4 paperback copies and an eBook of Altered States of the Union, and you'll be listed as a Founder. (Ideal for retailers.)

For $75, you get 3 hardcover copies and an eBook of Altered States of the Union, and you'll be listed as a Founder. (Even more ideal for retailers.)

For $200, you'll be written into history! Our authors will write you into a story. You'll also get a hardcover and eBook of Altered States of the Union, and you'll be listed as a Founder. There are limited spaces available, and will be first come, first served.
And an early bird special! The first 100 contributors will get a sneak preview story emailed to them in advance of the release of the book.

Altered States of the Union will be debuting at the Shore Leave convention on July 15th, 2016— yes, the book's coming out the weekend before the Republican National Convention. Won't that be fun? Copies of the book will be mailed out shortly thereafter, if you're not at the show to pick it up and get autographs in person.

We're taking pre-orders to finance our printing costs and spread the word. As we hit various goals, we'll be adding additional stories to the book and generally passing along more money to the contributors— all proceeds after production and distribution costs go to the people whose work drew you to the book in the first place— which, after all, is how it should be.

What are the risks for backing it?

As mentioned above, we have this convention this July we're locked into. (If you're a Republican or a Democrat, you might know how it feels to be locked into a convention this July.) But the stories are in, and barring an act of God, we should make the convention and mail out the books shortly after.

And, of course, you might find a version of America you like better.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Harun Rabbani and I am a mentor, a transformational leader and an award-winning trainer and professional speaker. I've been immersed in social and professional relationship-building since I was 12 working for my dad. Since then, I've worked in the corporate arena, and have been running my business since 2003. I've also been an active campaigner for several humanitarian projects and charities. 

In 1998, I started my personal development journey and years later interviewed hundreds of some of the world's leading experts in the human potential movement. This has led me to conclude that, ultimately, our greatest success, happiness and fulfilment come from meaningful relationships. 

Therefore, I began writing a book on this topic called "The Influencer's Handbook". It is about how to build inspired, influential and impactful relationships with the people who matter most to you. I call those people your "tribe". 

As well as exploring the psychology of influential relationships, "The Influencer's Handbook" takes a deep dive into the energetic dynamics into meaningful relationships. What causes relationship breakdown and what brings people together into trusting relationships?

Your contribution will ensure the success publication, launch and promotion of "The Influencer's Handbook" both in the UK and internationally.

What We Need & What You Get

Our first goal is to raise £5,354 will pay for the book to be published by professionals. This money will pay for:

  1. Professionally publishing the book (includes proof-reading, editing, book cover design etc).
  2. Circulating the book to a massive network of distributors globally.
  3. Making the book available on all major online retail units. 
  4. Publicity through social media campaigns. 
  5. A highly publicised book launch in London. 

You have two unique sets of perks to suit different budgets.

1. Investors - £100: This will reap you the following benefits:

  • 1 signed copy of "The Influencer's Handbook"
  • 1 copy of "The Influencer's Handbook" audiobook
  • VIP Invitation to the London book launch (or livestream of the launch)
  • 50% discount off The Influencers' Gathering (live event) in 2019

2. Pre-Orders - £25: The benefits include:

  • 1 signed copy of "The Influencer's Handbook"
  • Invitation to the London book launch 
  • 25% discount off The Influencers' Gathering (live event) in 2019

Should the goal of £5,354 not be attained, then all the available funds will still go into the project. We may have to curtail the paid publicity campaign. 

The Impact

As a contributor, you hare helping impact on thousands of lives. Here are some of the reasons why the content of "The Influencer's Handbook" is so vital to helping people:

  • It will help organisational leaders (CEO's, directors, etc) significantly increase their employee and customer engagement
  • New emerging leaders will accelerate their capability to inspire, influence and impact the people, the planet and themselves. 
  • Readers will be able to increase the richness of their relationships with families and friends. 
  • Give courage and confidence to people who are feeling isolated and alone. 

This is my fourth publication in which I am using my real life experience of transforming thousands of lives to reach out to a much wider audience. I am a firm believer that books can inspire people to change lives. This book will also give tools for people to impact on other lives.

Risks & Challenges

The greatest risk is not being able to write the book. The good news is that I have nearly completed writing the first draft. There is also the issue of finding a reputable publisher. I've known Mindy Gibbins-Klein, CEO of Panoma Press for 15 years. Her track record of publishing non-fiction books is outstanding. She is also an active promoter of her writers and their books. This gives me the confidence to employ her services for this important project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody can contribute financially. Right now, whether you contribute financially or otherwise, you can help by sharing this campaign through social media and directly to your most trusted contacts. 

Thank you for all your help! 

Harun Rabbani

story:
Poo is essential

The earthworm knows it, 

our garden knows it, 

the dog’s nose knows it and so do we, 

although it embarasses us to admit it. 

And yet, little by little, western society is lifting the taboo on poo.

The bestseller Who did this on my head? has proved that we can handle this topic with our children (who, by the way, have no hang-ups about poo.) Even the Guardian has recently run an article on how to poo during a first date. So even adults are allowing themselves to talk about it now. 

How far we’ve come. Or how far back around. The ancients also knew. Studying a king’s poo to gauge his health was a serious occupation long ago. And long before that, much longer, we came from dust. And that dust was nothing more than poo and a bit of sea water.

 

Poo is the story of our history

In Poo Earth and the Bone Moon, a dog recounts the story of our pooey origins. From deep in the seas, we emerged. So far, we know that story. But how we emerged and how humans came to be, well, that’s a story that only a dog, some cats, a zebra, a mammoth and a snake can tell you. 

And if you can’t believe your ears, see for yourself. The lively documentary illustrations of Laetitia Bermejo will convince you of their truth.

And if you’re still not convinced of this strange tale of our origins, read it again and simply enjoy  the absurdity of it all. 

This story is as much meant to delight 5-7 year olds as it is meant to loosen up the adults who have grown too constipated for their own good.

Remember, in the end, all is poo.

 

The Story of our Poo Earth is now a book

36 Pages. Color illustrations.

Illustrated by Laetitia Bermejo. Painter and multimedia artist. Illustrator of the Tortoise Diaries and various books by Tahir Shah, Christian McEwan among others.

Written by Serafine Klarwein. Mother, writer and multimedia artist and producer. Writer for Night Magazine and the blog The Secret Life of Echoes.

story:
Short Summary

This is the story of a woman who spent her life fighting an uphill battle against a man's world that wanted to own her. It's the story of the origins of feminism, journalism, and the prison system in the U.S. It's as relevant as ever today, and needs to be told. 

I'm turning Ann's story into a film, so of course, before doing that, I need to write a script. Since this is a true story, and has been obscured by history, I've been doing meticulous research to get it right. I've reached the point where continuing my research means visiting archives and libraries, and to do so I will need funding. 

By supporting my research you will help me make this immensely important research trip happen, and enable me to focus on writing so I can submit this project for filmmaking fellowships and grants. 

What I Need & What You Get

I'm looking to raise $5K in total. $3K will cover the cost of a research trip, which is budgeted for flights, car rentals, food, AirBnBs (when I can't stay with friends), phone coverage overseas, and travel insurance. I plan to visit Washington DC, Philadelphia, Syracuse, and New York City. $2K will cover cost of living expenses for 2-3 months so I can focus on writing. I've spent the last year working on this project every second I've had, but at this point I need to spend some time without a day job taking away time and energy, so that I can prioritize this project. Essentially I'm asking supporters to contribute to a self-made writing grant. 

To show my gratitude for your support, I want to offer the following rewards: 

$5  ---- An individual thank you email!

$10 ---- The above, plus a social media shoutout during my research trip!

$15 ---- The above, plus a postcard from my research trip!

$30 ---- The above, plus a souvenir from my research trip, mailed to you!

$50 ---- The above, plus an original print of one of my photos (you can choose from my website)!

$100 --- The above, plus a poem written uniquely for you, by me, in the style of early 19th century American poetry! 

Even if I don't reach my goal, any funds raised will go towards the research trip. 

The Impact

I've never been as passionate about a project as I am about this script. This story is so relevant today, and even though I see it as a hilarious period-piece comedy, it's also a startlingly relevant commentary on our own era. Sometimes the best way to look at ourselves is to do it through the lens of someone else's life. The internet has been massively helpful in letting me access documents, books, and people who have helped this project take shape. What I need your help with now is to dive into archives to connect the final dots and overturn the final stones. 

Risks & Challenges

Ann's story hasn't been preserved very well. She left a short autobiography and  a couple of trial transcripts, and that's about it. Although I hope to track down information on friends and lovers she had, as well as a portrait of her that has gotten lost over the years, historical research like this is always a gamble. I may spend weeks traveling the East Coast and looking through centuries old volumes only to barely find anything. I'm prepared for this, and also feel that in order to do this script justice, I need to have a clear idea of the limitations of character insights I have to work with. If nothing else, I will have the chance to spend time with a historian I've been in touch with, who has researched Ann, her life, and her time period extensively. I have archival experience and know exactly what I'm looking for, I just need to get to where it's being preserved, as most of the information I need is in old and fragile books and ledgers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's fine! Thank you for having a look at this page, and please share it with friends. Even just getting the word out gives this project a big boost!

Short Summary
This is the story of a woman who spent her life fighting an uphill battle against a man's world that wanted to own her. It's the story of the origins of feminism, journalism, and the prison system in the U.S. It's as relevant as ever today, and needs to be told. 
I'm turning Ann's story into a film, so of course, before doing that, I need to write a script. Since this is a true story, and has been obscured by history, I've been doing meticulous research to get it right. I've reached the point where continuing my research means visiting archives and libraries, and to do so I will need funding.
