story:
FAMILY, MENTAL HEALTH & POLTERGEISTS

Hotep, Good People!  I launched this campaign to take pre-orders for my first novel, The Basement.  Among other things - i.e. coach, entrepreneur, father, group exercise instructor, speaker, etc. - I teach Business Law, Constitutional Law, Criminal Justice and Political Science at a college in Northern Virginia.  As an author, I have already published three children’s books, a collection of poetry and a volume of essays exploring the social and political dynamics of being black in America.  In fact, this story sets the stage for a continuum exploring the various dimensions African American families.  What it means to be family … what it takes to keep a marriage or family or both together … the role of family in identifying and dealing with mental health issues … bonds of brotherhood and affection among black men are just some of the themes illustrated in these stories.  Plus, including The Basement, my upcoming novels span the genres of crime fiction, horror, thriller and science fiction.  It is going to be a fun and informative ride, and The Basement serves as the jump-off! 

The Basement tells the story of Greg Dennis whose deceased father-in-law returns as a poltergeist occupying the basement of Greg’s new home.  As a poltergeist, the father-in-law creates all types of havoc throughout the house, including stirring up dissension between Greg and his beloved wife, Drissa.  When the vengeful spirit's true plans come to light - i.e. namely returning to life by taking total possession of someone who resides in the house, Greg takes decisive action to end the haunting.  The Basement also touches on a subject that receives far too little attention, mental illness in the black community.  Millions of Americans face their own mental health issues or those of a loved one.  In Black America, discussing mental illness has long been considered taboo.  Hopefully, The Basement will make this subject just a little bit easier for all American families, and especially African American families, to bring out of the shadows and address as a family unit.  Just like “it takes a village to raise a child,” people facing the seemingly insurmountable challenge of living with a loved one who exhibits a pattern of behavior similar to the traits of a mental condition like borderline personality disorder truly need consistent support and affirmation from family members, friends and mental health professionals.  The Basement seeks to both entertain and inform its readers.


Plot Synopsis

Gregory Oyauma Dennis always wanted his own family.  More than anything, he wanted to prove he could transcend his parents failed marriage and give his own children what his parents could not or would not give to him, a home with both mommy and daddy.  The first time Greg laid eyes on Drissa Butler, he felt as though he were looking directly into his future.  In fact, the attraction between Greg and Drissa was more than immediately mutual, it was palpable.  Greg and Drissa fell hard and swiftly for each other.  Unfortunately, Drissa’s reverend father, Bishop Jab Butler, disapproved of Greg and Drissa’s relationship.  Greg’s perspective on life clashed with Bishop Butler’s teachings concerning the walk of a godly man.  By the time Greg and Drissa married, Bishop Butler developed Stage IV Lymphoma, and after years of an active ostracization campaign toward Greg within the family and the church community, Bishop Butler died.  Drissa seemed to take her father’s death the hardest.  In her mourning, Drissa began to feel her father’s presence in her home with Greg.  Drissa was not the only member of the Dennis household to feel the presence of the deceased bishop’s spirit.  When his daughter began to report late night visits from PaPa, Greg realized that perhaps the bishop’s presence might be more than a simple perception.  No sooner than Greg came to this realization, the vengeful poltergeist transformed the basement of Greg and Drissa’s home into a portal to the spiritual plain.  When the spirit of Bishop Butler challenges Greg to a final confrontation for the hearts and possibly the souls of Greg’s wife and daughter, Greg realizes that he may have to sacrifice himself to save his family. 


FINANCING THE FINAL STAGES OF THE RELEASE

All funds raised through this campaign will be used for the following. 

The Basement will be released on 7 August 2015!  Here is what needs to be done before that date:

1.  Manuscript needs to be submitted for final edit.

2.  The front and back cover for the paperback version still needs to be designed. 

3.  Register the manuscript with the US Copyright Office.

4.  Order the first round of printing.

In addition to what I need, here is what I would like to do:

1.  Hire a production company to create a book trailer.

2.  Host an official release party.

3.  Launch a four-city book tour - Chicago, Los Angeles, New Orleans and New York (For every $750 this campaign receives over the goal, I will add another city). 


PERKS, PRIZES & SPECIAL OFFERS

The primary focus of this campaign is to gain pre-orders for The Basement.  I am more interested in building excitement for the book than I am in making money in this stage of the game.  Making money is always nice, but I am looking at the long game right now.  Having said that, here’s what you get for supporting this campaign:

$3 Holla:  Maybe you don’t get into horror stories.  Perhaps you would rather wait for the release party or one of the tour events to meet me in person.  For whatever reason, you would rather support the campaign without receiving a book.  That’s Kool N’ tha Gang!  This contribution level comes with a thank you note, a book mark, your name on the Thank You’s page of my website and my quarterly newsletter, Old Skool Updates (which you can opt out of at any time.  Trust me; if you decide to opt out of the newsletter, I won’t take it personal … LoL). 

The Basement eBook:  In addition to the perks from the $3 Holla, you’ll get an eBook copy of The Basement in your choice of format (i.e. ePub, mobi, etc.) ahead of the release date.  That’s right!  Exclusive to this campaign, eBook pre-orders will be available on July 31st, a full week before the rest of the world can get it.

Special Edition The Basement eBook:  In addition to the perks from the $3 Holla, you’ll get an eBook copy of The Basement in your choice of format (i.e. ePub, mobi, etc.) ahead of the August 7th release date, plus a limited edition pdf version of The Basement with a special preview of the next segment of The Seven Sons of Chaos prequel, Worthless.  This sneak peek at Worthless will only be available through this Indiegogo campaign.  And, once this perk sells out, the preview will be gone forever.

Autographed Paperback:  In addition to the perks from the $3 Holla, you’ll get one paperback copy of The Basement personally signed by me.  Yes, I will personally sign each copy rather than sign a bunch of mailing labels and slap them to the inside cover.  Your copy of The Basement will be shipped to you on Friday, July 31st, which means you will get your copy ahead of the August 7th release date.

1 eBook + 1 Paperback:  In addition to the perks from the $3 Holla, you’ll get an eBook copy of The Basement in your choice of format (i.e. ePub, mobi, etc.) along with an autographed copy of the paperback version, both ahead of the August 7th release date.  That’s one copy to keep and one to share.  Or … you can keep both copies for yourself … LoL.

Book Trailer Sponsor:  In addition to all of the perks included with 1 eBook + 1 Paperback, you will be listed as an executive producer in the credits of the official book trailer for The Basement.  As an executive producer, you will also receive a link on my website.

Chicago Book Tour Sponsor:  In addition to all of the perks included with 1 eBook + 1 Paperback, you will be listed as the official sponsor for the book tour even to be held in Chicago.  As the sponsor, you will be entitled to the following:

1.  Recognition on all promotional materials concerning the event.

2.  A link on my website.

3.  An opportunity to make remarks at the event.

LA Book Tour Sponsor:  In addition to all of the perks included with 1 eBook + 1 Paperback, you will be listed as the official sponsor for the book tour even to be held in Los Angeles.  As the sponsor, you will be entitled to the following:

1.  Recognition on all promotional materials concerning the event.

2.  A link on my website.

3.  An opportunity to make remarks at the event.

New Orleans Book Tour Sponsor:  In addition to all of the perks included with 1 eBook + 1 Paperback, you will be listed as the official sponsor for the book tour even to be held in New Orleans.  As the sponsor, you will be entitled to the following:

Recognition on all promotional materials concerning the event.

A link on my website.

An opportunity to make remarks at the event.

NYC Book Tour Sponsor:  In addition to all of the perks included with 1 eBook + 1 Paperback, you will be listed as the official sponsor for the book tour even to be held in New York City.  As the sponsor, you will be entitled to the following:

1.  Recognition on all promotional materials concerning the event.

2.  A link on my website.

3.  An opportunity to make remarks at the event.

Release Party Sponsor:  In addition to all of the perks included with 1 eBook + 1 Paperback, you will be listed as the official sponsor for the release party to be held somewhere in the Greater Washington DC area.  Being that I live in Northern VA close to Manassas, the release party will likely be held somewhere in Manassas or Fairfax.  As the sponsor, you will be entitled to the following:

1.  Recognition on all promotional materials concerning the event.

2.  A link on my website.

3.  An opportunity to make remarks at the event.

4.  An article on posted to my primary blog, The Old School Journal, promoting your business, products or services.

5.  Two Additional eBooks + Two Additional Paperbacks.

International Shipping:  Please add $15 to the cost of your perk for any shipment to Canada or overseas.  Thank you.


STRETCH GOALS

Any funds raised through this campaign will be used to off-set the costs of the final release of The Basement on August 7th.  If the pre-order sells don’t go well, I will scale back the number of copies printed for the release date.  Additionally, the book trailer, release party and tour events are totally contingent on the success of this campaign. 

Having said that, I intend to add another tour stop for every $750 this campaign earns above the goal.  Moreover, if this campaign exceeds $8K, I will add a hardcover version to the mix.  If for some crazy reason the campaign exceeds $12K, I will produce an audio book version of The Basement.


RAISING AWARENESS

According to research psychologists Jean Twenge and Keith Campbell, approximately 6% of the US population suffers from narcissistic personality disorder.  When you consider that the people with the disorder generally come in contact with family, friends and co-workers, the impact of the disorder on American society increases exponentially.  The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM) describes narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) as a pervasive mental disorder characterized by the following symptoms (among others):  (a) a grandiose sense of self-importance (e.g. an expectation to be recognized as superior without corresponding achievements); (b) a general lack of empathy with regard to the feelings or needs of others; and (c) an envy of others or a distorted belief that others are envious of her or him.  Wider studies have concluded that 62% of people with NPD are men.  People suffering from NPD level various forms of mental abuse as well as attempts to exert emotional or, even, physical control over other people close to them including children, employees and spouses.  The abuse sustained from a narcissist present long-lasting traumatic effects on the victim.  In addition to physical abuse, victims of narcissistic behavior suffer a total loss of self-esteem.

Unfortunately, for many African Americans, psychotherapy remains taboo.  Many black Americans attempt to dismiss disturbing behavior patterns as undesirable personality traits rather than symptoms of a personality disorder.  Whether for themselves or a loved one, African Americans shun seeking treatment from a licensed mental health professional.  Using the example of a narcissistic father who becomes an entitled poltergeist, The Basement attempts to employ the technique of edu-tainment to draw correlations between abusive behaviors and personality disorders.  This book also seeks to destigmatize mental health services among African Americans. 


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

MAKE SOME NOISE!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Help me make some noise about this book:

1.  Post this campaign link on your Facebook page.

2.  Tweet about the book and the campaign.  If you shoot me an email about your tweet, I WILL RETWEET IT! 

3.  If you have a blog, I WOULD LOVE TO ALSO GUEST POST ON YOUR BLOG J.  I will also link your blog to one of my blogs in exchange for each shout out you give me.

4.  Invite me to speak to your book club via Skype or in person (Washington DC Metro).

I’m open to any other suggestions on how to generate interest in this book.  Please feel free to hit me up via my Indiegogo profile at A C Powell.


FAQs

Q:  When do I get my Perk?

A:  Each Perk has an Estimated Delivery month listed in description. You will be notified of any delays.

Q: Can I upgrade to another Perk?

A: Unfortunately, Indiegogo does not have a built in function for this. However, if you do want to upgrade to a higher perk level, we recommend that you simply donate the difference between your original payment and your desired new Perk level. Be sure to contact A C Powell via the contact user button on his profile so we can update your record.

Q: What if I forgot to add shipping for my Canadian or International order?

A: Similar to the procedure for Perk upgrades, we recommend that you make a separate payment to account for the missing shipping charges. Be sure to contact A C Powell via the contact user button on his profile so we can update your record. Shipping costs for US orders have been factored into the price for each perk. 

Q: I don’t see the update on my Indiegogo contribution profile after you confirmed my upgrade?

A: Unfortunately Indiegogo doesn’t allow us to update information for you or us, we’re tracking this separately and will make sure you get your proper perks and items, thanks!

Q:  Will any Perks go out before the Campaign is completed?

A:  Maybe.  We will cross that bridge when we get there.

scale back the number of copies printed for the release date.  Additionally, the book trailer, release party
and tour events are totally contingent on the success of this campaign.  
Having said that, I intend to add another tour
stop for every $750 this campaign earns above the goal.  Moreover, if this campaign exceeds $8K, I
will add a hardcover version to the mix. 
If for some crazy reason the campaign exceeds $12K, I will produce an
audio book version of The Basement.
RAISING
AWARENESS

According
to research psychologists Jean Twenge and Keith Campbell, approximately 6% of
the US population suffers from narcissistic personality disorder.  When you consider that the people with the disorder
generally come in contact with family, friends and co-workers, the impact of
the disorder on American society increases exponentially.  The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM)
describes narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) as a pervasive mental
disorder characterized by the following symptoms (among others):  (a) a grandiose sense of self-importance
(e.g. an expectation to be recognized as superior without corresponding
achievements); (b) a general lack of empathy with regard to the feelings or
needs of others; and (c) an envy of others or a distorted belief that others
are envious of her or him.  Wider studies
have concluded that 62% of people with NPD are men.  People suffering from NPD level various forms
of mental abuse as well as attempts to exert emotional or, even, physical
control over other people close to them including children, employees and
spouses.  The abuse sustained from a
narcissist present long-lasting traumatic effects on the victim.  In addition to physical abuse, victims of
narcissistic behavior suffer a total loss of self-esteem.
Unfortunately,
for many African Americans, psychotherapy remains taboo.  Many black Americans attempt to dismiss
disturbing behavior patterns as undesirable personality traits rather than
symptoms of a personality disorder. 
Whether for themselves or a loved one, African Americans shun seeking
treatment from a licensed mental health professional.  Using the example of a narcissistic father
who becomes an entitled poltergeist, The
Basement attempts to employ the technique of edu-tainment to draw correlations between abusive behaviors and
personality disorders.  This book also
seeks to destigmatize mental health services among African Americans.

story:
Short Summary

Texts from Mittens began as a column on Catster.com in 2013, and because readers fell in love with Mittens, the overly-dramatic texting cat, I created textsfrommittens.com later that year. Due to a quickly growing readership and requests from readers, Texts from Mittens became a book (Harlequin Nonfiction) on March 31, 2015. 

I've funded my own small book tour (here it is), with limited cities. Because readers have asked, and I've wanted to get out there, I want to expand the tour. My travel budget has hit its limit, so this is why I created this campaign.

Book Description:

Texts from Mittens is a series of text message conversations between a snappy, self-absorbed house cat named Mittens and his long-suffering human, a single woman who works away from home during the day. Mittens relentlessly hassles his human all day long, while only taking breaks to watch Judge Judy, hang with his best friend Stumpy, complain about the antics of Drunk Patty the neighbor, ask Grandma for money to buy useless items from QVC, and harass the "filthy beast" dog, Phil.


What We Need & What You Get

I polled the Mittens readers on Facebook about the cities they'd like to see included on an expanded tour, and ranked a list of proposed stops, based on popularity and cost-effectiveness (I don't require lodging or car rental at several of the stops). The amount raised will determine which stops are included, starting with no. 1. If I make the entire goal, all the stops will be added! If we exceed the goal, I'm open to adding cities.

Stops, by rank are:

1. Austin/Houston, TX

2. NYC and surrounding area 

3. St. Augustine/Tampa, FL

4. DC and surrounding area 

5. Phoenix, AZ

6. Seattle, WA

7. Chicago, IL/Detroit, MI

8. Atlanta, GA

The average for each trip is $1,000 -- some a little less, some a little more, depending on what's required at the stop.

  • Each trip includes airfare.
  • Some require car rental.
  • Some require a short hotel stay, but most include free lodging with friends or family.
  • Each trip includes applicable parking, public transportation fees, food, gas, and costs associated with events.
  • Each trip includes a donation to an animal rescue in each city (amount and rescues names TBD).

The trips will take place in the fall of 2015, between August and November -- actual dates and schedules are TBD. Again, the stops will happen according to amount raised and rank of stop on list. 

At this time, I'm scheduling US stops only. 

In addition to lots of additional stops to connect with Mittens readers, there are some cool perks available at each donation level.


The Impact

I'll get to meet Mittens readers from may areas of the country, visit, and sign books. This will be huge fun for me, and hopefully a good time for the readers as well!

Have little judge's robe, bags of nip, going-to-town shoes ... and willing to travel.


Recent Events -- Fun!

Here are some photos from recent signings and readings, which have been successful and well-attended. The expanded tour will include more of the same!


What People are Saying About Mittens


Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges all include whether or not we reach particular goals. If we don't meet the full amount, the tour schedule will include fewer cities.

The schedule will be like a puzzle, and I'll need to create event venues that will match travel plans. I'm confident I can do that because I'm ridiculously -- sometimes annoyingly -- organized. My husband will tell you.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, but want to help advance the cause, there are ways you can help!

Share this campaign page with your friends -- especially the ones who live in the target cities.

Like Mittens' Facebook and Twitter pages, and share them with your friends.

Keep reading and enjoying Mitty on his site and on Catster.com!

Buy the book.

Be nice to one another -- smiling and laughter goes a long way. Cheesy, I know, but you know it's true, and Mittens would want it that way. Probably.


Thank you! Mittens has the best fans ever! 

xoxo

Angie, Mittens, Mom, Phil, Stumpy, Drunk Patty, and Grandma

Also, Fiona, Twinkie, Rusty, and the UPS driver

story:
In 1963, a friend introduced me to Eric Fleming. At that time, he was considered the quintessential Western television hero. The role that made Eric famous was as the trail boss Gil Favor in Rawhide, which was the sixth highest rated TV show according to the Nielsen ratings. CBS presented Eric as the tough-minded trail boss with a cloaked caring side.  I lived in Manhattan when I met Eric, employed as a fashion model represented by the Ford Modeling Agency, and I performed as a showgirl at Lou Walters' Latin Quarter.

The story begins with Eric's childhood -- those horrible years when he was constantly and severely beaten by his misanthropic father.  In his late teens, Eric joined the Navy where his face was critically disfigured in a horrible accident. Next, I describe how Eric and I accidentally met on a blind date set-up by his Rawhide co-star Clint Eastwood.

In addition to information about our years living together and  becoming engaged, the factual tale culminates with his tragic and unnecessary death filming a movie on a tributary of the Amazon River in Peru. Attempting to meet budget constraints and to finish filming despite inclement weather, the movie's director decided to film the final scene in the Amazon River despite pleas from indigenous Amazonians that the formidable rapids weren't negotiable due to recent flooding. 

I didn't write the story with the intention of it being an official biography. Instead, this is the account of our three wonderful and inseparable years together. We encountered a myriad of unimaginable events that I describe in the story. Perhaps the truth about Eric will reverse the confident judgments made by journalists who never talked to Eric, and made up facts to suit their publications.

THE BOOK
To the public, Eric Fleming was a major television star. Unknown to his adoring fans was his life actually comprised a sequence of calamities that only a truly strong, rugged person could endure. To state his life's struggles resembled the biblical Job - one ordeal after another - would be an understatement. 

Eric Fleming: Death On the Amazon (DOA) presents my personal insights into a complex Hollywood star who treasured being an independent man liberated from the confines of the entertainment industry. He showed great moral courage throughout his career, swimming against the tide of his time regardless of what Hollywood rumormongers directed at him.  I constructed this novel based on a true story from the particulars in my diary. In addition, Eric kept a detailed memoir that I possess, which he maintained from a young age until the day of his death in Peru.

This book is not about the failings of film executives, or their greed or shortcomings. It's about Eric's persistence to achieve excellence and succeed despite the following events in his life:

1. Constant beatings throughout his childhood by his hated father,
2. Total facial reconstruction due to an accident in the Navy during World War II,
3. His financial calamity caused when all his savings from television and movies were embezzled by his business manager, and finally,
4. His death in Peru when shooting the rapids on a tributary of the Amazon River.

WHY DID I WRITE THIS STORY?
For decades, I've had mixed feelings about disclosing Eric's innermost thoughts delineated in his journal. However, friends and relatives have made it clear that the world should know his life story, get rid of ill-informed rumors about him, and clarify the tragic details of his death. The world has changed greatly since Eric's death, and yet his inspiring courage against all odds is as powerful and meaningful today as it was in 1966. In fact, this book may be even more important today. Why? According to a November 2016 article from the Daily Mail, forty-three people have died while working on movie sets in the United States since 1990. The same report found that one-hundred and ninety-four serious film and television set accidents had occurred between 1990 and 2014. 

Even after Eric's death during filming, safety has often been a secondary concern for directors and production companies. In 1982, Vic Morrow's head was decapitated plus two child actors died during John Landis' filming of the 'Twilight Zone' movie. According to Ranker.com, eventually it came out that the children who died were going to be paid illegally under the table. Eleven years later, Brandon Lee (Bruce Lee's son) was killed during a scene in The Crow.

My real struggle was to explain the never-ending enjoyment Eric and I shared for the years we lived together, while not losing sight of the cost of the tragedies he constantly confronted.

The book will include a number of photographs from our private photo collection of our life in Hawaii and filming in Peru. In addition, I'll incorporate a few Hollywood style photos of Eric. Plus I've noticed there have been snapshots posted on the Internet (what isn't posted on the Internet?!?) that I might include.

Eric took nothing for granted. He understood the fragility of life; remembered his past as well as looked forward to a wonderful future with me in Hawaii. He took delight in the world and appreciated the incredible opportunities afforded him. To me he was always kind and encouraging. 

BOOK EDITING
I'm currently interviewing and negotiating with a number of elite professional book-editing services. Although I'm the author of DOA, I need a book editor to refine my manuscript so that it is ready for publishing. The editor will correct all grammar, spelling, punctuation, and syntax errors they find in the manuscript. My intention in hiring a book editor is to have them focus on every detail of my writing. Prior to publication, the editor will correct any factual errors, inconsistencies, or contradictions. Contingent upon their expertise and the task, estimates vary from $25,000.00 to $35.000.00 for editing service.

MARKETING
There's no business like show business, however it's necessary to tell the public of this book. Marketing is all about SHOW. I've completed most of the manuscript, and now I need to tell the world DOA will be available. Since I can't handle every aspect of publishing, I will retain a book-marketing firm to initiate a campaign to publicize DOA. While they accomplish that aspect of the business, I will take care of the more personable aspects like public appearances, bookstore visits, and readings. 

I feel fulfilled with joy that Eric's story will be expressed on paper, and on its way to being published. As a person who believes in expressing her emotions, I am grateful that you are helping make this happen! Great books tell persuasive stories, are powerful, and timeless. This book will live on much longer than any of us. And this is all because of YOU!

Funding publishing expenses:

1. Self publishing

2. Cover design

3. Editing

4. Formatting Book

5. Promotion 

6. Audio Books

 

Why I Chose to Self-Publish & Use Indiegogo 

I chose Indiegogo (after much thinking, research and subsequent careful campaign planning) to raise the money to self-publish Eric Fleming: Death On the Amazon (DOA). 

Self-publishing allows me complete creative control over the words, photographs, design, layout, marketing ... all of it! I am 100% committed to honoring the integrity of Eric's story, as well as spelling out the details of his death at the hands of an avaricious director.

The funds raised, with the help of supportive, generous backers as yourself, will go toward the printing of the hardcover books on 60-80 lb. paper (the book will have more than 10 pages of photographs). Standard 50 lb. paper will be used for paperback books.

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is it like to be high on marijuana? Can a cannabis high help to remember long gone events, to fuel your imagination, to work creatively, to come to introspective and other insights, and to empathically understand others? How much did cannabis inspire outstanding thinkers, artists and musicians like Charles Baudelaire, Rudyard Kipling, Walter Benjamin, Billie Holiday, Diego Rivera, John Lennon, Carl Sagan, Hal Ashby, and so many others? And how much did the marijuana high positively transfom our society?


Hello Indiegogos.

My name is Sebastian Marincolo. I am a freelance writer and photographer with a doctorate in the philosophy of mind and have researched the positive potential of the marijuana high for more than ten years. I have almost completed writing a manuscript of my third book, "What Hashish Did To Walter Benjamin - Mind-Altering Essays on Cannabis" (in English),  a collection of 20 neurophilosophically inspired essays on the astounding positive potential of the cannabis high. My essays are written for a wide audience and first appeared in five languages and in shorter versions on my expert blog for the Dutch marijuana seed bank Sensi Seeds  (2013-15). I discuss why a high can be used to enhance various cognitive processes and abilities, such as to better retrieve distant memories, to focus one's attention, to better recognize patterns, to intensify sensations of all kinds, to enhance imagination, introspection, as well as to enhance empathic understanding, our ability to come up with spontaneous insights, and to personally grow.

On the basis of my research, I have also investigated how the marijuana high has positively affected famous thinkers, artists, musicians, and others to come to a better understanding how marijuana has inspired them – and through their work, our society as a whole. Briefly, I am aiming to show that the marijuana high offers a whole spectrum of enhancements which have been used by myriads of people with a deep positivce impact on our society. I am hoping that my book helps marijuana users, scientists as well as medical professionals from various areas to better understand the positive potential of the marijuana high. This understanding could help millions of users to avoid abuse and risks and to positively use marijuana in a more meaningful way -  for medical, inspirational, as well as recreational purposes.

My new book has important implications for some medical uses of marijuana, such as the role of cannabis for autistic children and, also, possible roles of cannabis in psychotherapy, personal development, and healing. I am also hoping that my book can help to change our society's perspective on the role of marijuana (and other psychoactive substances like LSD and ayahuasca) in the history of mankind. I am deeply convinced that we need to legalize and regulate marijuana. Only a sane, informed, and liberal approach towards the potential of mind-altering substances will help us to end the mislabelled "war on drugs" - which really is a highly irrational military repression of a subgroup of users of some kinds of psychoactive substances. My mind-altering essay on this mind-altering plant are written to help us all to find our way back to a world worth living in.


From the Index

Part I:  Turn On

1. Cannabis, Mind Enhancements, and Culture                                                                         2. Just Another Altered State of Consciousness                                                                        3. Marijuana, Dopes, and Cognitive Enhancements                                                                 4. GUINEA – A Guerrilla-Neurophilosophical Approach to High Science


Part II:  Tune In

5. The Zen-Effect of Marijuana                                                                                                        6. Marijuana and the Enhancement of Episodic Memory                                                        7. Marijuana and The Power of Imagination                                                                               8. Marijuana and The Slowdown of Time Perception                                                               9. What it Means to be 'High'                                                                                                           10. The Effects of Marijuana on Body Image Perception                                                      11. Marijuana, Empathy, and Severe Cases of Autism                                                            12. Marijuana, Reading, and Language Understanding                                                        13. Marijuana and Creativity - A Love Story                                                                                 14. Personal Transformation with Marijuana


Part III:  Inspire 

15. Vipers, Muggles, and The Evolution of Jazz                                                                        16. What Hashish Did to Walter Benjamin                                                                                    17. Carl Sagan, Cannabis, and The Right Brain Hemisphere                                                   18. The Most Powerful Drug Used by Mankind                                                                          19. An Unusual Argument for the Legalization of Marijuana 


Appendix  

20. Vaporizer Highs 

__________________________

For more information about me and my work please take a look at my brand new personal blog  www.marijuana-insights.com. You can also find some of the essays there which will go into the new book.


What the money is needed for

As you may imagine, my research focus did not quite resonate with governmental research institutions. Despite my academic credentials and support from many highly valued experts I had to finance my research and writing myself over the past ten years and now ask your help to be able to self-publish this book. Based on my previous experience with self-publishing and the advice of many other authors here is a list of my estimated costs:

  • content editing and proofreading: US$ 1100
  • cover design, layout, production: US$ 950
  • formatting and digital conversion: US$ 400
  • ISBN: US$ 130
  • PR + online marketing services: US$ 750
  • books + shipping costs for free copies for PR-distribution US$ 400
  • Indiegogo fees 5%: approx. $ 270
  • 3 weeks writing/editing/project management time: $ 1500

Great Value Perks

I offer a lot of other interesting perks, such as of course the digital copy and the print version of the book including naming you as supporter, but also counseling and consulting sessions, as well as workshops! Also, for my previous book "High", published by one of the most renowned publishing house in Germany (Klett-Cotta/Tropen), I have produced my own limited macro art photo series "The Art of Cannabis" with deep focus fusion technology. Some of my perks include e-postcards of this photo series (postcards, posters).


A word of caution

I am fully aware that marijuana use also brings risks and has an abuse potential. Many people abuse marijuana and have entered into a problematic relationship with it. However, I think that we need more focused research on its positive potential and that my book can also help people to refrain from abuse and to come to a more healthy relationship with cannabis.


Share on Facebook

Worldwide, people are beginning to acknowledge the positive potential of cannabis. Philosopher and writer Sebastian Marincolo has written a new book "What Hashish Did To Walter Benjamin" in which he explains how a cannabis high can help to remember long gone events, to fuel your imagination, to work creatively, to come to insights, and to better empathically understand others. His book also sheds light on how cannabis has helped writers, philosophers, musicians, and artists like Walter Benjamin, Carl Sagan, or Billie Holiday in their work. Help him spread the word and support his Indiegogo campaign:
http://igg.me/at/what-hashish-did-to-walter-benjamin

Tweet

Help writer and cannabis researcher Sebastian Marincolo to publish his book "What Hashish Did To Walter Benjamin". Indiegogo campaign at http://igg.me/at/what-hashish-did-to-walter-ben...

Thanks so much in advance for your help!


Praise for my previous work

“Sebastian Marincolo’s work is terrific and is going to make a big contribution to the field.”

Lester Grinspoon, medical marijuana expert and Harvard Associate Prof. Emer. for Psychiatry

“I’m loving it! Wow. What an amazing, important work! Your book is such a treasure – a unique resource. Such a definitive statement of everything I’ve been thinking when it comes to marijuana … I now understand the benefits that Norman Mailer, Carl Sagan, and Richard Feynman got from Marijuana.”

Jason Silva, filmmaker, gonzo journalist and founding producer/host for Current TV, the Emmy winning cable network started by Al Gore

“Marincolo’s research on the marijuana high is years ahead of others working in this field”

Joe Dolce, former editor-in-chief of Details and Star magazines. He is writing a book, as yet untitled, about the new world of cannabis.

“Marincolo’s writing and manner of thinking are excellent – I am enthusiastic about recommending his work.”

Michael Backes, marijuana expert and author of „Cannabis Pharmacy – The Practical Guide to Medical Marijuana" 


Dedication

This book will be dedicated to my mentor and friend Dr. Lester Grinspoon, Harvard Assoc. Prof. Emer. for Psychiatry at Harvard Medical School and marijuana expert, who recently turned 87 .. Happy Birthday, Lester!

story:
About "Drops of A-"

So, recently I started writing a novel about a guy named Eric who lives with mental illness. He's been bullied during his life and even though he want to feel fantastic about finally being a grown-up everything seems to still hang on. Through the book we'll follow his life, from realizing there's a problem to finally seek help for it. How can you ever feel like you're awesome the way you are when your family sees it as a phase, you don't have any friends and the only way you can handle it is with a razor blade?

  • My name is Anders Hagström and I'm a lecturer in mental illness of teenagers. 
  • I live every day with OCD and anxiety and when I was younger I also used a razor blade to handle my feelings of not belonging anywhere.
  • As a contributor to this project you're investing in a future where this no longer is taboo. When contributing to this book you'll help young teenagers to not feel alone and to finally live in a world where we see these problems and try to solve it.

What I Need & What You Get

  • To be able to make this project happen I need to collect $7000. $3000 will cover the cost for printing, indexing, proofreading and publishing. $1000 will cover the cost of translation from Swedish to English. $2000 will be used for travel expenses when marketing the book. I will try to get it out there in media, but they rarely pay for travel and living. $1000 is to keep a roof over my head as I finish the book.
  • You can read all about the perks on the left side. Remember, everyone donating $15 or more will get the book as an e-book.
  • If I don't reach the goal I will still try to make this book happen, but in a smaller scale. 

The Impact

When I were 14 and afraid of not being loved by my parents If I came out as gay I felt like sh*t. I thought I was completely alone in this world and that no one could understand what it was like to be me. To use a razor blade, just to be able to survive - I don't want any kid to feel like that. It's so important that we show the youth of today that you don't have to feel this way and that they're not alone. 

Risks

The biggest risk is that either finishing the book, the printing or something like that will procrastinate the release. If that would happen I'm going to inform you about it just as soon as I can.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're not able to contribute with money, please share this campaign to everyone you know. On Twitter, on Facebook or among your friends. Indiegogo have share tools, please use them and help me to make this project happen!
Thank you all for reading and for being a part of this!

story:
Who are we? What are we up to?

The 2015 Throw Slam Team is made of five poets. The best five poets. (From this year's competition season.) That's right, competitive poetry. We're headed to Saskatoon to represent Montreal at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word (CFSW) where we'll be competing against spoken word artists from across Canada in the national poetry slam championships.

Throw is currently the only team from Quebec going to nationals. Last year we made it all the way to the finals stage, so we're pumped up to be going back. Now we just need to get there.

Wait, what's a poetry slam?!

Spoken word poetry is all the feelings of normal poetry with 10 times more energy, +100 entertainment value, and a whole lot of important stuff to talk about. A slam is a competition where performers go head to head to see who has the best ideas, writing, and delivery. There's a lot of laughing, crying, yelling, and eerily silent dramatic pausing.

Why do we need your help?

We're going to need to take flight more than just metaphorically to get ourselves all the way to Saskatoon. Unfortunately Air Canada does not accept sick rhymes as a valid currency. Donations will go towards getting the team to nationals and giving us a place to stay when we get there.

What's in it for you?

Look slightly to the right. What's that??? It's... glorious poetry themed merchandise! We've got a lot of awesome stuff just waiting to get sent out into the world. Treat yourself to a present in the mail. Buy a haiku for a loved one and pretend you wrote it yourself. Have a poem composed in your name and refer to yourself as “a muse” for ever after. The possibilities are endless.

Meet the Team


Rabbit Richards’ performance poetry is written with precision and empathy to reach you at gut level. Her stories invite you to join her in her world and highlight the small details that evoke memory. A native of Brooklyn, New York, she currently calls Montreal home. Rabbit is the 2014 and 2015 Throw! Slam Champion and Team Captain. She is a member of the Kalmunity Vibe Collective and this will be her third time participating in CFSW.

Halogen is a poet, a performer, and maybe a human (probably not.) This is her third time competing at CFSW and this year she's coming for hugs and victory. Past exploits include co-founding Discordia Poetry Collective, being an editor for Soliloquies Anthology, and studying Creative Writing and Concordia University. Halogen hopes to be a plant when she grows up and would like to be your imaginary friend.

Anomaly was found in a tide pool and transplanted from the West Coast youth poetry scene. This will be her first year at CFSW, but she is a long time competitor in Victorious Voices, and in 2014 she captained a team at Hullabaloo, the BC youth slam competition. She is also a musician, teacher, activist, and plans to run away with a circus. Her hobbies include collecting strangers' shopping lists and sitting on refrigerators.

Simon Banderob is, in order roughly chronological and mostly alphabetical, an actor, author, director, playwright, podcaster, poet, storyteller, clown, itinerant landscaper and lumpenproletarian for all occasions. Simon was the one-time host of the Discordia Poetry Slam, a two-time member of the Throw! Poetry Collective’s slam team and has been inflicting his interpretation of spoken-word upon poetry slams in Canada, the USA and Germany. He is tickled pink to be going to CFSW this year, representing Montréal.

Esme is mostly made up of tea and soft light with enough flesh attached to be called a real person. Above all else she is a passionate  defender of and advocate for all of life’s beauty. This is her first year at CFSW and her first year with Montreal’s Throw Poetry Collective. You can normally find her laughing too loudly or tripping in public. Originally from Vancouver, she will always have the 49 latitude attitude but had to leave the forrest for a bit to find her roots, ironically.

Thanks for your help!

We'd love if you could share our campaign with your friends, enemies, and casual acquaintances.

 for all occasions. Simon was the one-time host of the Discordia Poetry 
Slam, a two-time member of the Throw! Poetry Collective’s slam team and 
has been inflicting his interpretation of spoken-word upon poetry slams 
in Canada, the USA and Germany. He is tickled pink to be going to CFSW 
this year, representing Montréal.Esme is mostly made up of tea and soft light with enough flesh 
attached to be called a real person. Above all else she is a passionate  defender of and advocate for all of life’s beauty. This is her first 
year at CFSW and her first year with Montreal’s Throw Poetry Collective.
 You can normally find her laughing too loudly or tripping in public. 
Originally from Vancouver, she will always have the 49 latitude attitude
 but had to leave the forrest for a bit to find her roots, ironically. 
  Thanks for your help!
We'd love if you could share our campaign with your friends, enemies, and casual acquaintances.

story:
MARKETPLACE OF FUTURE INSIGHT

I am what one might call a process philosopher. I hold a BSc in Applied Physics and a PhD in Sociology. My mind's eye is on the evolving needs of society. I study our world at the crossroads where the natural and social sciences meet. In The Next Scientific Revolution​, I argue that 'reality' emerges as webs of ‘recurring patterns of behavior’ that shape our society following predictable stages. 

This insight produced novel opportunities. This one is about creating a website that offers freelance analysts (journalists, consultants, etc.) an automated process to map the future of companies and nations and gauge their progress. As digital marketplace of such maps, this website helps improve our chances by fostering public awareness about society's developmental needs and hiccups.

The ability to anticipate and engage the future is what I once coined Future diligence. Future diligence is precisely what this website helps stakeholders across society achieve. Companies, investment firms, hedge funds, private equity concerns, recruitment firms, political parties, electorates and, last but not least, the public at large will all benefit from this website.

* Check research history here or this story in pictures here.

WHAT THE WEBSITE DOES

As surveys show, extrapolation-driven analyses are no longer sufficient:

  • the current credit rating model is reported to have massive flaws;
  • in 50% percent of the cases, mergers and acquisitions fail;
  • in 83% percent of the cases, merger and acquisition goals are not achieved;
  • algorithms that hedge funds use appear to fail since the financial crisis. 

The website that I hope to launch with your help offers a new way of scanning the future state of companies and nations by mapping rather than extrapolation. It helps analysts (contributors of maps) map the past and future of companies and nations by selecting their present and/or past stage(s) of development. Analysts substantiate the selection of a stage by linking it to press articles, papers, and video clips with evidence of the stage characteristics.

Once an analyst has completed a timeline of stages (and supporting links), the website produces a gamified map, which lets readers slide from stage to stage between past and future. To put stages in perspective, they are projected on a GDP- or share-price history, which is automatically collected when available. For each stage, a map highlights the success factors and leadership role (and whether the latter fits). Analysts can add their views such as on the duration of stages.

Readers can ask for a map of a company or nation or for a map update. Analysts can post their maps without readers asking for it. They may offer their maps either for free or for a small fee. If a small fee is involved, readers get access to a map after making a digital payment. The fee-per-map model is meant to foster a marketplace of future insight that is driven by supply and demand.   

Click here to visit the test website (yet to be rebranded).


WHO THE WEBSITE SERVES

The so-called 'Future-diligence' website will likely attract a broad readership:

  • Journalists may use the maps to put their reporting into a broader, developmental perspective for their readers;
  • Scholars may use the maps to unveil what really works during each stage for example by means of machine learning or Bayesian analysis;
  • Investors may use the maps to improve their investment portfolio by selecting companies that traverse a certain stage of growth;
  • Hedge funds may use the maps to identify imminent stage transitions so as to update their investment world timely;
  • Banks might use the maps to either evaluate client loan applications or optimize their loan tenders;
  • Private equity may use the maps to evaluate their acquisition options and shorten their path to exit;
  • Companies may use the maps to evaluate themselves, divisions, and partner companies to improve the fit of organizational strategies and leadership;
  • Recruitment firms may use the maps to evaluate the temporal needs of client companies and the ideal fit of candidates;
  • Political leaders may use the maps to decide their political goals and calibrate their election strategies.


CONTRIBUTORS OF MAPS

We expect scholars, consultants, journalists, and analysts from the financial services industry to become analysts (contributors of maps). To help them prepare the best maps possible, we will organize a brief (one- or two-day) seminar in the different geographies. For this reason, we intend to use a small part of the funds to develop and fan out a Future-diligence mapping course. Once the curriculum has been proven successful, we’ll organize a mapping course as webinar. 

OUR VISION

Although originally meant to cover the legal/moral responsibilities of organizations, Corporate Social Responsibility is rapidly emerging as precondition for success. 

Future-diligence mapping favorably affects our capacity to prevent hardship. It also offers new windows of opportunity and value add to stake holders. 

Our vision is that Future diligence (mapping) will emerge at the center of CSR. Eventually, we envisage it to become a legal requirement - like the due diligence. 

WHAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR

The funds will enable us to upgrade the test website by improving its user interface, by adding marketplace features (including a dashboard for analysts and readers), and by optimizing the system’s reporting features. 

The funds will also allow us to develop an analyst training course and to reach out to candidate analysts worldwide. We will establish ‘Future diligence’ as company - in the appropriate geography - as soon as we have achieved sufficient funding.


Note: The brighter the color of a wedge in the pie-diagram with the estimated allocation of funds below, the higher it is on our list of priorities. 

WHAT YOU WILL GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Donations of $ 50 USD and more 

As token of my/our gratitude, we will list you as distinguished contributing patron or patroness on the Future-diligence mapping website.

Donations of $ 150 USD and more

We will send you a copy of my book The Next Scientific Revolution with a personal dedication in addition to the previous perk.

Donations of $ 500 USD and more

We will send you a Future-diligence mapping training course voucher in addition to the previous two perks.

ADDITIONAL WAYS TO HELP 

  • Please share the URL of this crowdfunding page with your colleague students, scholars, and journalists and with everyone who might support the idea. 
  • You’ll find Future diligence on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn. Follow it, like it, and mention it to your friends so they can follow in your footsteps.
  • You want to get updates when I get started? Sign up for our mailing list through this link or scan the scan code below. Thanks for mentioning it to your friends. 

THANK YOU

Last but not least, thank you very much! By contributing to this initiative, you help society become a more accommodating and forward-looking place.   


QUESTIONS

Should you have any questions, please, write to me: question@futurediligence.com

story:
Why Support "Not THAT Kind of Christian: Loving God Without Being an A**hole"?

This book is primarily for the: 
  1. "Nones" (people who have never identified with religion), 
  2. "Dones" (people who have walked away from it), and 
  3. "Prodigal Sons" (people who are hanging in there or have come back to Church but don't feel like they really fit)
I'm in that group. Maybe you are too. If you're like me, you still think about God, What this Jesus person was about, and about big questions like why we're here, if we have purpose, and if there's something more to this universe than what we see. 
But because of personal experiences, media portrayals or all of the scandals involving Christianity, you just don't see yourself as "That kind of Christian." So you figure there's no room for you at all. No place to ask questions, go deeper, connect with something bigger than yourself.

People asked to complete the phrases, “God is ________” and “Jesus is _________,” most commonly offered words like “all-loving,” “compassionate” and “forgiving.” The same group, when asked to complete the phrase, “Christians are ________,” offered words like “judgmental,” “angry,” and “hypocrites.”

So if we Christians are supposed to reflect God and Jesus to the world, why are so many of us such jerks? And why do we come off as so...well, weird?

Sometimes we Christians take everything so seriously it's a real drag. So this book is done very much with tongue in cheek, but also with the intent of getting at some real truth. And sometimes the best way to move forward, change and grow is to be able to laugh at ourselves.

What's With the Subtitle?

Some people wonder why we have "profanity" in the subtitle. It's not for shock value or to seem overly edgy. It's because, over and over again, when I talk to people who don't identify as Christian what it is about Christians that bothers them, more often than not it's because we can be real a-holes. So let's name it, call it out, and really, honestly talk with each other for once?

Where did the Idea Come From?

One of the most inspiring, honest sermons was from my friend who started out by saying, "I'm a Christian because I'm an asshole." At that moment, a little light went on inside me. It's not that I need Jesus because of original sin or to save me from burning in hell. He's not a stamp on my celestial passport. 

But I can be a real schmuck. And once I have the humility to admit it, I might actually have something to learn from it. One of the biggest paradoxes, though, is when people mistakenly think that becoming a Christian makes them no longer be an a-hole; in fact, Christians who think they're somehow "fixed" are some of the biggest a-holes of all. Christianity (the religion) isn't a-hole insurance; in fact, sometimes it just makes us worse to be around.

So I'm an occasional jerk and know I could use some help with it. But if I never completely get over being an jerk, what's the point of trying? What good is this Jesus guy? If I'm going to be an a-hole, why not go big and have fun doing it?

Because we're all connected. We need each other, whether we like it or not. We're in this life together, and we owe it to each other, as Bill and Ted famously said, to "be excellent to each other."

What We Need

I believe it's a book that needs to be written, that people can enjoy and use, and that might actually help us better understand each other and ourselves. So like I did with my first novel, "BLOOD DOCTRINE" (now under option to be made into a TV series), I'm publishing this under my own imprint, Square Core Media. 

But just because I'm doing this without a major publisher doesn't mean it can't be as good as - or even better than - it would be if done by a big house. Fortunately I have the experience and contacts to do the book with the very same people who work for the "Big Five" publishers, but they also don't work for free. So here's a breakdown of the anticipated costs:

  • Content Edit - $1,500
  • Copy Edit - $1,000
  • Proofread - $1,000
  • Cover Design - $750
  • Typesetting/Interior Design - $1500
  • Illustration - $2500
  • ISBN/PCN - $80
  • Title Setup - $90
  • Ebook Conversion - $100
  • Global Distribution - $30
  • First Paperback Printing - $3,500
  • Marketing - $2,500
  • P/R - $1,700
  • Rewards (other than books) - $1,300
  • Shipping materials and handling costs for Rewards - $1,250
  • Indiegogo/Paypal/Credit Card Fees - $1,200
TOTAL - $20,000

If we fall short, I'll have to cut back on the marketing and PR budgets. Though not essential to getting the book completed, those costs are critical to help ensure the book is found by lots of people who aren't already personally connected to me. 

And if, by some chance, we raise more than we needed (like last time - thanks to you!!!) we'll need more cash for awards, shipping, printing and we can always use additional help to increase the ad budget and public relations campaign. 

To be clear: none of the money in this campaign goes to me personally. All of it will be used for the book project. 

What You Get

Of course no crowdfunding campaign would be complete without rewards! I don't expect you to support this project just because I asked you to, or because you agree with the message. I want to make it worth your while, and to help give you bragging rights as some of the few insiders who made the book really happen, way back at the beginning. 
So depending on your donation level, you can earn all kinds of swag, from stickers and custom stone coasters to copies of the book, limited edition T-shirts or even have me come talk about the book in your town. And everyone who gives $100 or more will be listed at special patrons of the project in the book itself. 
And who knows? We might come up with some other surprises along the way, shared only with backers of the project. Join us and find out!
NOTE: Be sure to select the perk you want when picking an amount to give, or else the system tells me you don't want anything. And that would just be sad. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people want to be a part of the campaign but just don't have lots of money. That's totally understandable. The good news is you can contribute as little or as much as you want. The donation levels for awards are just suggestions. If you don't care about that, you can give $1, $5 or whatever you can manage to say you're on board.

You can also spread the word by sharing the campaign with your fiends and anyone else via social media or the like who would be interested in checking it out. Oh, and if you do have some money to give and don't really care about the awards, you can help us put more money toward the project by declining any gifts. 

Not that I wouldn't take them. Hell, that's probably why I'd do it in the first place!

The migrant crisis in Hungary is getting extremely bad, 3000  mostly Syrian refugees are arriving  every day only to be treated treated like trash by the government and are restricted to even leave. The fascist government is not doing anything to help them at all and only civilians are helping them... they are forced to walk for 6-8 hours a day or wait in filthy "camps" against their will for nothing. These are a desperate men, woman and children, some of who are orphans who just escaped civil war and ISIS and this is what they get when they finally get to the EU. The situation is so dire that babies are freezing to death at night and others are getting increasingly sick.  You can read a full on CNN article here: http://www.cnn.com/2015/09/07/europe/europe-migrant-crisis/index.html

Volunteers from Migration Aid (a group formed by civilians trying to help on the spot in Hungary at every hour) are doing everything they can at the scene, but basics such as blankets, sweaters, tents, food, medicine are desperately needed for them to survive! The numbers and conditions are unprecedented they need our help, everybody's help and they need it now. First and foremost please spread the word to put pressure on the Hungarian government and the EU to help, but most importantly, I would like to ask you guys to help me raise as much money as we can to help these poor people DIRECTLY before they lose what dignity they have left. Contributions will be transferred directly to my sister in Hungary, who is involved with Migration Aid and other groups helping at the scene right now.

THANK YOU!!!!

Reka Bliss (a compassionate Hungarian with a lot of Syrian freinds). <3

story:
Our Story

Morning Chew was created when we realized that in today's world of ongoing daily political drama, we were scouring multiple news sources to get non-political news on topics that we were interested in.  Everywhere we turned, every lead story was politics.  We thought others were probably experiencing the same frustration and the idea for Morning Chew was born.  We wanted to find news and information about the things that mattered in our daily life in ONE PLACE!  Things such as: 

  • Health Trends
  • Business News
  • Movie & Show Reviews
  • Family Life Tips
  • Job Hunting Advice
  • Recipes
  • Affordable Travel Tips & Spotlights
  • Sports News
  • Wine & Cocktail Recommendations
  • People That Are Making a Difference
  • Non-political Hot Topics
  • Humor

Morning Chew is a paid subscription email newsletter delivered to your inbox every Tuesday and Thursday morning.  We decided to avoid paid advertisements in our newsletter to ensure a more enjoyable reader experience.  We will be sharing articles with a brief introduction on all of these topics from multiple news sources, pick and choose the topics that are interesting to you, there is something for everyone and you don't have to spend the time searching for good content.  We honestly wanted to save time in our own lives and find news that mattered and we believe it will do the same for you.

Reader participation is important to us and we want our community of readers to help share articles with us.  At the end of the day, we are better together.  We know everyone has a topic that impacts them personally, so we want to hear from our readers often.  Our readers will get acknowledgment for submitting an article and regular contributors will also get Morning Chew Swag.  

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we have done.  Our website is complete, we are signed on with our email send-out provider, we have done all of the legal business set up and our back office is ready to go.  We have also put love, sweat and effort into working to bring this all together over the last year.

What do we need the money for?

  • Promotion and Marketing to gain readership is the primary reason for the money.  This will take consistent ongoing marketing dollars on platforms such as Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.  We need the initial money to start that process and then as we gain readership we will continue to use our incoming revenue to promote Morning Chew.
  • Ongoing website maintenance/edits 
  • Any funds we raise, regardless of whether we meet our goal, will go to promoting our newsletter to gain subscription readership

Risks & Challenges

There are not many risks, but the challenges are simply gaining consistent reader subscriptions to cover our costs and continue to have money to promote our newsletter.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign, we would love for you to share our campaign to friends and family via email or social media.  You can share directly from this campaign.  You can also send us some good vibes as we go on this journey, good vibes never hurt anyone!

story:
Stories of Science and Us

When thirteen-year-old Parin's parents signed her up for a "science communication" event, she wondered, "Why would I go to an event that's probably about writing lab reports?" After all, she spends most of her time in theater classes, not studying science.

An hour into the event, though, Parin found herself excitedly jotting down notes instead of doodling Sailor Moon-inspired characters (as she was prone to do during biology class). What changed? When a workshop leader demonstrated using Twitter to share science, Parin realized that there were more ways to interact with science than she'd thought.

Science and Us is a youth-led nonprofit teaching teens how to communicate—and by extension, understand—STEM. Science and Us opened up a new world for Parin, one where Sailor Moon and photosynthesis could coexist. Now, as the youngest member of our team, she's helping make that change in others' lives too.

Part of the Science and Us team with Gabi Serrato Marks (right) of Communicating Science at MIT and Mackenzie Lemieux, an event volunteer

But Parin is lucky. There are thousands of programs getting young people into STEM, but virtually none focused on communicating it, or highlighting ways to appreciate science without being a scientist. Careers in science media, policy, and outreach—which are important to society and fulfill students' wide-ranging interests—are almost never mentioned in school. We're helping our peers realize that they can find and invent jobs where they can be fully themselves.

We're interviewing dozens of diverse people who bridge STEM and the public, then compiling their stories and advice into a book. We'll share this book and free excerpts with classrooms across the country, because finding a place for STEM in your life shouldn't depend on luck.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're using 48 Hour Books to print the books. It'll cost about $1000 to order 200 copies, based on our current page number estimates.
  • (If we don't reach our goal, we'll print as many copies as our funding allows for.)
  • Additional funding we receive will go toward printing more books and supporting our Makeathon events, where we help Boston-area middle and high schoolers create articles, podcasts, and art explaining STEM topics!
  • We have lots of perks, including digital and physical copies of the book, a chance to have science communicators call into your classroom to answer your students' questions, stickers and posters, and access to our invite-only launch event in Boston this fall!

 

The Impact

When we get Stories of Science and Us in classrooms and libraries across the country, we're enabling thousands of students—who are often expected to make decisions about their future—to discover careers bridging STEM and the public. This can be life-changing.

When students engross themselves in the vivid, tangible journeys of diverse science communicators, they realize that they can pursue fields like science media, policy, education, and outreach, or create their own path.

When we teach young people to communicate science, we teach them to understand science and approach challenges in any field. We prepare them to solve the world's problems, which transcend disciplines, in a way that memorizing facts never will.

 

Experience Stories From...

We've just started to reach out to interviewees, and we're excited to share that several people have already confirmed that they'll share their stories with you!

From top left to bottom right: Lindsey Murphy, Dr. Henry J. Adler, MJ Dunne, Ana Humphrey

 

Lindsey Murphy - Creator + Host of The Fab Lab with Crazy Aunt Lindsey

Lindsey is the creator of YouTube’s most beloved kids science web series that takes everyday concepts and turns them into fabulous DIY projects children can do at home with their families. Since 2010, The Fab Lab With Crazy Aunt Lindsey has partnered with Scientific American and the New York Academy of Sciences, been published in various national family magazines, and crowdfunded nearly $100,000. Born in Morristown, New Jersey, and a graduate of New York University, Lindsey moved to Portland, Oregon, in 2013 with no job, knowing no one, and exactly $.47 in her bank account. (Learn the rest of her story in Stories of Science and Us!)

 

Henry J. Adler, Ph.D. - Research Assistant Professor at the University of Buffalo

Born profoundly deaf, Dr. Adler uses both Listening and Spoken Language (LSL) and American Sign Language (ASL). He earned a doctorate in neuroscience from the University of Pennsylvania and has conducted hearing research at numerous institutes for about 30 years. Dr. Adler is a member of HI-ARO, a group of Association for Research in Otolaryngology members with hearing loss.  This group looks for ways to ease communications between its members and hearing peers, as well as between them and the public, including young people who may be pursuing careers in STEM in spite (or because) of their hearing loss.

 

MJ Dunne - Health IT Researcher & Science Communication Fellow at the Oregon Museum of Science and Industry

MJ is a Health IT Researcher with over 10-years experience in health disparities and health equity research. She has an MA in Health Communication and a BA in Social Science. MJ currently works for a non-profit that provides electronic health record software to community health centers across the nation. She is a Science Communication Fellow at the Oregon Museum of Science & Industry (OMSI) where she uses pop-culture, superheroes, and statistics to demonstrate the social and economic factors that contribute to the overall health of our communities. For fun MJ likes to garden, read books, rescue sad houseplants, forage for mushrooms, create low-brow art, and hunt for treasures with her 4-year old daughter.

 

Ana Humphrey - Exoplanet Researcher & High School Senior

Ana is a high school senior from Alexandria, VA, and incoming freshman at Harvard University. Her research to find the existence and probable locations of exoplanets—planets outside our solar system—won her the top prize of $250,000 in the 2019 Regeneron Science Talent Search. Ana created her first environmental education project at age 10, and founded the Watershed Warriors Initiative in 8th grade. She also volunteered with Inspire Virginia to turn increase youth vote turnout statewide and in the D.C. metro area. Ana has communicated her research at science fairs from regional to international levels.

 

Challenges

Being young has its pros and cons. On one hand, we're deeply connected to the issues we're trying to solve. Learning about science communication and careers at the intersection of STEM and the public has changed our lives.

We're dedicated to bringing these opportunities to others—not to make ourselves look better, but because everyone deserves them. In organizing our events, scientists and science communicators have been incredibly generous with their time and expertise. We've been fortunate to be able to organize 2 events at Boston University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

Collage of all past speakers, panelists, and workshop leaders from Science and Us events. We've had researchers, journalists, artists, diplomats, entrepreneurs, and more!

On the other hand, we've met multiple professionals who've refused to correspond with us because we did not have adults supervising our day-to-day operations. Fundraising can be a challenge (though our fiscal sponsor has helped us surmount this).

At the end of the day, however, being young means that we're connected to the people we want to help—today's middle and high school students. And we'll do all we can to make Stories an invaluable resource for them.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, we'd be grateful if you could:

  • Share our campaign with 3 people you think might be interested!
  • Let us know what you'd like to see in the book at scienceandus.org/stories (especially if you're a middle or high school student or teacher)
  • Nominate an interviewee at scienceandus.org/stories

Feel free to reach out to us at contact@scienceandus.org!
