story:
Short Summary:

Pete Thompson grew up in the freedom of the pristine beaches of southern California in the 50's.  Hermosa Beach was his home, but Manhattan Beach, Redondo and Torrance beaches were his backyard playground as well.  His brothers and sister were enveloped by the new and growing surf culture that would engage the world in the coming years. The surf legends of this new  phenomenon were his brothers first time employers, and best friends.  His strict parents looked always for the best address, as his family moved to the "Hill" of the wealth and privilege of Palos Verdes Estates.  Majestic cliffs overlooked the Pacific where inside a gated beach community he surfed most any day, and became his enclave and sanctuary during his high school years and onto young adulthood.

His life of ease took a real turn after college graduation.  Getting a job, the Draft, and Vietnam confronted his new life.  I was on my own.  So, I volunteered for the Marine Corps, Summer 1969.  It is here I met two men, Jesse and Hector from the hood of south central and the barrio of East LA and through the crucible of Marine training, we became brothers and learned that skin color didn't mean a damn thing.  I've retired after a successful career in sales and marketing management and have been blessed with a strong marriage of 44 years and three good kids and six grand children.   The Bend is my first novel and its message of brotherhood that was challenged to the breaking point, is one I have wanted to tell for many years.  Three families of different race and background have the same fears and aspirations of all of us, as they navigate through the Freedom of the 50's ( for some ) into the upheaval of the cultural turmoil of the 60's.  Although each live just a few miles from apart, they in fact live on different planets culturally, but are more similar than different.  This is a central theme of The Bend. 

The heartache of lost love, redemption, hard choices and the tragic murder of a father, the pull of the gangs, and the Vietnam War's impact, are historic themes and events that impact these men and their families, which punctuate this important and historic telling of great change in America.

The Impact:

First, why a crowd funding campaign.  The first publication took over 8 years to write and publish via an independent print on demand publisher. I chose to self edit this work, and that was a big mistake.  I have spent several thousand dollars personally in this effort. Now, understanding the real costs and expense of this undertaking and as I remain passionate about the story and its important message, I need assistance in getting this work re-launched and edited properly, so the book  and story can be offered to the world as the first rate product it deserves to be.

When you contribute to this project for the re-launch of the book you will provide invaluable support for the telling of this historical and timely story.  The three main characters, Pet, Jesse, and Hector will show how their lives in the hood of south central and the barrio of East LA are far more similar than different to the privilege Pete experienced in Hermosa Beach and the upper class enclave of Palos Verdes Estates.  

It is my hope The Bend will inspire many more to realize the bond of brotherhood and family is universal, for those who are willing.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal is to raise $25,000.

These funds will be to cover the costs of putting the manuscript into the hands of an experienced Print On Demand publisher with the expertise to do the professional and complete job of proof and copy edit, as well as for content and word craft.  Their staff will provide the finest quality for hard, soft bound books as well as ebooks and audio book production.  Costs to cover promotion expenses, which include travel for book signing events, Perks allotment for signed editions, shirts, hats, coffee mugs, etc., as well as trade mark and purchase of certain images in the book are to be paid for.

Your contributions will be set aside in an account overseen by Indiegogo, and will not be allocated to a separate account I will be able use no earlier than 15 days after the campaign is completed.  The new edition is slated to be available by May 2020.

 

Risks & Challenges

The challenge for me is to have many of you believe as I have that the story and message of The Bend is one that resonates and is one you desire to see shown to our divided country, if not the world.  This is a Huge undertaking for me personally.  As the book has been published once, and not produced in the quality way it should have, then why support this ongoing effort?  Well, for me, the message that skin color doesn't mean a damn thing and the tableau of the story of three families who live so close physically and of different race, but with the same hopes and dreams is a message which must be told  over and over.  The inherit message of The Bend is universal and one we must come to embrace if we as a culture and world are to finally reach our true potential. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute much to this campaign.  Although, the smallest donation of $5 or $10 will add up and be very helpful.  But, if you can not contribute financially, I am asking for you to tell your friends and others about this book and about its timely message.  If successful in achieving my goal, any and all will be acknowledged for helping, whether you gave a dollar, or just passed along the good word of The Bend.

story:
Greetings. I am mOody bLaCk National Award Winning Poet and Host, Smart Arts Teaching Artist, Comedian, Voice Over Actor, and Beard Enthusiast.

I am raising funds to perform on tour in California. This tour is important to me because I've traveled and performed a great bit of the US. However, I've never been to California to share my gift. I've been requested throughout the years but never had the means to get to California. I would love to be able to perform and facilitate writing workshops for people of all ages in California. This would serve as a means for people (who I haven't had a chance to reach) to learn how to express themselves and heal. That would mean the world to me!  

 

HERE'S WHERE YOU COME IN:

  • I need investors to fund the trip from South Carolina to California
  • The cost is $2000 (plane ticket from SC to northern CA, from northern CA to southern CA, from southern CA back to SC/ lodging and food for 2 weeks)
  • If an investor pay $100- I will serve as a brand ambassador for your brand for a month, $200- I will serve as a brand ambassador for your brand for 2 months, and so on... And what that means is I will wear paraphernalia, shout out your brand, market and promote and my social platforms 2 days a week for a month or more...depending on the investment you make.
  • If the goal is not met: I will use the funds to perform on a tour closer to my geographical location. Making sure I serve a community in need for arts integration and/or healing through poetry.

The Impact

Attending poetry events and workshops have such a positive impact in a community:

  • Poetry has been known to improve mental health and writing skills. I have been diagnosed with depression since 1996 and I found it quite therapeutic.  Therefore, I feel it's imperative to share my story through poem to help others do the same.
  • Every city I perform or facilitate a workshop: people have approached me to let me know how I've given them hope and a new perspective on life. That I made it feasible for them to be open about what they feel and to share with others in hopes to heal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, here's other ways you can help:

  • Please spread the word via word of mouth, emails, or texts
  • Also, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

If an investor pay $100- I will serve as a brand ambassador for your brand for a month, $200- I will serve as a brand ambassador for your brand for 2 months, and so on... And what that means is I will wear paraphernalia, shout out your brand, market and promote and my social platforms 2 days a week for a month or more...depending on the investment you make.
If the goal is not met: I will use the funds to perform on a tour closer to my geographical location. Making sure I serve a community in need for arts integration and/or healing through poetry.


The Impact
Attending poetry events and workshops have such a positive impact in a community:

Poetry has been known to improve mental health and writing skills. I have been diagnosed with depression since 1996 and I found it quite therapeutic.  Therefore, I feel it's imperative to share my story through poem to help others do the same.
Every city I perform or facilitate a workshop: people have approached me to let me know how I've given them hope and a new perspective on life. That I made it feasible for them to be open about what they feel and to share with others in hopes to heal.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, here's other ways you can help:

Please spread the word via word of mouth, emails, or texts
Also, you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The background

Due to the COVID-19 virus we are forced to move our Beyond Storytelling Conference in Berlin from May 2020 to May 2021. To keep the bond, to stimulate further conversation, and – last but not least – to compensate our losses we want to print the conference READER like nothing had happened and release it in May 2020.

The conference READER is an inspiring collection of features, essays, interviews, reflections and stories. With contributions from Mary Alice Arthur, Stephanie Bachmair, Jacques Chlopczyk, Julie Diamond, David Epston, Christine Erlach, Eric Flügge, Roi Gal-Or, Bettina Haasen, Sohail Inayatullah, Ulrich Jungblut, Jeffer London, Michael Margolis, Michael Müller, Adah Parris, Wolfgang Tonninger, Michael White and Meike Ziegler.
 

The financial frame

  • To be able to print the READER we have to raise at least 1.500 EURO with this campaign.
  • Our target lies on 5.000 EURO to cover part of our expenses for the conference 2020 due to #COVID-19.
  • To make it easy for you to decide we created some unique and reasonable perks.
  • In the case, we cannot make the first hurdle of 1.500 EURO, we will pay back all the money.
     

The book

  • Why we want to print the READER and not just spread it as pdf?
    • Because we love the format and we think that it is a treasure box for the pillow.
    • Because it is physically serving as a bond for the community, to remind each one of us what inspiring source this can be.
       

The community

 

The show will go on ...

story:
I am starting a new, but different kind of adventure in my life. I am experimenting with...AUTHORSHIP! I'm introducing my first self-published book...

A DAY IN THE WOODS OF NANA'S BACKYARD!

But, I need your help to get the books out to YOU!  So, I am raising funds to get books printed and out to the public. The manuscript, illustrations, and layout are complete and in queue to print at a book publishing company! Ready...set... 

This book project is special to me because it evokes nostalgic memories of childhood vacations.  Personally, I feel my eyes welling up and a warm fuzzy feeling 'round my heart each time I read it and get to the ending! I think it will move you, too! It also evokes the memory of playing outside and childhood curiosity.  I hope to inspire a new generation of children that are not often playing outside, to...play outside! At least when it is possible.  This story is also a reminder that communing with nature has GREAT health benefits for "kids" of ALL ages! 

It's a great story for young AND old!  The story is about, a young city girl that explores and discovers the secrets of the woods in a small country town when visiting her family.  Will the adventure stop there?  Read it and find out!

An online book club advance review describes the adventure as...magical!

So...It's GO time! Will you help?

#TakeTime2Read  #ForestBathing #ADayInTheWoods #LorisStories

 

There is no risk! This is going to happen (unless something happens to ME...knock on wood.) So, keep me in prayer and let's get this party started! Make a pledge TODAY!

I want to get this project done in a month...2 weeks for pledging and 2 weeks for printing.  And, I want to get rewards out to all pledgers by September if not sooner!  Wish me luck, and... 
#TakeTime2Read

story:
Short Summary

Cristina Petersen is West Coast born and raised and has always had a passion for reading and writing, From an early age, she wrote elaborate stories and had a strong desire to work with people in a creative way. From her many travels, she found her path as an English language instructor and has a B.A. and M.A. in Applied Linguistics from the University of Victoria. She also loves painting and art in general and views her teaching practice as one of the many ways she can express her creativity.

Monika Blichar is a Polish-Canadian artist and entrepreneur with a passion for all things creative. She is the owner of Monika's Art Boutique, Art World Expo, and Painting Dreams International Art Tours. Monika has been teaching since 2007 and has a BA in English and French from the University of Victoria. Monika has been inspired by all things creative from an early age and is committed to sharing this passion with others via creative projects, community events and artist retreats in British Columbia and Europe. 

Bringing Murray to life in this book is important to us for several reasons. Murray is a reflection of many people and how they feel about themselves. Murray has no fire and as a result, he feels inadequate in comparison to his fellow dragons. This story helps teach children about acceptance, courage and love for all living things-all important values to instill into children at early ages. In addition, we also believe strongly in education and learning through creativity and imagination. The story takes the reader into a world filled with magic and wonder and our resources at the back can help children with vocabulary, reading comprehension and art activities. The book would be a great addition to any home or classroom and we would love to see Murray fly with kids all over the world! 

If you contributed to our campaign, you would be helping us teach children all over the world through a unique and magical story. Murray could fly around the world and into the hearts of many children, families and schools with your help!  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3,500 to get started. 

$2,600 will be needed to raise funds to pay our Publisher.

$500 is needed for art supplies to create story boards first via canvas then in printed form with high resolution images.

$400 is needed to pay for travel expenses to meet and finalize all details with the publisher in Victoria.

 

The Impact

This book would make a difference in the lives of both children, families and other educators around the world. Bringing magic and imagination through Murray's experience would allow all readers to learn and internalize the moral of the story and apply it in their lives. Too often in today's society, we are taught to conform and look or act in a certain way. Murray's feeling like he doesn't belong is only too real for many kids (and adults!). By going through this life experience, he comes to realize with the help of his dragon friends that true happiness and belonging are within us all, despite differences in abilities or appearances. He also realizes that the Earth is the most precious thing to life and that he must protect it. Murray is magical and from that place of wonder, we hope this story will inspire children and adults alike! 

 

Risks & Challenges

We are both working more than full time each week on our careers in education and art. While we have no shortage of ideas and creativity, our challenges come from a lack of  time and funds available to invest in our passion projects while contributing to our households, maintaining a studio and gallery and balancing work with life. If we are funded to our goal, we will be able to efficiently publish the book while guaranteeing that the challenge of time and investment funds are not in our way. We have been dedicated to education and invested many years into Bachelor's and Master's degrees  and are committed to making this book possible! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute by pre-ordering a package outlined in the description, please send this campaign to your network via email or other social media, for example, a favourite teacher past or present, other parents, friends and family. We would love to help other educators and families have this book in 2018!

story:
Introducing Us

Ladey Adey and Abbirose Adey are a mother and daughter team who have written three books together with many more planned.  They write together and Abbirose is the illustrator and artist in the partnership.  During solo writing projects they come together for the publishing work and have set up their own independent publishing company Pink Parties Press.

Abbirose is a Primary School Teacher so it is fitting that their latest book journey is a children’s book about a little unicorn.  

Ladey is an Author, Videoblogger and Podcaster.  She helps people to realise their dreams of becoming a published author. 

Why The Little Unicorn Book Project Is Important To Us

As a family when Abbirose and her sister, Candice were growing up, reading aloud was treasured time together.  As adults we still love children books, the feel, the illustrations and aspect of sharing the story. 

What You Will Help Us To Achieve

By joining us in this campaign, you will help us continue to spread the joy of reading, to other families, and introduce a new, loving character of the Little Unicorn.

Where The Funding Will Go

We need £4,000 to cover the cost of printing and travel to Literary Festivals and schools to share the Little Unicorn book.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, all contributed funds will go into the printing of the book first and foremost.  Any funds after this will go towards reaching out to more young readers, unicorn lovers and their families.

Your Perks

We are excited about the perks we can give our supporters.  We had to stop ourselves from continuing to create more and more products!  

Unicorns have a life of their own and Little Unicorn wanted us to create hundreds and thousands. 

These include:

  • A signed copy of the book; Little Unicorn - What's Your Name?
  • Little Unicorn clothing and gifts.
  • The opportunity to join the Little Unicorn Facebook page.
  • Digital Little Unicorn Goodies.

The Impact

Your contribution will make an impact by guiding your loved ones and others around the world in shared reading.  You can be instrumental in helping young readers start their reading journey by learning the colours, the days of the week and the magic of their own name.

Other Ways You Can Help To Make A Difference

Help us make a difference in shared reading, give a shout out about this Little Unicorn campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page and posting in your social media world.

If you can not or do not want to contribute financially to this campaign, we would welcome any pertinent advice or ideas as how we can take this concept further, tips or experiences you might have had with similar projects in order to help us get Little Unicorn out into the world.

Please share and post or blog and tweet about the Little Unicorn book project on social media, we are sure your friends would love to hear about it, whether they have children or not.  They may be secret unicorn lovers!

story:
A Little about Drunk Monkeys

Founded in 2011 in the heart of the San Fernando Valley, Drunk Monkeys became a place to feature great works of literature and pop culture criticism. We've showcased everything from political musings to smut to what is hands- down our biggest issue of all time. We yearn to read things that build worlds and break hearts, and we are proud of our stance against abuse and harassment.

We are a staff of unpaid volunteers, and this is a labor of love. And, unfortunately, we are not a paying market, but we'd love that to change. 
 

And for the first year, we'd love to humbly ask you for help.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've done the math, and in order to compensate our contributors from January to December of 2019, we will need to raise at least $2500. 

Here's how that will work: 

Fiction, poetry, art, and essays will be paid $10 a piece.

Writers of the Month will be paid a $15 flat fee.

The budget for each month is around $200 ($2400 for the year with an additional $100 of wiggle room).

Editorial staff will not be paid using this money (editorial staff is unpaid, anyway).

These amounts are subject to change, depending on volume of work and how much is raised (we want to be able to pay people as much as possible), with any extra amount going towards the 2020 budget. Donors will be notified of how funds are distributed for transparency's sake.

What do you get for becoming a donor? Well, what don't you get? We have a wide variety of perks, from pins to editorial services to Vanderpump Rules livestreams to an exclusive Mr. Butterchips print made by our very own Alex Schumacher! There's something for everyone at every donation level.

If we do not reach our goal, we will use any funds to compensate our contributors appropriately in reflection of what we do raise; our donors will be notified in an update towards/ at the end of the campaign.

The Impact

As writers ourselves, we all know that it's often a thankless job. Too often it's pay-to-play, with reading fees that seem to pile up quickly and little to no payout. We definitely understand the frustration of not being compensated for work, and the excitement of money coming in from something you wrote, something that was loved and appreciated. While we won't be able to pay the dream-bucks we wish we could, we believe that a modest payment is a welcome addition to the joy of publication; we want our authors and artists to know we appreciate them and their work. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we face is not meeting our goal, and having to adjust our payment plan. We are raising this money to pay our contributors, not our staff, and not the various fees that go along with running a literary journal. It is essential we reach at least $2500 in order to be able to compensate our writers and authors accordingly. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know how tight money can be; we're all feeling it personally, too. And we never want you to feel you have to make a monetary contribution if you can't afford it. But there are other ways you can help! Sharing the link with your social circles can make a big impact in our campaign, so feel free to throw that link on your Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, or whatever the cool kids are using these days!

And really, the greatest thing you can do is check us out. If you like what you're reading, comment on our posts, let the writers and artists know! We love community interaction. We love all of you. We want you to be part of the Drunk Monkeys family. 

 

Very sincerely, yours:

Kolleen Carney Hoepfner

Editor in Chief

Matthew Guerrero

Founder

and the entire Drunk Monkeys team.

Kolleen, Chris, and Matt, proving it IS about the pasta, always

story:
Hi! I'm Steven Howell Wilson, former DC Comics freelancer and Parsec / Mark Time award honoree. My partner-in-crime is Phil Giunta, up-and-coming author of the scariest stories you'll ever read. We are FIREBRINGER PRESS, and, for fifteen years, we've been bringing the works of unpublished and under-published authors to the reading public. 

It is our honor and privilege to offer Meanwhile in the Middle of Eternity, our third anthology showcasing the work of 13 astounding authors and six incredible artists. And, to do right by them, we need your help!

We’re delivering a fantastic and diverse array of stories. Join gods and mortals in combat against slithering demons in famine-stricken Finland. Witness an unconventional battle of wits as a devious genie tries to outfox a clever robot.

Ride with two hapless deliverymen as they stumble upon a frightening ritual to propitiate an ancient and malevolent power. Escape to a remote corner of the globe with a desperate family fleeing an insidious alien invasion. Follow a fraternity pledge as he undergoes an initiation to terror at a local cemetery.

The $4000 we're seeking will pay the basic setup costs for getting the book into distribution; it will cover marketing costs; but, most of all, it will allow us to compensate our authors and artists at semi-professional rates. It's important to us that hard work pay off. Well, these folks have done the work. You can help us reward them for it. 

In return, we can provide you with autographed copies of this incredible book, or an ebook version, if you're on a tight budget. If you can contribute a little more, we can provide ebook or paper copies of the earlier two titles in this series. And, if you're a writer yourself and looking for feedback from experienced professionals, Phil and I have a reward level which allows you to submit a work for formal critique. 

If we don't reach our goal? Que sera sera. We're doing this. Contributors will still get their perks, and we'll starve for our art. Okay, we'll do simulated fasting for our art. Our fifteen-year track record proves that we deliver quality books despite the challenges involved in indie publishing. 

But we'll make our goal, because we know our community values good storytelling, dynamic artwork, and the talented people who craft them. You've proved that many times in the past through our successful campaigns for our Firebringer Take Two project, my novel Sacrifice Play - A Tale from the Arbiter Chronicles, and the previous volume in the "Eternity" series, Elsewhere in the Middle of Eternity. 

So please join us in supporting Meanwhile in the Middle of Eternity and the team that put it together for you. Even if you can't spare any money in the midst of our topsy turvy times, please support us by sharing the link to this campaign with your friends and social media followers.

Follow a fraternity pledge as he undergoes an initiation to terror at a local cemetery.
The $4000 we're seeking will pay the basic setup costs for getting the book into distribution; it will cover marketing costs; but, most of all, it will allow us to compensate our authors and artists at semi-professional rates. It's important to us that hard work pay off. Well, these folks have done the work. You can help us reward them for it. 

In return, we can provide you with autographed copies of this incredible book, or an ebook version, if you're on a tight budget. If you can contribute a little more, we can provide ebook or paper copies of the earlier two titles in this series. And, if you're a writer yourself and looking for feedback from experienced professionals, Phil and I have a reward level which allows you to submit a work for formal critique. 
If we don't reach our goal? Que sera sera. We're doing this. Contributors will still get their perks, and we'll starve for our art. Okay, we'll do simulated fasting for our art. Our fifteen-year track record proves that we deliver quality books despite the challenges involved in indie publishing. 
But we'll make our goal, because we know our community values good storytelling, dynamic artwork, and the talented people who craft them. You've proved that many times in the past through our successful campaigns for our Firebringer Take Two project, my novel Sacrifice Play - A Tale from the Arbiter Chronicles, and the previous volume in the "Eternity" series, Elsewhere in the Middle of Eternity. 
So please join us in supporting Meanwhile in the Middle of Eternity and the team that put it together for you. Even if you can't spare any money in the midst of our topsy turvy times, please support us by sharing the link to this campaign with your friends and social media followers.

story:
Welcome to the crowdfund for Conversations on AI - a 200 page trade paperback and free eBook featuring dialogues between pioneering thinkers and responses to these from the book's first readers.

 

What's the book about?

Click on the video above ☝️☝️☝️ and allow our AI presenters to enlighten you.

The initial impetus for the project was to assemble a group of writers, artists and thinkers so they could discuss a topic that all of their work has a stake in, and publish their discussions as a ~200 page free eBook and trade paperback.

That group ended up comprising Reza Negarestani, Benjamin Bratton, Mat Dryhurst, Holly Herndon, Helen Hester and Nick Srnicek. And the topic that turned out to unite their interests was Artificial Intelligence.

These thinkers have previously dealt with AI from various angles: some have written about AI directly (Reza Negarestani's Intelligence and Spirit and Nick Srnicek's work on the political economy of AI), some engage with AI as a collaborator (Holly Herndon, Mat Dryhurst and SPAWN), while some have developed the notion of artificiality in itself as a means out of conceptual deadlock (Helen Hester and Benjamin Bratton).

In the three conversations on the topic, AI will act more as a crossroads than the sole focus. Our dialogists are fascinated by the impact that AI will have on politics, art, philosophy, education, terraforming, and many more things, meaning that although the dialogues may consistently pass through AI, they will almost certainly end up at surprising destinations.

 

 

Reza Negarestani is a philosopher and a former systems engineer. He originally became known for pioneering his pioneering work of theory-fiction Cyclonopedia (2008). Since the early 2000s, he has contributed extensively to journals and anthologies, and lectured at numerous international universities and institutes including Duke University, MIT, École Normale Supérieure, and Haus der Kulturen der Welt among others. Negarestani’s writings have been translated into twelve languages. Negarestani’s latest philosophical work is Intelligence and Spirit (Urbanomic/Sequence Press/MIT, 2018), a book investigating the meaning of intelligence at the intersection of artificial intelligence, philosophy of mind, theory of computation and the philosophy of German Idealism.

 

 

Benjamin Bratton's work spans Philosophy, Art, Design and Computer Science. He is Professor of Visual Arts at the University of California, San Diego. He is Program Director of The Terraforming programme at Strelka Institute of Media, Architecture and Design in Moscow. He is also a Visiting Professor at The European Graduate School, SCI_Arc (The Southern California Institute of Architecture) and NYU Shanghai. He is the author of several books including The Revenge of The Real: Politics for a Post-Pandemic World (Verso, 2021) and The Stack: On Software and Sovereignty (MIT Press, 2015).

 

 

Holly Herndon operates at the edge of electronic and avant-garde pop music and emerges with a dynamic and disruptive canon of her own. On her most recent full-length album PROTO Herndon fronts and conducts an electronic pop choir comprised of both human and AI voices over a musical palette that encompasses everything from synths to Sacred Harp stylings. CNN noted that Herndon is 'shaping the future of AI' and she has demonstrated this nexus of technological evolution and musical catharsis with elevated performances at The Barbican (London), Volksbühne (Berlin), Sónar (Barcelona), Unsound (Krakow), and Club 2 Club (Milan). The sounds synthesized on PROTO by Herndon, her AI “baby” Spawn, and the vocal ensemble combine elements from Herndon’s dynamic and idiosyncratic personal journey: the timeless folk traditions of her childhood experiences in church-going East Tennessee (particularly the prismatic layered practice of Sacred Harp singing), the avant-garde music she explored while at Mills College, and the radical club culture of Berlin, all enhanced by her recent PhD composition studies at Stanford University, researching machine learning and music. Herndon co-founded the podcast series Interdependence alongside Mat Dryhurst.

Mat Dryhurst releases music, research and artworks solo and in conjunction with creative partner Holly Herndon. He teaches at NYU’s Clive Davis Institute of Music, Strelka Institute and the European Graduate School and hosts discussions with figures shaping 21st century culture on the Interdependence podcast.

 

 

Helen Hester is Professor of Gender, Technology and Work at the University of West London. Her research interests include technology, social reproduction, and the future of work, and she is a member of the international feminist working group Laboria Cuboniks. Her books include Beyond Explicit: Pornography and the Displacement of Sex (SUNY Press, 2014), Xenofeminism (Polity, 2018), and After Work: The Politics of Free Time (Verso, 2022, with Nick Srnicek).

 

 

Nick Srnicek is a Lecturer in Digital Economy at King's College London. He is the author of Platform Capitalism (Polity, 2016), Inventing the Future: Postcapitalism and a World Without Work (Verso, 2015 with Alex Williams).

 

 

When will the conversations happen?

The conversations will start happening this summer and autumn.

After that, the publication of the book will occur in two stages.

Stage 1

Once the conversations have all taken place, they'll be published as a 'beta' eBook of approximately 50,000 words – equivalent to about 200 printed pages. This will be free for all to read.

Stage 2

This is where things really start to get interesting.

Before the trade paperback is published, Impossible Object will seek responses to the dialogues from their first readership. The call for proposed responses will be open to all readers. One to three of these will be published alongside the main dialogues in the first full print and electronic edition of the book.

Also, the names of the original backers will be included the acknowledgements in recognition of the role they played in making the book happen.

Stage 3?

Our seeking responses to the book needn't stop there...

 

 

 

Who will design Conversations on AI?

We're excited to say that editorial design for the book and for Impossible Object's future titles will be by the incredible Metahaven.

The work of Metahaven consists of filmmaking, writing, and design. Films by Metahaven include The Sprawl (Propaganda about Propaganda) (2015), Information Skies (2016, nominated for the 2017 European Film Awards), Hometown (2018), Eurasia (Questions on Happiness) (2018), and Chaos Theory (2021). Solo exhibitions include Turnarounds, e-flux, New York (2019), Version History, ICA London (2018), Earth, Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam (2018), Hometown, Izolyatsia, Kyiv (2018), Information Skies, Auto Italia, London (2016), The Sprawl, Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, San Francisco (2015), and Islands in the Cloud, MoMA PS1, New York (2013). Recent publications include PSYOP: An Anthology (Koenig Books, London, 2018), and Digital Tarkovsky (Strelka Press, Moscow, 2018).

Not only will Metahaven be doing editorial design for Conversations on AI; in line with a plan that will be repeated with future Impossible Object titles, the front cover image will be minted as a standalone NFT and auctioned a little further down the line.

Some of the proceeds of this will go to iODAO, Impossible Object's creator DAO.

 

Where will the money go?

  • Fees for our dialogists: Benjamin Bratton, Mat Dryhurst, Holly Herndon, Helen Hester, Reza Negarestani and Nick Srnicek
  • Our designer, Metahaven
  • The costs of producing, marketing and distributing the book
  • The development of web3 functionality on Impossible Object's website and forthcoming Discord server

 

About Impossible Object

Impossible Object publishes fiction, theory, conversations and poetry.

Please visit our website for more details on our current projects and upcoming releases.

story:
We are raising money to help with the marketing of our soon to released  book " Are We A Bus?" The book is in the final stages of production. It will next go to formatting and publishing. We are extremely excited and proud of our work and cannot wait for people to start reading our comedic look at what it takes to tour North America with a rock band!

The money we are raising will be used to offset the costs that are out of pocket  marketing expenses to increase our reach. Our out of pocket expenses to this point have been: book editing, formatting, book cover design, copyright expenses, and the actual cost of publishing to different platforms and the printing of promo books.

 

We have an extensive marketing campaign planned that will extend into our knowledge of the music touring industry along with multiple online social media campaigns and various music platforms.

 

Our book will appeal to music fans and mystery readers and fans of authors such as Tim Dorsey, Carl Hiaasen, Randy Wayne White, Christopher Moore and many others.

 

We tried to keep the perks fun and with the theme of the book.  Hope you like it, we had fun writing and coming up with the concept. 

World’s greatest guitarist The Doctor, Jurgen Weislangwolf's latest tour was locked down and ready to kick off like any other tour. But an ex-stage manager had other plans, waiting for his chance to get back out on the road. Without any fanfare, the tour started with an unnoticed set of eyes watching every detail.

 

Hardened tour professionals Jeb and Neusy can easily navigate any tour loaded with con men and rip off artists in their path. When murder and mayhem started to become an obstacle, the success of the tour became dependent on them keeping the band safe. 

 

Content and enjoying his new life on the road,  the ex-stage manager was always watching and waiting for his opportunity to create chaos, which increased  once he realized the incompetence of the two FBI agents that were assigned to the tour.

 

Comedy and satire on an already humorous industry where vile and disreputable people have been known to ruin many careers.

 

 

Kent Niepert - “ I have always been involved music from a young age, starting my first hard rocking band at 16 and always dreamed of being a famous guitarist. Never reaching that ultimate goal I supported my two musician sons to be the best that they could be musically. I had managed my son’s bands, War/n/t and CUJO in China. I have also played lead guitar with them on stage in large festivals.”

 

“My dreams took on a different direction when Jeff invited me on a tour featuring famous musicians, several of whom were idols of my youth. Touring was hard work and not always “shits and giggles”, but I learned what it took to set up a stage for many players as well as getting them to their hotel rooms at night for a well-deserved rest between travels.”

 

“After years of touring and sharing stories on life on the road, Jeff and I were inspired to write our own stories featuring fictional rock stars, fans, booking agents, and crew. This process took many years writing, emailing, and editing our works between two continents. The summer of 2020, we completed our first novel and soon after had a second novel completed. Every time I read through our books, I crack a smile or LMAO at some of the absurd, nonsensical, tales that came out of our heads. I’m sure anyone that reads this will enjoy learning about what touring is all about with a lot of zany instances that take place during the story.” 

 

Jeff Agins:  "When I was given the opportunity to work with a national rock tour in the nineties it certainly was a learning experience which I was able to apply a lot of what I learned into my everyday life and the business I had at the time. "

"A highlight of my career was producing a five day guitar seminar on the campus of UCLA. The seminar featured three concerts with guest musicians I grew up listening to."

"After many tours and real life experiences It was extremely satisfying and entertaining to be able to take my knowledge of the music industry and create a fictional world. Working with Kent created such fun times of writing, waiting for his reaction and reading what he would write back.  I hope you enjoy reading it as much as I enjoyed writing it."

 

Follow us on Facebook

story:
July 2020

Thank you very much for your contribution to our ongoing campaign! We're both humbled and encouraged to receive your generous support when so many are also in need of help. 

You can support journalism at San Francisco's legacy LGBTQ community news source by scrolling down and choosing a "perk" listed along the right side of this page. 

Your contribution will allow us to pay our staff, 70-plus freelance writers and photographers and keep our legacy LGBTQ newspaper and website operating through the fall when, hopefully, the economy will begin to recover.

Throughout the years, the Bay Area Reporter focused on stories that mainstream media did not consider important: anti-gay discrimination in employment and housing; bias and fear of people with HIV/AIDS; victims of abuse and anti-gay violence; the plight of at-risk youth; and the unmet needs of LGBTQ elders.

We've also supported thousands of LGBTQ artists through the years, with lively features, reviews, and nightlife coverage. Our publication has given voice to the vulnerable and is a record of our history. But only with your help can we continue to play this unique role.

There are other ways to support the B.A.R. You can link a favorite article or share how the B.A.R. helped a friend who was featured in our reporting. And please do read us, in print and online at www.ebar.com.

Subscribe to our free email newsletters at www.ebar.com/subscribe

Visit us on Facebook @BayAreaReporter and on Twitter @eBarnews

Find and download pdfs of past issues at www.issuu.com/bayareareporter

Thank you again for getting us to our goal! We couldn't have done it without you.

 

Apr. 9, 2020

Dear Readers & Advertisers,

I hope you and your loved ones are safe and healthy during this period. We have faced challenges before and we can only get through this ordeal together, not alone. On behalf of myself, the editorial staff, and the more than 50 contributors who bring the Bay Area Reporter to you in print and online every day, every week for nearly 50 years, THANK YOU for your support. That support is important as we contend with an unprecedented medical epidemic and an uncertain future.

From my first days as an assistant editor at the BAR in 1989, I witnessed past crises like the AIDS epidemic, the 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake, the September 11, 2001 attacks, the 2008 financial crash, and the contraction of the newspaper industry, and yet, through hard work and dedication, the BAR managed to survive and has never missed publishing an issue --  and I don't intend to stop now if I can help it. 

To this end, I have had to make difficult, heart-breaking decisions to lay off staff and decrease costs in response to a sudden drop in advertising and a rapidly changing situation. Distribution has been redirected to concentrate in neighborhoods. eBAR.com will publish more articles online. By keeping our operation leaner, we will attempt to weather this situation into the summer when hopefully there will be some clarity about the future. Unfortunately, we are in the same boat as the majority of small businesses and hoping to make it through to better days.

We are grateful for the support of those advertisers who have committed to continue their advertising during this period. Community newspapers depend on advertising to provide free distribution of print and online publications. Advertisers in the BAR are interested in reaching and supporting the LGBTQ community, and readers are interested in advertisers who value them. These advertisers support our community institutions and charities. Now I am appealing to you directly for your help to meet and exceed our fundraising goal to bridge the gap.

As a community media outlet, we take our mission to serve our community seriously, asking difficult questions of our politicians, our nonprofits, and our own leaders and institutions. We may not get an answer, but we are compelled by our professionalism to pose the questions in an attempt at transparency and disseminating information. But holding the powerful to account is not the only function we serve.

Over the decades, the BAR has been an advocate for our community, from the birth of the gay rights movement all the way to marriage equality and advocating for transgender rights. Our political coverage started when Harvey Milk was our first political columnist, before he was elected supervisor and replaced by longtime political watcher the late Wayne Friday. The BAR was the first LGBT community publication to unapologetically feature the leather community with a regular column by the legendary Marcus Hernandez (Mr. Marcus), and the first to publish obituaries with photos during the AIDS crisis.

Throughout the years, the BAR focused on stories that mainstream media did not consider important: like anti-gay discrimination in employment and housing; bias and fear of people with HIV/AIDS; victims of abuse and anti-gay violence; the plight of at-risk youth; and the unmet needs of LGBT elders. Our articles have given voice to the vulnerable and are a record of our history. But only with your help, can the BAR continue to play this unique role.

San Francisco will overcome this crisis. But what about our beloved Castro and LGBT community? What will it be like after this epidemic passes? We made it through the AIDS crisis by pulling together and that community spirit is necessary now. With the rise of anti-gay right-wing activists and authoritarian leaders, the need for a free LGBT press has never been greater, and with your help, the BAR is committed to serving our community and doing everything in our power to survive.That is why I am asking you to read the BAR regularly, visit eBAR.com, download our app, patronize our advertisers, but also make any contribution you can to help defray operating costs for the immediate future.

San Francisco is one of 11 US cities that is fortunate to have a legacy LGBT publication by us, for us, and about us. Help preserve the BAR as an historic and important community institution for the future.

Thank you for your continued support,

Michael Yamashita, Publisher

We have faced challenges before and we can only get through this ordeal together, not alone. On behalf of myself, the editorial staff, and the more than 50 contributors who bring the Bay Area Reporter to you in print and online every day, every week for nearly 50 years, THANK YOU for your support. That support is important as we contend with an unprecedented medical epidemic and an uncertain future.From my first days as an assistant editor at the BAR in 1989, I witnessed past crises like the AIDS epidemic, the 1989 Loma Prieta earthquake, the September 11, 2001 attacks, the 2008 financial crash, and the contraction of the newspaper industry, and yet, through hard work and dedication, the BAR managed to survive and has never missed publishing an issue --  and I don't intend to stop now if I can help it. To this end, I have had to make difficult, heart-breaking decisions to lay off staff and decrease costs in response to a sudden drop in advertising and a rapidly changing situation. Distribution has been redirected to concentrate in neighborhoods. eBAR.com will publish more articles online. By keeping our operation leaner, we will attempt to weather this situation into the summer when hopefully there will be some clarity about the future. Unfortunately, we are in the same boat as the majority of small businesses and hoping to make it through to better days.We are grateful for the support of those advertisers who have committed to continue their advertising during this period. Community newspapers depend on advertising to provide free distribution of print and online publications. Advertisers in the BAR are interested in reaching and supporting the LGBTQ community, and readers are interested in advertisers who value them. These advertisers support our community institutions and charities. Now I am appealing to you directly for your help to meet and exceed our fundraising goal to bridge the gap.As a community media outlet, we take our mission to serve our community seriously, asking difficult questions of our politicians, our nonprofits, and our own leaders and institutions. We may not get an answer, but we are compelled by our professionalism to pose the questions in an attempt at transparency and disseminating information. But holding the powerful to account is not the only function we serve.Over the decades, the BAR has been an advocate for our community, from the birth of the gay rights movement all the way to marriage equality and advocating for transgender rights. Our political coverage started when Harvey Milk was our first political columnist, before he was elected supervisor and replaced by longtime political watcher the late Wayne Friday. The BAR was the first LGBT community publication to unapologetically feature the leather community with a regular column by the legendary Marcus Hernandez (Mr. Marcus), and the first to publish obituaries with photos during the AIDS crisis.Throughout the years, the BAR focused on stories that mainstream media did not consider important: like anti-gay discrimination in employment and housing; bias and fear of people with HIV/AIDS; victims of abuse and anti-gay violence; the plight of at-risk youth; and the unmet needs of LGBT elders. Our articles have given voice to the vulnerable and are a record of our history. But only with your help, can the BAR continue to play this unique role.San Francisco will overcome this crisis. But what about our beloved Castro and LGBT community? What will it be like after this epidemic passes? We made it through the AIDS crisis by pulling together and that community spirit is necessary now. With the rise of anti-gay right-wing activists and authoritarian leaders, the need for a free LGBT press has never been greater, and with your help, the BAR is committed to serving our community and doing everything in our power to survive.That is why I am asking you to read the BAR regularly, visit eBAR.com, download our app, patronize our advertisers, but also make any contribution you can to help defray operating costs for the immediate future.San Francisco is one of 11 US cities that is fortunate to have a legacy LGBT publication by us, for us, and about us. Help preserve the BAR as an historic and important community institution for the future.Thank you for your continued support,Michael Yamashita, Publisher

story:
After publishing the book "We love you, Alice Cooper!" I got many positive feedbacks from you, from Alice Cooper (he had read our stories!) and all the guys from Alice's crew. Also I have received a lot of messages from fans, who wanted to be a part of this project and hadn't chance to do it.
So, I decided to do THE SECOND PART OF THE BOOK!
From the 1st of August till the 30th of September I will be collecting stories from fans about meets with Alice, about influence of his music on our lives and other things, connected with Alice Cooper, his amazing crew, with music and concerts. I am collecting also fan art and photos.
I need funds to publish this book - to pay translators because stories are in different languages, I am collecting them from the whole world. Of course I will be happy to send a copy of the book for each person who will donate $25 and help me publish this book!

story:
Short Summary

The humble toasted sandwich. Simple. Versatile. Universal. Amazing!
There's one thing that Robbie and Adam from Red FM's Big Breakfast have found  in the last two years...everyone loves a toastie! From childhood favourites to adulthood creations, the people of WA have embraced The Big Breakfast toasted sandwich movement and now it's time to repay the faith. We're taking this thing to the next level!
That's right - we're making a book!!  
Robbie and Adam's Toasted Sandwich Tuesday Recipe Book is ambitious, it's exciting and maybe even a little bit crazy... but the people have spoken and we must respond!
An easy task this will not be - countless ideas and recipes have come across our desk in the last two years - all worthy to appear in this jaffle bible. Sadly, we cant include everything, so we must choose the absolute cream of the crop, the jewels in the crown, the clutch players in the final 5 seconds. The most delicious, tasty, amazing recipes is what we're after and we need you to help us achieve this mountainous task.
 

What We Need & What You Get

The Big Breakfast boffins have crunched the numbers and the results are in. To recreate all recipes, photograph each toasty treasure, produce the book and provide the perks we need the princely sum of $7800.

To achieve this royal figure we have come up with some perks for our loyal #TST disciples. Help us achieve this sum and you will be regally rewarded with gifts that range from your name chronicled in this historic book - to full blown naming rights on-air.

This is the opportunity to have YOUR favorite recipe gracing the pages!

When all is said and done, Robbie and Adam believe they owe it to toasted sandwich lovers everywhere to make this happen. Lets be honest - if you love #TST then deep down you already know that you owe it to YOURSELF to be involved!! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can afford to help in monetary terms - we totally understand. But hey, you can help in other ways! Please by all means share our journey. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Blogging - please just share, share, share the TST movement!

story:
THE BOOK

This is a book about Los Angeles' Architecture, Streets & City told in stories by people at a time of significant urban change: The hills are for the first time in 60 years joined with the coast by a public railway line. Neighbourhoods will transform and the city is undergoing a cultural shift. We will document LA stories at this pivotal moment through the voice of local people and publish as a collection of written and visual essays. 

Our only rule: To tell Los Angeles’ stories using only public transport.

 

 

Packed with genuine humor and warmth it will be a book to treasure for its humanity as well as its documentary on architecture and neighbourhood development.

“Don't Laugh, the Metro Expansion to Santa Monica Is an Actual Success”
Hollywood Reporter 2016 by Peter Flax

The full extension of the expo line only just opened in May this year, which is why the timing of this book is now. Enough of the public transport network is now up and running to make it an essential part of everyday life for a growing number of people. The young are able to build an entirely different life to the older generation, which shifts urban and architectural demands and aspirations. Is a new kind of city emerging? This and many more questions will be addressed allowing moments and the idiosyncratic to paint a clear set of characteristics, issues and latent opportunities. Finding the spectacular in the mundane and the mundane in the spectacular. Example stories might be "Downtown Milk" mapping milk stories downtown (drawn & anecdotal - how does a city function?) & "The journey to Stalh house" account of journey through the people met along the way. 

Who is involved?

Contributions will come from renowned architects, artists, writers, cultural and civic institutions as well as the man, woman, friend of a friend encountered in a deli, street & neighbourhood. We are already talking to City Hall, Morphosis, Simon Sadler, Andrew Holmes & Peter Cook and so far all is very encouraging even if not yet definite. Paul Karakusuevic of Karakusuevic Carson will reflect on housing in his "a tale of two cities"(working title). 

Testimonial: " You've chosen a great topic, because public transport in LA is so unlikely, and its impact is a culture shock: LA will be reinvented." Simon Sadler, Professor in Architecture UCD

 

How will we do this?

As architects and architecture students from the uk, we will tell the stories through drawings, photography, film, interviews and other writing in a collection of ‘urban essays’.  We will in our fieldwork prompt reactions as much as answers in our interview and engagement techniques and learn from the works of Raynar Banham “Los Angeles, The Architecture of Four Ecologies”, Mike Davies “City of Quartz”, Venturi & Scott Brown “Learning from Las Vegas”, Paul Auster’s “True Tales of American Life” & Archis “Mokum” & “Beyroutes” (to name but a few). As outsiders we will develop an observant journalistic dialogue with Los Angeles and work together to reveal new detail about this forever fascinating city.

 

The book is for...

Los Angeles and for readers around the world interested in architecture, society and city development. The stories we tell will be based on LA’s own experiences as they are told to us. The language will celebrate the diversity we encounter and the architecture will be experienced in sequence with life as it happens around it.

WE NEED YOU

All funding will go directly towards facilitating first-hand interviews, the making of the book and its publication in hardcopy and digital versions. With your support we will create an excellent book which captures this moment celebrating LA as it is now. Any additional funding will go towards hosting an exhibition of the work in London and LA and fund a travelling lecture to universities and architecture practices.

 

When will it be ready?

We are aiming for a september 2017 publication, which will be the culmination of 4 years of research by Cultural Geometries lead by Christina Godiksen. Our first hand interviews and documentary of LA is planned for January 2017.  

image shows example of Tote design which is yet tbc. 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

First of all our gratitude for helping us make this happen! We will credit your contribution in our the book and you can buy the book here through our pre-sale. We have created a few gift packages which range from designed tote bags, posters, book and film. Everything is our own original work.  

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Please also share this with as many people you can, that would help us loads too. 

We have currently raised over £5000 with generous contributions from Weston Williamson and Karakusevic Carson Architects.

THE TEAM

Director/Editor:

Christina Godiksen - experienced architect and tutor, LA design review panelist. Founder of Cultural Geometries Research Community and CG Architecture ltd. 

“I have been going to LA for the past 3 years and seen visible change occurring year on year. As an outsider and visitor these changes appear perhaps starker and more tangible than to those who live in the change, which is why I believe that the ping pong we as a team can have in our direct engagement with the city, specific neighbourhoods and people, is critical in revealing a truly unique perspective which has not yet been documented. I will draw on my experience working with Archis on “Mokum” to direct the contributions and in my role as editor”

Graphic Editors:

Caroline Lundin  - Is the co-founder and director of Sundae Design Studio. She is currently also an associate lecturer at Oxford Brookes University, School of Architecture. She  likes colour and Sundae!

Sanaah Shaikh - Partner at Make, architect and associate lecturer at Oxford Brookes University, School of Architecture - Nothing escapes her eye. 

Authors:

We are a group of enthusiastic and energetic architects and architecture students from the School of Architecture at Oxford Brookes University, UK. Our Urban Essays will be drawn, photographed, filmed and written. 

 

Writing Team

Craig Ross -  Distinctly Average (in a good way)

Tegan Ramsey - Enjoys sewing, loves dogs.

Chris Fulton - Avid nerd, programmer and musician.

Sophia Ferraz - Bad jokes, good food.

Joshua Hyland - Either at in the studio or at Apres.

Alexandra Goodey - Wise, crazy granny.

 

Film Team

Havard Wallin - Cyclist, musician & wannabe adventurer.

Live Furustol - Loves nature and big cities.

Jim Santoni - French, hasn't been to America before.

Rodney Sihlangu - Basketball lover & cereal enthusiast.

 

Photography Team

Isaac Lockett - “What a great guy!” 

Una Ledaal - Norgwegian, sucker for Ben and Jerry’s

Julia Estrella - Eat, Sleep, Work, Repeat.

 

Drawing Team

Nick Bailey - Travel, Create, Design.

Elizaveta Romanova - Art Lover, Architecture survivor.

Hilton Murrell - Pretty underwhelming.

Millie Bryant - Country girl, tea addict.

Georgina Beng - Full of energy, travel lover.

 

Graphics Team

Tom Yudin - Ceramic art, architecture and makes mean mince pies

Hollie Allen - Illustrator, shopaholic & puppy enthusiast.

Max Collins - There's not mushroom for my bio, but I'm a fungi!

Dominik Scigala - Excited to see where that one episode of Gilmore Girls was shot.

story:
Private Government Education

Private government, in the form of monarchy or some other privately owned arrangement, is the only way to prevent our civilization from sliding downhill. For centuries, this was considered common sense among the greatest living minds. I'm writing a book on this topic written in a language highly accessible to intelligent and open-minded progressives, libertarians, and conservatives. It's already more than halfway done and I want your personal support for the final stretch.

  • “Democracy never lasts long. It soon wastes, exhausts and murders itself. There was never a democracy that did not commit suicide.”

    – John Adams, letter to John Taylor, 1814.

  • “Democracy has nothing to do with freedom. Democracy is a soft variant of communism, and rarely in the history of ideas has it been taken for anything else.”

    – Hans-Hermann Hoppe, "Reflections on State and War", 2006.

  • “Most importantly, I no longer believe that freedom and democracy are compatible.”

    – Peter Thiel, "Education of a Libertarian", 2009. 

  • “Democracy and liberty are not one but two.”

    – Henri Frederic Amiel, diary entry, 1865.

  • “The notion that tyranny evolves naturally from democracy can be traced back to the earliest political theorists.”

    – Erik von Kuehnelt-Leddihn, "Liberty or Equality", 1952. 

The United States government is on the road to falling to pieces, both due to financial problems and hyperpolarization between progressives and conservatives. Private government, either at the highest level or as a patchwork of smaller countries, is the only viable long-term fix. The book I am writing puts the crucial arguments for this in plain language. 

This is your chance to contribute personally towards the first major work in favor of private government that conveys arguments in a way that is clear and accessible to a general audience. I hope this book will be read and discussed by leading economists and political theorists, as some of my prior work has been. The objective is to increase the profile of serious arguments in favor of private government as a step on the road to actually implementing it. 

What I've Already Accomplished

Here's a quick list of what I've done for the cause of private government so far:

  • Released a short book A Critique of Democracy: A Guide for Neoreactionaries which received favorable reviews from various blogs and sold several hundred copies. Prominent readers include econblogger Arnold Kling. 
  • Coverage from TechCrunch in November 2013. 
  • Spirited responses and coverage from The American Conservative, The Ümlaut, The American Spectator, TakiMag, The Telegraph, Arnold Kling, Noah Smith, David Brin, Charlie Stross, and Scott Alexander. 
  • Co-founded the political theory blog More Right, one of the most influential outlets for promoting the cause of private governance. 
  • Wrote the Monarchy FAQ, the most straightforward and clearest refutation of common objections to monarchy online today. 

What I'm Working On

This call for support is both for funding the monarchy book I'm writing which is half-completed, as well providing a more solid basis for the group blog More Right. 

  • The monarchy book is called Monarchy: A Political Study. Over 2,000 pages of original research and 100 pages of writing have already been completed. The target length is 200 pages. Here is a sneak peak at the table of contents. 
  • More Right needs a more solid foundation for providing small stipends to talented writers. It needs to become a more serious center for private government advocacy. More Right gets about 20,000 views monthly but it should be 3-4 times that. 
  • Recent examples of writing: Monarchy and Existential Risk, Neoreactionary Accomplishments Series, David Boaz of Cato Thinks We Should Let Voters Earmark Their Taxes.
  • Further research and thinking for answering the "how do we get there from here" question of private governance. 
  • Preparation of materials for the eventual creation of a non-profit Institute for Private Government. 

What You Get For Support

Those who commit their support to this project will be publicly acknowledged, either under their real name or a pseudonym, for their contribution to the initiative for private government at its earliest historic stage, here in 2015. 

  • Those who contribute $15 or more will receive a copy of the ebook. 
  • Those who contribute $50 or more will receive a signed copy of the physical book.
  • Those who contribute $100 or more will receive an acknowledgement in the acknowledgements section of the book itself. 
  • Those who contribute $500 or more will be acknowledged in the Leaders' Circle for the Institute for Private Government when it is incorporated. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing publicly via this Indiegogo is the preferred method, but there are others:

  • Contribute privately by sending PayPal contributions to michaelanissimov@gmail.com. The same rewards outlined above are available to those who contribute funds before the end of May 2015. 
  • Contribute anonymously by Bitcoin to 1PH4k2QAqZ1zC8BnpZuBuMczQhmYUXz4BV. The same rewards apply to contributions made before the end of May 2015.

Those who contribute $100 or more will receive an acknowledgement in the acknowledgements section of the book itself. 
Those who contribute $500 or more will be acknowledged in the Leaders' Circle for the Institute for Private Government when it is incorporated.     Other Ways You Can Help  Contributing publicly via this Indiegogo is the preferred method, but there are others:  Contribute privately by sending PayPal contributions to michaelanissimov@gmail.com. The same rewards outlined above are available to those who contribute funds before the end of May 2015.  Contribute anonymously by Bitcoin to 1PH4k2QAqZ1zC8BnpZuBuMczQhmYUXz4BV. The same rewards apply to contributions made before the end of May 2015.

story:
About After Happily Ever After

Amazing life transformation during and after divorce! You won't want to miss the amazing things that happened!!!
I had always believed my Ex-wife and I would live happily ever after, that the troubles facing so many other people would bypass us in lieu of others who weren't "in love," but that bubble burst like a super nova and I fell hard.  
About ten years ago my wife left me and my world fell apart. I thought I would be paralyzed before I would ever be divorced. It just wasn't a word in my vocabulary and it wasn't something I could comprehend, but here I was, labeled and defined by something that happened to me. I wrestled with grief and forgiveness for years and during the time following my divorce I lost three grandparents, several huge projects, as well as my finances. I faced the near loss of my house and something I could never get back, time with my precious daughter. 
Like all of us who have experienced deep emotional trauma, I had a choice to make. I could wallow in self pity, remaining bitter and angry or I could choose the path of forgiveness and I could fight to heal. I chose the latter. I elected to heal and to love instead of hate, to forgive instead of remaining bitter. During the process I learned how I could actually overcome my struggles. I also learned there is a powerful force at work in our lives and that force is redemption. We are never too far from saving. This book is that amazing story!!!
Contributors funding, After Happily Ever After,  will be creating a book that encourages people, heals marriages, and may even save someones life. I have already completed the first draft, but I need to finish doing the rewrites. The money raised will help me pay my expenses, the artists for the cover art, and promotional material I need to create in order to find a good publisher. 

I am in a better place now then I ever was before. I am a better man, a better father and now a better husband (I recently remarried :). This is my story, the story of how I overcame my pain and even managed to thrive through it. I know my experiences and the things I learned are going to make a huge difference in our families and across our nation. I hope you will join me in changing someone's, After Happy Ever After. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise $5000.00. I have about two months worth of work left to do and I need money to help pay for expenses, for the artists to create the cover art and any promotional materials I will need to find a good publisher. IE Website, animation, video or graphics.

When you fund this book you will get a signed copy of the finished work when I get it published. If, for any reason, I cannot find a publisher I will self publish the book and get you a copy of the book, or a pfd of the book, depending on your level of investment. I'm sure you're thinking of someone right now who is going through divorce and needs this book. It'll make a great gift and you'll be investing in their future.

In the event I don't reach my goal I will still keep fighting to finish this book in any way I can. All of the proceeds will go toward that end, regardless of the amount I receive.

The Impact

After Happily Ever After, is a vitally important work. Our nation is suffering. We have two generations of fatherless families and that number is on the rise. Divorce is running rampant and over 50% of all marriages are ending this way. This book takes a good hard look at the causes of so much suffering and helps its readers work to find the healing and peace they need while navigating the many challenges they experience through this painful process. 

Risks & Challenges

Like all projects there is a certain degree of uncertainty and risk. However, the risks involving, After Happily Ever After are nominal. I have already finished the first draft of the book and with the help of my father, ten time published author David Crossman, I am certain it will be of the highest quality and caliber. 

Having spent the last two years working with Dave Ramsey as the content producer of the new online video channel I am well aware of what it takes to create compelling stories that change peoples lives under a high pressure situation. While  I was there I also made wonderful contacts in the publishing industry and already have my book being read by a number of very talented professionals.

The primary obstacle to this book is going to be distribution, whether by a publisher or if I go the self published route. The way to overcome this challenge will to be to continue to share and promote the work though social media, churches, news outlets, and public speaking events. I am prepared to do what it takes to get this message out and I am excited to see how far it goes. 

Honestly, part of it is really out of my hands. This story is much bigger than me.


Other Ways You Can Help

I would really appreciate your help in any way on this project. Even if you can't contribute financially, you can share the message with your friends and family. And, if you are a spiritually minded person, you can pray! 

There are a number of ways to share this campaign with others and Indy Gogo has a number of great tools you can use. Thank you for all your time and attention!!!

story:
Short Summary

Scion of the great Tiffany family of artisans and jewelers, and intimate friend of Sigmund and Anna Freud for decades, Dorothy Tiffany Burlingham's life story is nothing short of fascinating, especially as told by her grandson Michael John Burlingham. Our firm New Street, has published the book in a beautifully-produced audio edition, and now we are looking to pre-fund the creation of our elaborately illustrated eBook through greatly discounted pre-sales. 

Originally published in paper in 1989, Michael Burlingham's The Last Tiffany received great acclaim:

Burlingham's research, insight, and honesty guarantee that each reader will respond intensely: we can no more escape his family than our own. (The New Yorker)

Michael Burlingham ... gives his readers more than just a history of his famous grandmother's life. Rather, he has written a biography of the dream of dynasty. ...In a measured, evocative style, Burlingham's biography transcends its immediate subject. The story it tells is one of both the tragedies and regenerative powers of the family. (Chicago Tribune)

A drama set in a remarkable time in which New York City matured into an international metropolis, Sigmund Freud revolutionized Western thought, and Hitler rose and was crushed. ... This biography is rich in personal and historical detail. (The New York Times)


What We Need & What You Get

We, the publishing firm New Street Communications, are looking to raise a minimum of $2000 to fund creation of the eBook. 

The beautifully produced 14-hour audio edition already released has a retail value of $24.95. The significantly-illustrated eBook will be likewise be priced at $24.95 upon publication. 

Folks who pre-order or choose simply to support the project have three discount options:

  • At the $35 level you will receive the audiobook immediately and the eBook in November - a $49.90 value discounted down to $35
  • At the first of two $20.00 levels you will receive the eBook in November - a $24.95 value discounted down to $20.00
  • At the second of two $19.95 levels you will receive the audiobook only, but immediately - a $24.95 value discounted down to $20


The Impact

The importance of Dorothy's life cannot be overemphasized.

Born in 1891, Dorothy Tiffany was the last child in the long line of the famous Tiffany dynasty of jewelers and artisans. As was expected of the young heiress, Dorothy married a wealthy member of the American plutocracy, Dr. Robert Burlingham. But the lackluster life of wealthy young women in early 20th century America held little appeal for Dorothy. Leaving behind her socially prominent husband, she took her children and moved to Europe, where she underwent psychoanalysis with Sigmund Freud.

Dorothy and her children became Sigmund and Anna Freud's longterm houseguests and intimate friends, developing a unique and storied extended family relationship that remains fascinating for its depth and complexity. But Dorothy's quest for fulfillment and a rich inner life ultimately had tragic consequences for those who were dearest to her as she embarked on a path that ultimately led to their downfall.


Risks & Challenges

There really are no risks. Our firm New Street, founded 2005, is accomplished at the production of beautifully eBooks. The eBook will be created whether or not we meet our ideal goal, and all discounted pre-orders will be fulfilled.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word using Indiegogo share tools as well as your own social networks. We'd really appreciate that.
