story:
Here I Come, Baby Giant!

Hi there!  My name is Mica, but according to the little guy behind the curtain, my name is Gramouse!  I am the author of 'Baby Giant and the Chocolate Donuts', and Nolan Ray(Mouse) Burton is the three year-old idea man!

He took a journey one night while sleeping and awoke with an outlandish tale of a scary monster named Baby Giant that ate ALL the chocolate donuts!

As he shared the details of his visit, I realized we had a tale to tell.

I have had the passion to write a children's book for more years than I care to admit. Then  the story appeared!

I am a new author.  This is my first published book.  But guess what?  I already have a publisher!  I am so incredibly fortunate to have the backing and support of a first class publishing house that provides marketing support, first class editors, illustrators and major distribution companies.  

They provide distribution through independent book stores, major book stores, i.e. Barnes and Noble, Amazon, Kindle, Nook, etc.

Their authors support each other as a community rather than competing with one another...

So....you see...this is happening!  Baby Giant is ready to roar!

The Story...

In a dream one night, Nolan met Baby Giant, a scary monster who ate nothing but "all the chocolate donuts". He described where he lived and what he looked like, which included "owies" on his teeth, which Nolan said, were from eating nothing but chocolate donuts.  

I took the story from there...  

Nolan is a good eater, and by that I mean he loves his fruits and veggies, and his beverage of choice is water - no sweet drinks for him!  And the meat he eats is hormone and antibiotic free, organic and grass fed.   

He is not perfect, mind you!  He does love his Gran and Gramouse's birthday cakes - no spoon or icing necessary!   (I'm thinking the love outweighs the effects of the sugar....)  But he does know what makes his muscles big and strong (just ask him, he'll tell you) - fruits and veggies - and why Baby Giant has owies on his teeth - all the chocolate donuts.

Nolan loves going out into Gramouse's garden (that she planted with help from the rabbits and birds....) to forage for tomatoes and such.  He either eats them straightaway or gives them to his little brother, Carson!

He also loves cooking and baking.  He walks in my kitchen and is ready to bake a cake, BlendTec a smoothie or make juice!  

So, he decides to return to Baby Giant(with the help of his magic wand) and help him with his eating.  He knows Baby Giant is lazy and mean because of what he does and does not eat.  Baby Giant lives in a lush, fruitful land, so Nolan decides to show him all the neat things he can eat and drink (BG lives in a cave, and there is a free-flowing spring running through it).

Baby Giant learns and loves it!  He goes from donuts to do...nuts!

Why 'Baby Giant and the Chocolate Donuts'?

Monsters!  Dreams!  Green food! Nighttime travel!  Sugar, sugar, sugar!  Magic wand!  Self-reliance!  Brave guy!  

Only a fruit and veggie eating, sometime sugar eating, night travelling, monster-fearing, magic wand wielding, wise little boy could come up with this kind of mixed-up story!

Between the covers of 'Baby Giant and the Chocolate Donuts', one will discover the magic and beauty born in the travels of one spunky three year-old.  'Baby Giant and the Chocolate Donuts' is an inviting children's picture book that looks at all this crazy stuff and weaves it into one intriguing, humorous, informative, vibrant and colorful story with many powerful messages!  'Baby Giant' is a unique tale of wonder that pops right out of the pages, grabs and pulls you in to a place you will never want to leave!

There is a need to help children with their fears.  

There is a need to open new food doors for finicky eaters.

 There needs to be more ways to assist children  connect to their food.  

Children have a deep, spiritual side that must be better understood.  

Our world needs more folks practicing sustainability.  

'Baby Giant and the Chocolate Donuts' takes all of these and weaves them into a story that will live on in the hearts and minds of children for many years to come.

The story takes you from the safety of Nolan's bedroom, where the monsters have him frightened, to the land of 'Baby Giant' - a place where he will bring light, fun, health and magic to an otherwise grey, dull world. 

"WE CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN...WE CAN CHANGE THE WORLD NOW....WE CAN SAVE THE CHILDREN....WE CAN MAKE IT BETTER".....Robert Lamm and the band Chicago, thank you!

How Your Precious Contribution Will Be Utilized

A major portion of the funds will go to the publishing house for the illustrating, marketing, editing, printing and distribution.  

There is also the cost of producing, purchasing and packaging of the special perks being offered to our generous supporters.

There will be costs of travelling to book signing events, and you know I will not be able to go without Nolan!  (No, Mom....get back to work...it's just Gramouse and Nolan on this adventure!!)

Then the second printing, and living expenses (this clean living is not a cheap venture....) and such, as well as the next Nolan adventure, because I am sure he is just beginning! 

Risks & Challenges

The risks are minimal...this book is being published!  Again, how fortunate am I to already have a publisher, as a new author?!

Honestly, my challenge is to be able to sustain myself through this total dedication to making this happen.  There you have it.....

 Together, we CAN make a difference...and Nolan and Baby Giant are ready to lead their own parade!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are anything like me, times can be tough.  So, what can you do?

Happy thoughts - powerful energy there!  

Share this with others....spread the word!

And please, let me know you are out there...you never know what surprises await your behind-the-scenes support....

story:
*For a gallery of images available click here.


QUIEN SOY? - WHO AM I?

Carlos Cazalis es un fotógrafo profesional dedicado principalmente a trabajos documentales a largo plazo. Hago esto porque creo que es la mejor manera de obtener una mayor profundidad y perspectiva a sobre los temas que elijo. He sido galardonado con algunos premios internacionales y mi trabajo ha sido publicado y exhibido internacionalmente. El trabajo que les presento, es un foto libro que tardo siete años (2007-2015) en producirse. Hizo falta tiempo porque era imprescindible asegurar que una serie de eventos históricos se completarán en España, Francia y México.

Carlos Cazalis is a professional photographer dedicated to long-term documentary projects. I do this because I think it's the best way to gain a greater depth and perspective on the issues that I choose. I have been awarded several international awards and my work has been published and exhibited internationally. The work I present here to you is photography book that took seven years (2007-2015) to occur. It took this time because it was imperative to ensure that a number of historical events would be completed in Spain, France and Mexico.

Mis orígenes son de una familia muy taurina de Aguascalientes, México con tres generaciones de matadores, pero yo elegí fotografiar en vez de matar por la admiración a la imagen donde comprendí  una filosofía, humanidad y ritual. Sin embargo no me considero taurino, pero esto es una parte de mi historia.

My origins are from a taurine family in Aguascalientes, Mexico with three generations of matadors, but I chose to photograph instead, through the admiration of the image where I realized there was a profound philosophy, humanity and ritual. However I do not consider myself a bullfighting advocate, but this is a part of my story.

Jerez de la Frontera, 16 de Mayo de 2009

PROYECTO: SANGRE DE REYES - BLOOD OF KINGS

Voy a producir 2,000 copias de un foto libro intimo y fuerte sobre la aceptación de la muerte y que con su practica se aprende a vivir plenamente. Para contar esta historia hay dos personajes, uno es el matador José Tomás, quien además de ser considerado el último gran matador, es una persona intrigante que tarde a tarde a demostrando que estaba dispuesto a morir haciendo lo que mas amaba. Con esta pasión fue demostrando lentamente y toreando cada vez menos que vivir es saber morir. El otro personaje es el toro de lidia, un bellísimo animal, con una profunda nobleza a quien amamos por su existencia pero que sin embargo hacemos llegar a su muerte.

I will produce 2,000 copies of a photography book that is intimate and strong about the acceptance of death and that in this practice one learns to live fully. To tell this story there are two characters, one is the matador Jose Tomas, who besides being considered the last great matador, is an intriguing persona who in presentation after presentation shows that he is ready to die doing what he loves most. Through his passion he has slowly and bullfighting less and less to shown us that live is to know how to die. The other character is the bull, a very beautiful animal with a deep nobility whom we love for it’s existence but nevertheless we take him onto to his death.   

Con sus contribuciones, voy a imprimir y distribuir un foto libro, de alta calidad, con una impresión inconfundible, distribuido a nivel internacional por la editorial Catalana/Mexicana, la Editorial RM. Es un asunto económicamente, un poco caro, pero es la única manera de garantizar algo de calidad, durabilidad y de transcendencia digna de la historia y sus personajes que han ido mas allá de sus limites.

With your contributions, I will print and distribute this photo book at the highest quality, with an unmistakable printing and distributed internationally by the Catalan / Mexican publisher, Editorial RM. It is a bit pricey, but it's the only way to ensure something of quality, durability and significance worthy of the story and characters that have gone beyond their limits.

QUIEN PARTICIPA - WHO'S WHO

El libro cuenta con la colaboración de tres autores muy distintos y de gran estilo: el francés Jacques Durand, ex cronista del diario Liberation escribiendo de la pasión y sueño de ver a Tomás, el mexicano José Cueli, psicoanalista y ex cronista del diario La Jornada en una filosófica poesía y finalmente el escritor norte americano y corresponsal de guerra Jon Lee Anderson, hablando del guerrero. Un elemento mas de literatura nos da pausas de reflexión, son extractos facsimile del libro Pagan Spain  del ganador del Pulitzer, Richard Wright, con sus primeras impresiones de la inconfundible majestuosidad y fuerza del toro.

The book has the support of three very different and stylish authors: the French Jacques Durand, a former columnist for the newspaper Liberation writing on passion and the dream of seeing Jose Tomas, the Mexican Jose Cueli, psychoanalyst and former columnist for the Mexican daily La Jornada in a philosophical poetry and finally the North American writer and war correspondent from the New Yorker, Jon Lee Anderson, speaking of the warrior. Another element of literature that will provides us a pause for reflection, are excerpts from the book Pagan Spain, by the Pulitzer prize writer, Richard Wright, with his first impressions of the unmistakable majesty and power of the bull.

Finalmente el libro esta editado por el editor francés de Campos y Ruedos, François Bruschet y la curador mexicana Patricia Mercado y diseñado por las diseñadoras de N2Estudio en Madrid. 

Finally, the book is edited by François Bruschet, French editor of the online magazine Campos Y Ruedos and by Patricia Mendoza, Mexican curator. Two committed designers from the N2Estudio.com in Madrid have put the final touches.
QUE BUSCAMOS. - WHAT WE SEEK

De ustedes los contribuyentes solicitamos $22,500 USD, Necesitamos otros $11,250 USD que vendrán a través de un inversionista independiente. Todo, esta dirigido a la impresión y distribución del libro. La Editorial RM se caracteriza y esta bien reconocida por su alta distribución. Ustedes de todos modos serán beneficiados de la siguiente manera.

From you the contributors we are requesting $22,500 USD, we will need another $ 11.250 USD which will come through an independent investor. All this will be used for printing and distribution of the book. Editorial RM is recognized for its high distribution. In any case you will benefit in the following manner. 

PREMIOS - AWARDS

Todos los contribuyentes aparecerán en el libro en una pagina de agradecimientos, así mismo en cualquier exposición que se haga a futuro, de la cual también serán notificados y considerados como invitados especiales.

Ustedes podrán contribuir de la siguientes maneras:

1. Una serie de cinco postales firmadas del proyecto Sangre de Reyes.


2. He creado una serie de impresiones numeradas y firmadas. Todas impresas en inyección de tinta (a nueve tintas) sobre papel de algodón Hahnemuhle de 300 gramos. Todas las fotografías será impresas bajo mi exclusiva supervisión en el laboratorio Imagenes Vanguardistas. 

3. Trípticos. He creado dos trípticos, donde cada imagen mide 20x17 cm. pero ustedes pueden crear el suyo.

All contributors will appear in an acknowledgments page in the book, additionally in any exhibition to be done in the future, for which you will also be notified and invited as special guests.
You can contribute in the following ways
1. A series of five signed postcards on the project Blood of Kings. 

2. I have created a series of numbered and signed prints. All of them are inkjet prints (nine colors) on Hahnemuhle cotton paper of 300 grams. All photographs will be printed under my exclusive supervision in the laboratory Imagen Vanguardistas.

3. Tryptics. I've created two triptychs, with each individual image measuring 20x17 cm. but you can create your own.

*El costo de envío es por separado y ronda, dependiendo del servicio de envío y el destino en los $50 USD.

Prints sizes available as follows: 17x21 cm; 28x35 cm, 50x60 cm and 100x75 cm.  * Shipping costs are separate, depending on shipping service and the destination but round in the $50 USD

Tríptico Nuñez del Culvillo, 60 x 17 cm. 


Valencia, Bayonne, Barcelona, 17 x 48 cm.


Toro Nuñez del Culvillo. Impresión de 100x73 cm. 

IMPACTO - IMPACT

Confío plenamente que el libro Sangre de Reyes tendrá un impacto importante, tanto en el mundo taurino como en el de la fotografía. Como pueden ver el libro narra la transcendencia y el impacto que ha tenido José Tomas en los últimos siete años. Muchas de las fotografías que se incluyen son de tardes históricas, especialmente en Barcelona el 7 de Julio de 2009 con la encerrona de seis toros, así como la ultima corrida que se llevo a cabo en dicha plaza antes de su cierre el 25 de Septiembre de 2011. Estuvimos en su regreso a Valencia en el 2011. Estamos en Nimes, Francia en 2011 y 2012 con la encerrona de seis toros que tuvo 11 orejas, 1 rabo y un indulto. Finalizamos este pasado 2 de Mayo de 2015 con su reencuentro después de la casi trágica tarde del 2010 en Aguascalientes, México. También incluimos a Jerez de la Frontera, Alicante, Huelva, Gijón, Burgos, Linares y Bayona.

I trust that the book Blood of Kings will have a significant impact, both in the bullfighting world and in photography. As you can see the book tells the importance and the impact Jose Tomas has had in the last seven years. Many of the photographs here included are historical evenings, especially in Barcelona on July 7, 2009 with the six bulls and the last bullfight that took place in the plaza before its closure on 25 September 2011. We were with him in his return to Valencia in 2011. We were in Nimes, France in 2011 and 2012 with the six bulls that had 11 ears, one tail and a pardon. We ended this past May 2, 2015 with the reunion after that near tragic afternoon of 2010 in Aguascalientes, Mexico. We also include Jerez de la Frontera, Alicante, Huelva, Gijon, Burgos, Linares and Bayonne.

Nadie sabe por seguro cuando y si es que volverá José Tomás a torear. Yo confío en que nunca habrá una despedida, pero siento que el ha ido de mas a menos presentaciones. El libro por lo tanto marca momentos cumbres en fotos, todas ellas detalladas al final del libro con fechas y lugares.

Nobody knows for sure when and if Jose Tomas will return to bullfighting. I know there will never be a farewell, but I feel he has gone from more to less presentations. The book therefore mark a high points with the images, all of which are  detailed at the end of the book with dates and places.

Mucho del trabajo que aparece en el libro fue publicado internacionalmente en diarios como The New York Times, El País, y revistas como Le Monde, Le Fígaro, Newsweek Japón, International Herald Tribune, Sports Illustrated y Vanity Fair.

Much of the work on the book was published internationally in newspapers like The New York Times, El Pais, and magazines such as Le Monde, Le Figaro, Newsweek Japan, International Herald Tribune, Sports Illustrated and Vanity Fair.

The New York TImes, 1 de Octubre de 2009

Newsweek Japón, 1 4 de Abril de 2010

RETOS - CHALLENGES

No ha sido fácil llegar hasta aquí. He tenido que hacer varios viajes a Europa y México. Obtener los pases de a cada corrida siempre fue un malestar que no se apaciguo hasta que tenia el pase en mano. Sin embargo creo que todo el trabajo ha valido la pena. Debido a la delicadeza y muchas veces controversia del tema del libro ha sido especialmente difícil encontrar apoyos y es por eso que ahora busco el de los aficionados, porque al igual que ustedes, nos hemos arriesgado y viajado largas distancias para presenciar aquello que nos mueve en el interior. Si la colaboración de ustedes no nos rinde lo suficiente, yo seguiré buscando el apoyo economico para poder presentar el libro con la Editorial RM en Paris Photo en noviembre 2015, nuestro objetivo final, pero debemos ir a imprenta ya!

It was not easy to get here. I had to make several trips to Europe and Mexico. Get passes for each bullfight was always a stressful situation that was not appeased until I had the pass in hand. However, I believe that all the work was worth it. Due to the delicacy and often controversial theme of the book it has been especially difficult to find support and that is why we now reach out to the aficionados, because like you, we have risked and traveled long distances to witness what moves us. If with your cooperation the goals here are not meet, I'll keep looking for financial support to present the book to the Editorial RM in Paris Photo in November 2015, our ultimate goal, but we need go to press now to reach the deadline.

CIERRE - CLOSE

Si no pueden contribuir por cualquier razón les agradecería que compartieran el enlace con cualquier conocido suyo. Pueden utilizar las herramientas de Indiegogo para compartir el enlace en redes sociales.

Muchas gracias!

If you can not contribute for any reason I would appreciate your shared this link with any acquaintance. You can copy the link or use the tools provided by Indiegogo to share the link on social networks.

Thank you!

Le Figaro, 8 de Julio de 2009

story:
I've thought long and hard before choosing this route, but transitioning is an expensive  and financially daunting process which has proved to be a difficult process to handle alone.  So I am asking you, all of those who support trans identities and the loyal readers of my blog The Cis Jungle to help me in navigating this cis world. Please help me fund my transition which includes continuing hormone replacement therapy and a very expensive genital reconstructive surgery including the costs which come with it (i.e. travel,recovery, electrolysis). And what an amazing story it would be to say America has literally helped me pay for my vajayjay! As much or as little as you can or would like to contribute would be AMAZING!  Thanks for your Support!

All extra funding will be used to support trans women of color in their quest to transition.

Be sure to visit thecisjungle.wordpress.com for great topics and updates on my transition!

Short Summary

I am James Terzian. Author of the Lord of Shadows Rises. This fund raising is to raise money for marketing of my novel the Lord of Shadows Rises and the sequel 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will go fro my book Marketing, I am self published amd I have to do all of the leg work. Thuis will help

10 dollars will get My first book and will be mentioned in sequel book.

20 Dollar get the First book signed. Mentioned

30 Dollar get above plus sequel.

40 Dollar get both books signed.

Both books are finished just some tweaking 

The Impact

It will help an inspiring writers. Will share books and the joy of reading. It will also send messages that you can fight your disability like I have with my learning disability. 

Where the money goes

The fund will go strictly for marketing, including trade shows, books fairs. Getting some review for my book from Kirkus, and other respectable indie reviewers.

It might go for stuff like trinket I might need made and marketing materials, business card, book marks and other goody. It will go all to marketing. All contributor will get at least a mug 

Risks & Challenges

The risk are it just might not sell or might fall short in my marketing strategies.

Challenge is my learning Disability and my weakness in Grammar and tenses 

How you can help 

If you don't contribute at least support not only me but many other indie author so we can share our love for writing, creativity and reading. Buy my book or another self published author

story:
About this Campaign 

Literature is something we all go back to from time to time. The feeling when we can't put down a book is priceless. Books brings us to new worlds that have to be discovered where we can build our own fortresses that are keeping us safe from cruel world around us.

My name is Stevan Mijailovic, but I more known to my readers under my pen name Marat M'saev Daan and I am poet and writer from Serbia. I am writing for 11 years now and have 5 published books in Serbian, 3 in English and 1 in Spanish, all published via CreateSpace.

At the moment I have thousands of readers via social networks, especially on Facebook in various groups, and many of them ask me when I will publish my books in a traditional way so they can buy them in bookstores. I was thinking a lot about their request and have decided that it is time to finally find a traditional publisher.

I have tried to find some companies to sponsor me, but in the end everything circles around politics which is not willing to help new authors to spread their art. This has forced me to turn to individuals who love and support art with all of their hearts.

I am kind of person that is always helping other authors to spread the word about their art and I hope that Indiegogo community will help me as well to fulfill my dreams to publish my books in Serbian.


Funding and Perks

Funding

Goal for this project has been set to be 3.000$. 2.500$ will be for printing books where each book will be printed in 300 copies (1500 copies in total). All books will be in Serbian, although for English speaking contributors, there will be perks that are connected to books in English. However, if we collect more than what is set to be our goal, number of copies may go up per title.

Remaining 500$ are reserved for promotions here in Serbia. At the moment I have deals for promotions in 2 of 4 biggest cities, although I will continue with negotiations for remaining two cities. 

Perks

Virtual high 5 (1$)

  • I am very thankful to You! High 5!!

Small Supporter (5$)

  • Thank You for Your support! You are truly a good person and I thank You from the bottom of my heart!

Medium Supporter (15$)

  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page

Big Supporter (25$)

  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page
  • Your name will be listed in all five books I am publishing. People should know how great You are!

Huge Supporter (30$)

  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page
  • Your name will be listed in all five books.
  • We will have a Skype video chat

Small Art Lover (50$)

  • You will get one of my books of Your choice that will be signed and shipped to You 
  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page
  • Your name will be listed in all five books
  • We will have a Skype video chat
  • Your name will be in the list of Contributors in all five books!

Medium Art Lover (100$)

  • You will get three of my books of Your choice that will be signed and shipped to You
  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page
  • Your name will be listed in all five books
  • We will have a Skype video chat
  • Your name will be in the list of Contributors in all five books!

Big Art Lover (150$)

  • You will get all five of my books that will be signed and shipped to You
  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page
  • Your name will be listed in all five books
  • We will have a Skype video chat
  • Your name will be in the list of Contributors in all five books!

Huge Art Lover (500$)

  • You will get five signed sets of all my books  
  • Your picture will be in my "Contributors" album on my Facebook page
  • Your name will be listed in all five books I am publishing
  • We will have a Skype video chat
  • Your name will be in the list of Contributors in all five books! 
NOTE:
  • If You are an English speaking person, all books written in English that will be sent to You will be from CreateSpace since here in Serbia there is no use to publish them in English, unfortunately.
  • 4th and 5th book are not translated into English at the moment but will be in next two months.

About my books and short descriptions

All five books that are in this project are poetry written in free verse. Each book has it's own theme for it's poems written in my own unique style. I was writing about all kind of feelings and emotions from joy and happiness, to the pain and death. What makes my poems unique is that reader has to think about them after reading and feel them with one's soul.

Here you can find examples of my poems and one review of my 3rd book "Moonchild's Smile":

  • Example of poems
  • Review 

Moment of Truth (Trenutak Istine)

There’s always been some thinking. Self-knowledge or knowledge of the environment? It often doesn’t matter. Time periods are different, the question is do we recognize them. Our desires, our needs, our truths, it takes courage to admit to ourselves that after a long night, a new sun is born. One story after another, our lives go with hope for a better future. That’s our moment of truth.


Carnival of Rust (Karneval Rđe)

Pain, sorrow, anger, passion are emotions that moved writer to start writing this book. Sometimes, when we are cornered and don’t know what to do we have those emotions and want to burn the whole world. A moment later like rain is falling all over us and we feel like unprotected robots exposed to ones nemesis creating of us “Carnival of rust”.


Moonchild's Smile (Osmeh Mesečevog Deteta)

Love, often is just another unattainable term that fears us. White light is waiting for us somewhere at the end of the tunnel that provides only over needed tenderness. It is up to us to acknowledge and accept is as it is because it brings us smile on our faces every morning while giving us strength to step into new day.


Feather in the Well (Pero u Bunaru)

Insurgence, one of the biggest obstacles for the expansion of horizons. Teenage days and worldviews that are inherent for people of that age. Love, family, friends, life, everything boils down to two colors, black and white with possible shades of gray, though learning to see the whole range of colors and finding tiny little things that make us happy in the way of growing up and forming a complete personality.


Musical Lines (Notne Linije)

Sixty poems, with musical steps, make a lavish dance. The poems are written in free verse, some swaying, they are not constrained by any rhyme nor imperative detailed descriptions and explanations, they begin and end where the thought is. Poet allows words to magically and smoothly sail on paper, allowing the reader to unearth his world and reach into the depths of his soul. In strong and striking images of his poetry transforms various expressions of experiences, especially that of direct and ones that is completely individualized as well. Emphasized visual notes, joined with written imagination makes author’s poems confusion of genre series in which the reality, at the same time, evokes and overcomes.



Risks & Challenges

There are no risks for this project since I do have a publisher and a company that will print the books. I have already arranged everything with both companies so the only missing link in whole project is funding it.

I have set 30 days for this project since the challenge is to have printed books till the end of September current year. Reason for this is to have promotions I have mentioned earlier before Book Fair in Belgrade where my books should appear. Although, I don't see it as a race against time since books should be printed in two to three weeks top, so there is enough time to fulfill all plans before the "big event".


Other Ways You Can Help

If You are not able to contribute financially for this project, please, share it with Your friends, maybe they can. For any kind of support that You may provide to me, I am thankful from the bottom of my heart for helping me fulfill one of my biggest dreams!

My name is Stevan Mijailovic, but I more known to my readers under my pen name Marat M'saev Daan and I am poet and writer from Serbia. I am writing for 11 years now and have 5 published books in Serbian, 3 in English and 1 in Spanish, all published via CreateSpace.
At the moment I have thousands of readers via social networks, especially on Facebook in various groups, and many of them ask me when I will publish my books in a traditional way so they can buy them in bookstores. story:
• Greetings, my name is Jennifer Word. I am the founder and owner of EMP Publishing. We are a new independent publisher, just outside of Los Angeles, CA. We have a small but strong Team of associate editors, artists and cover designers. I am also the Senior Editor for the company, with over five years experience working as a professional editor for various independent imprints.

 Jennifer Word-Managing Editor of EMP Publishing


  • This campaign is simple. We'd like to build up a steady readership, already in place, before the inaugural issue of the CCQ is released. We'd also love to raise enough funding to increase the current $25 per story payment to authors by as much as we can (obviously, that would depend on how much we can raise, which is why I've chosen flexible funding for this campaign). But let me explain in finer detail:
  • EMP Publishing recently launched an open call for our first anthology: Creepy Campfire Stories (for Grownups). The call was so successful, we were able to fill a 65,000 word anthology with the most amazing horror stories, featuring 19 incredibly talented authors. But a lot of other great writers didn't make the cut, not because their stories weren't good enough, but because we simply ran out of room (and budget) for a bigger book.
  • That is when I realized that Creepy Campfire Stories (CCS) had incredible franchise potential. So, the idea was hatched, and the new Creepy Campfire Quarterly (CCQ) was born. With our tight budget, the new quarterly anthology can only pay writers $25 per story and one contributor's copy, but this has not dissuaded authors from submitting. The maiden issue of CCS, slated for release on January 20, 2016, already has 16 incredible authors and stories lined up, with over 65,000 words of awesome and creepy horror.
  • We've got tons of authors submitting to the new quarterly. What we need now are dedicated readers. I'd like to launch into the first year of the CCQ's life with a steady readership in place, and build from there. So, again, this campaign is utterly simple: There are only four perks, including one year subscriptions to the CCQ for a flat rate of $55, and a two year subscription to the CCQ for a flat rate of $100.
  • Since the CCQ was born out of the amazing success of the original Creepy Campfire Stories (for Grownups) Anthology, slated for release on October 20, 2015, offers of that book for order now, are another available perk.
  • The Creepy Campfire Stories (for Grownups) Anthology was such a success, we've just launched NEXT October's 2nd annual Creepy Campfire Stories (for Grownups) SCIENCE FICTION horror edition! It is slated for release on October 25, 2016, and that is also available to order now, as a perk.
  • All funding raised through this campaign will be used to improve EMP Publishing's projects, namely the CCQ (Creepy Campfire Quarterly), by directly funneling into higher payments for the authors. We'd love to be able to, minimum, raise the $25 per story payment, for example, up to $50 or better. We can reach that initial goal with just $1000 funding raised. We could reach that with only 18 one-year subscriptions, or 10 two-year subscriptions! I know we can do this! I am confident we can reach at least the minimum goal, if not decently beyond.

All that's left now is to show off some of the incredible cover designs by EMP Publishing's resident cover designer, Ms. Fatlind Colaku. She has designed both covers for the CCS editions, and will be our designer for ALL of the CCQ covers as well. Take a look at her work:


So, that's it. Are you a lover of horror fiction? EXTREME horror fiction? Science Fiction? The CCQ publishes all sub genres of horror, including: science fiction, speculative, magical, fantasy, paranormal, supernatural, psychological, historical, Urban Legend, Original Creepy Pasta, mystical, Occult and extreme. We may even be inclined to throw a little creepy poetry in, now and again. If any of that sounds appealing to readers out there, seriously consider supporting the new CCQ (as well as the CCS Anthologies) and EMP Publishing by ordering a one or two-year subscription to the CCQ, or order a copy of either (or both) of the CCS Anthologies.

  • Again, we're hoping to raise at least $1000, specifically to increase payments to authors, and generally fund the publication costs of the CCQ. Each issue currently costs approximately $500-$600 to produce. Without more funding raised, the payment cannot go any higher than the current $25 per story to authors.
  • This campaign is the ONLY way we can currently offer subscriptions to the quarterly publication OR sell copies of the Anthologies before their release.
  • Even if we don't reach $1000, ANY funds raised will lower the expenditure out of the EMP Publishing account, and we would be able to factor a smaller increase in pay to the authors (instead of raising to $50 per story, we could still raise payment to $35, or $40 per story), for example.


  • I cannot impress upon readers how intricately vital it would be to already have a strong readership in place, as well as several CCQ subscribers, to launch into the Quarterly's first year as a regular publication. Every subscriber would be a vital lifeline to ensuring the success and longevity of the quarterly anthology.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, we completely understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks (especially readers, and, in particular, lovers of horror and sci fi) to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Even if you can't order a book or subscription, maybe you could spread word about our campaign on your FB or Twitter page? We'd be humbly grateful if you did.
  • It's easy to spread the word about our campaign with one click, using the Indiegogo share tools! Look for them on this page, they link to Facebook, Twitter and other social sites.

And that's all there is to it. See? Simple. Thank you to anyone and everyone that supports this campaign, I cannot express to you enough, my never ending gratitude and thanks!!

story:
BECOMING JEWISH: Short Summary

Help me start a spiritual movement centered on kindness, compassion, tolerance, equality and Tikkun Olam (a call to heal and repair the world).  

BECOMING JEWISH is a memoir about my relationship with spirituality and religion throughout my wonderful and turbulent life, from Catholicism to Christianity, new-age spirituality focused on nature, atheism, "higher power" as presented in the 12 steps - AA (Alcoholics Anonymous), to Judaism. 

As a former journalist, I am usually the last person I would ever consider writing about, but after starting a blog (kowalskikibitz.com) during my Jewish studies (eventually leading to my conversion), I received a lot of positive feedback and intrigue from my readers. You can read the summary here: Who is Eva Kowalski?

I began writing the first chapter of my memoir earlier this year when a NY literary agent expressed interest in the project. However, I was unable to obtain an advance and unfortunately, as a struggling bohemian writer, it will not be possible for me to write this book without your support.

I take writing very seriously and it's impossible to write an entire book whilst working full-time. I pride myself on being detailed and accurate, which requires a lot of hours in research and cross-referencing. So in order to shape this project into its utmost best, I'll need to give it the time and attention that it deserves. I have accounted for all the costs and this is the bare minimum that I need to get started. I will still continue working part-time of course...unless the seas part and my campaign does exceptionally well, enabling me to focus solely on this project. :)

So why is it important for me to write this book? I've mulled over this question many times, thinking, maybe it's not worth it. I'm kind of embarrassed asking for money. I should just stick to writing corporate brochures or ghostwriting on a passionless topic. Do I really want to reveal myself? But then I realized, I'm Jewish now! I have chutzpah! Plus this is an important story with so many crucial themes and turning points dealing with faith, overcoming adversity, survival, struggle, finding hope and discovering that love really is everything. It's not just about words on a page, I want to create a piece of literature that inspires a humanitarian movement of kindness, compassion, tolerance, equality and Tikkun Olam (a call to heal and repair the world). 

Tikkun Olam & Masada


I have covered many different topics as a former journalist and I can identify a story worth being told - this is one of them. I was born in Poland, but raised in Australia after immigrating with my mother at the age of three, in an attempt to escape the communist regime of the early eighties. Despite the fact that a majority of Jews had lived in Poland for centuries leading up to one of the worst human crimes in history (the Holocaust), I never knew what a Jew was and had never met a Jewish person, till I was 24-years old, working as a military journalist for the U.S. Navy in Chicago. I interviewed a Rabbi who was in the Chaplain's Department (for several articles including "A Rabbi's Perspective on the Holocaust" during the Days of Remembrance and an article on the Festival of Sukkot). I befriended the Rabbi Lieutenant and from there my fascination with Judaism began.

Since then I have overcome an existential crisis and converted to Judaism, traveled to Israel and Amsterdam, where I visited the Anne Frank museum/hideaway. Also to Poland to the site of the concentration camp in Auschwitz. I have been exposed to Jewish history serendipitously through my travels. It's as though Judaism subtly weaved its way into my life with little effort from me. 

I have seen and experienced much in my life and spirituality and religion have had a huge impact on my emotional growth and identity.  Prior to Judaism, I didn't always have the right coping skills and at one point had lost the desire to live entirely. I toyed with danger and had been broken to the point of having no standards for anything, let alone myself. Judaism has provided me with a philosophy for living, a way of being and moving forward in this world with good intentions. It has also provided me with the skill-set to navigate through life in the midst of uncertainty and opposition. It's so easy to get lost during one of life's transitions or unforeseen circumstances when your beliefs are clouded and you don't have a moral code to follow or live by. My memoir, "Becoming Jewish" has the potential to change the way people view spirituality and religion. At the minimum, I hope it will inspire & awaken! 

I have always aspired to write a memoir and now I finally feel I have the right story to tell. Please support me on this journey! Even sharing this link with others is a huge help! Thank-you so much! Shalom! 

My Story...


What We Need & What You Get

I'm trying to raise the funds to support the writing of this book for the next 6-months. I have an agent interested, but I'm also willing to self-publish if for whatever reason it doesn't work out. So you will get a copy of the final printed book, guaranteed! 

The funds will also help with the cost of online promotion, advertising, proofreading and editing, and possibly printing. I'm planning for this memoir to reach epic heights, so I'm being very conscientious in currently building an online following and doing everything I can to get the word out. 

Even if you are unable to pledge, please support by sharing this link and make sure to follow me on Twitter and Facebook.  Also, to read more about my journey to Judaism, please visit my blog kowalskikibitz.com

I have great taste (only. partially. kidding.) and therefore some great perks  if you are able to support this campaign, including a Recycled "Absolut" Glass Mezuzah, chic LUCITE  dreidels, and original Jewish-themed photography  by artist/photographer Arick Maurice (will arrive autographed).  

      

Risks & Challenges

The biggest threat that I can foresee: well, there has been a resurgence of Anti-Semitism recently, particularly in parts of Western Europe, so writing on the topic of Judaism has the potential to spotlight me. Hopefully, I don't end up on some kind of hate list. However, it is also my hope to present a more liberal and objective perspective on Judaism that may dispel some of the biases and myths concerning Jews.  

Do a Mitzvah! Other Ways You Can Help

story_txt:
BECOMING JEWISH: Short Summary
Help me start a spiritual movement centered on kindness, compassion, tolerance, equality and Tikkun Olam (a call to heal and repair the world).  
BECOMING JEWISH is a memoir about my relationship with spirituality and religion throughout my wonderful and turbulent life, from Catholicism to Christianity, new-age spirituality focused on nature, atheism, "higher power" as presented in the 12 steps - AA (Alcoholics Anonymous), to Judaism. 
As a former journalist, I am usually the last person I would ever consider writing about, but after starting a blog (kowalskikibitz.com) during my Jewish studies (eventually leading to my conversion), I received a lot of positive feedback and intrigue from my readers. You can read the summary here: Who is Eva Kowalski?
I began writing the first chapter of my memoir earlier this year when a NY literary agent expressed interest in the project. However, I was unable to obtain an advance and unfortunately, as a struggling bohemian writer, it will not be possible for me to write this book without your support.
I take writing very seriously and it's impossible to write an entire book whilst working full-time. I pride myself on being detailed and accurate, which requires a lot of hours in research and cross-referencing. So in order to shape this project into its utmost best, I'll need to give it the time and attention that it deserves. I have accounted for all the costs and this is the bare minimum that I need to get started. I will still continue working part-time of course...unless the seas part and my campaign does exceptionally well, enabling me to focus solely on this project. :)
So why is it important for me to write this book? I've mulled over this question many times, thinking, maybe it's not worth it. I'm kind of embarrassed asking for money. I should just stick to writing corporate brochures or ghostwriting on a passionless topic. Do I really want to reveal myself? But then I realized, I'm Jewish now! I have chutzpah! Plus this is an important story with so many crucial themes and turning points dealing with faith, overcoming adversity, survival, struggle, finding hope and discovering that love really is everything. It's not just about words on a page, I want to create a piece of literature that inspires a humanitarian movement of kindness, compassion, tolerance, equality and Tikkun Olam (a call to heal and repair the world). 

Tikkun Olam & Masada



I have covered many different topics as a former journalist and I can identify a story worth being told - this is one of them. I was born in Poland, but raised in Australia after immigrating with my mother at the age of three, in an attempt to escape the communist regime of the early eighties. Despite the fact that a majority of Jews had lived in Poland for centuries leading up to one of the worst human crimes in history (the Holocaust), I never knew what a Jew was and had never met a Jewish person, till I was 24-years old, working as a military journalist for the U.S. Navy in Chicago. I interviewed a Rabbi who was in the Chaplain's Department (for several articles including "A Rabbi's Perspective on the Holocaust" during the Days of Remembrance and an article on the Festival of Sukkot). I befriended the Rabbi Lieutenant and from there my fascination with Judaism began.
Since then I have overcome an existential crisis and converted to Judaism, traveled to Israel and Amsterdam, where I visited the Anne Frank museum/hideaway. Also to Poland to the site of the concentration camp in Auschwitz. I have been exposed to Jewish history serendipitously through my travels. It's as though Judaism subtly weaved its way into my life with little effort from me. 
I have seen and experienced much in my life and spirituality and religion have had a huge impact on my emotional growth and identity.  Prior to Judaism, I didn't always have the right coping skills and at one point had lost the desire to live entirely. I toyed with danger and had been broken to the point of having no standards for anything, let alone myself. Judaism has provided me with a philosophy for living, a way of being and moving forward in this world with good intentions. It has also provided me with the skill-set to navigate through life in the midst of uncertainty and opposition. It's so easy to get lost during one of life's transitions or unforeseen circumstances when your beliefs are clouded and you don't have a moral code to follow or live by. My memoir, "Becoming Jewish" has the potential to change the way people view spirituality and religion. At the minimum, I hope it will inspire & awaken! 

I have always aspired to write a memoir and now I finally feel I have the right story to tell. Please support me on this journey! Even sharing this link with others is a huge help! Thank-you so much! Shalom! 
My Story...

  What We Need & What You Get I'm trying to raise the funds to support the writing of this book for the next 6-months. I have an agent interested, but I'm also willing to self-publish if for whatever reason it doesn't work out. So you will get a copy of the final printed book, guaranteed! 
The funds will also help with the cost of online promotion, advertising, proofreading and editing, and possibly printing. I'm planning for this memoir to reach epic heights, so I'm being very conscientious in currently building an online following and doing everything I can to get the word out. 
Even if you are unable to pledge, please support by sharing this link and make sure to follow me on Twitter and Facebook.  Also, to read more about my journey to Judaism, please visit my blog kowalskikibitz.com
I have great taste (only. partially. kidding.) and therefore some great perks  if you are able to support this campaign, including a Recycled "Absolut" Glass Mezuzah, chic LUCITE  dreidels, and original Jewish-themed photography  by artist/photographer Arick Maurice (will arrive autographed).  
      

    Risks & Challenges 

The biggest threat that I can foresee: well, there has been a resurgence of Anti-Semitism recently, particularly in parts of Western Europe, so writing on the topic of Judaism has the potential to spotlight me. Hopefully, I don't end up on some kind of hate list. story:
What is 1sentence?

The goal of this campaign is to give 1sentence a full-fledged website. 1sentence is a project where writers will write short stories based on the same single-sentence prompts. With your help, 1sentence.org will become a website where people can write, read, and review each other's work, and be part of a brand new short-story community.

History

When I first started out writing, I didn't know where to begin. What should I write about? How do I make a good plot? How do I make characters that other people will like? In my very first lesson of "just do it", I turned to my friends for help, asking them to give me random single sentence prompts. I would then write short stories based off of them, and it worked beautifully. I ended up writing several stories, and a couple of them I was quite proud of (you can read a couple of them here). That was three years ago. Now I am capable and confident enough to create my own stories, having had much experience in developing plot and forming characters.

Earlier this year, I used this same idea to host a fun little project online. I made a few threads on reddit and on several writing communities and told people what was going to happen: I was going to release some random single sentence prompts, then I would write short stories based off of them, and anyone was free to join me. The part that I was most excited about was seeing all the different types of stories that people could make with the same premise. A prompt was released on the 1st and 15th of April, May, and June, and I asked people to host it on their own blog. If they didn't have a blog I hosted it on Google Docs. You can see the results at www.1sentence.org.

Aftermath

I was shocked that I was able to convince random strangers on the internet to participate in something. As I had hoped, there was a good variety among the stories and I was constantly impressed by what other people did with the prompts. Some of them are actually strong foundations for a potentially longer work.

Before the project began I predicted what the outcome would be: there would be high initial interest in the beginning, but participation would dwindle as it went on, and that's exactly what happened.

When I asked myself why this happened, I thought of two reasons:

  1. It was a hassle for people to create their own blog to host their own stories, or to write them out and contact me so I could host them on google docs
  2. There was no real incentive for them to create stories, beyond personal satisfaction, because I was the only one providing feedback on their work

This made me think some more. What if I were able to solve these two problems? What if there was a website dedicated to this idea of getting people to write stories based on the same prompt, so that we could all see the different stories that came out of it, and be able to review and critique each other's work?

Project Summary

I am trying to create a new "1sentence.org". Instead of just being a Wordpress website, people will be able to create an account, or log in with Facebook/Google, and submit stories directly to the website, as opposed to writing them elsewhere and having me host them. Readers will be able to read stories, add their favourite stories to their library, and follow their favourite authors. Writers will be able to share their stories on Facebook or Twitter. There will also be a forum for people to talk about their stories, the prompts, and whatever else they'd like.

The main content of the website will be the short stories. Every month there will be a new prompt. Anyone with an account will be able to submit one story for each prompt. Twice a year I will initiate the same marathon I did earlier this year: a prompt on the 1st and 15th of each month for three months, for a total of six short stories. Right now I'm thinking Dec-Jan-Feb and Jun-Jul-Aug. This avoids clashing with NaNoWriMo, aligns perfectly with the two polar seasons, and students are mostly out of school during these intervals, allowing for a higher rate of participation.

The primary goal of 1sentence.org will be to help writers become better writers. The secondary goal will be to provide free content for readers of any literary orientation.

How Writers Become Better Writers

I believe there are two ways to become a better writer: write more, and get feedback.

The whole prompt aspect plus the marathons are challenges to see how creative you are, and to see if you can keep up with everybody else. You'll have to write in order to complete the stories on time.

As for getting feedback, the only rating system will be leaving a "like". There will be no thumbs down, downvote, or anything negative of the sort. If you like a story, you click the thumbs up. If you don't like it, you move on, but it'd be very helpful if you leave a comment telling the author how they could improve! All stories will be open for comments.

There will also be a Critique function, something a little more specific that readers can do. At the end of the story you'll have the choice to answer a short critique.

If you choose to do a critique, you'll see only the topmost section first. Depending on what you select, the corresponding numbered section shows up next, then the thank you message. I was taught that plot, character, and narrative are the three most important elements in written storytelling, so hopefully this system allows writers to see what they excel at and what they could improve on, as represented by your story's feedback (which only you can see in your account's control panel):

Keep in mind that these images, and anything else here, are just outlines, layouts, and/or sketches. Everything will look different once the final website is up and running.

All stories will be categorized under one or two genres, as chosen by the author. Readers thus have the choice to either read stories based on prompts, or based on genre (horror, fantasy, romance, etc.).

New, Popular, and Spotlight

Stories listed on the front page and on each genre's webpage will be sorted under three headings. "New" will show the latest stories first. "Popular" lists the stories with the most views/likes. "Spotlight" is what will, hopefully, give everyone equal exposure. It will list stories that have been posted for a while but have yet to receive any comments or critiques. One problem with writing websites is that the best are usually highlighted while the rest sink to the bottom. The Spotlight feature is intended give each story a fair chance.

Getting Published

I believe it is every writer's goal to be published; that is, to have their work produced into something physical.

Twice a year there will be a three-month long marathon where a prompt will be released about once every two weeks. All stories submitted by the respective deadlines are eligible to be published in the 1sentence anthologies. 

Each marathon will produce six prompts. What I envision is three of the best stories from each prompt being chosen to be a part of that anthology. That's eighteen stories total, potentially from eighteen different writers. How will the three stories from each prompt be chosen? The first story will be the highest rated (most number of likes), the second story will be editor's choice (that's me! I will choose the stories I feel to be the most creative, entertaining, and well-written, while adhering to the prompts themselves), and the third story... I have no idea yet. There are several categories/conditions I have in mind but for now I am still deciding (feel free to leave a comment if you have an idea!).

If all goes according to plan 1sentence.org will be up and running by the end of this year. The first marathon will take place during Dec 2015, Jan 2016, and Feb 2016. The first prompt will be released on Dec 1, and everyone has until Dec 14 midnight to submit a story. This continues for Dec 15, Jan 1, Jan 15, Feb 1, and Feb 15. Three stories from each prompt will be chosen (highest rated, editor's choice, and ???). I will then get 1sentence 2016 Vol. 1 printed. It will have six sections, one for each prompt, divided into the three chosen stories.

I definitely would like to have at least one volume printed. How many copies and the printing of future anthologies will depend on how popular 1sentence gets. For the record: authors retain first rights on their stories.

Funding

I am not a tech-savvy person. I do not know how to code. Thus, it is going to cost me $3,000 to get this website made. I have already found a web developer/designer, and we are working together to make 1sentence.org complete with the following features:

  • account creation + Facebook/Google sign-in
  • preset avatars (you'll also be able to upload a custom image)
  • base function of submitting stories (along with cover pictures), with likes, comments, critiques, and "save for library" features
  • mobile-friendly interface
  • message forums
  • anti-spam/security measures
  • a pleasing user interface (minimal and intuitive is the goal)

The extra $500 will cover indiegogo/transfer fees, and hopefully be enough for webhosting for a year or two. It is my hope that 1sentence will eventually be able to sustain itself, but for now this will be a helpful kickstart!

If the goal is not reached, everything simply goes toward the web development budget.

Stretch Goals

If funding surpasses the original goal, there are two immediate things the surplus will go to.

1. Marketing.

2. Development of a 1sentence app for both Apple and Android devices. Right now, 1sentence.org will translate into a mobile-friendly interface if you access it via your mobile device's web browser, but we don't have plans to make an app yet. The purpose of the app will be to give 1sentence more of an e-reader feel, and also to make it easier for writers by having an offline mode where they can write or record ideas.

The Perks

Originally I was going to do the usual stuff like t-shirts, notebooks, and pens customized with the 1sentence logo, but I've decided those things aren't really valuable. They only help market 1sentence's brand, which is what I eventually want, but here at the beginning and what I hope to be for a long time, I'd like to put the community first. I've done a bit of thinking, and I feel the perks to the right are pretty fun and/or meaningful.

1s gold

The gold account is basically a premium membership. In return for your support of 1sentence you will be given a few perks on the website. Right now, a gold membership gives you access to a super-secret message board for cool kids, grants you permission to submit stories to prompts that have been closed, and lets you submit more than one story for each prompt. Perhaps gold members will also be given an exclusive avatar. Things are still in development, and I hope to be able to provide more perks as this project moves along.

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary assistance isn't the only way you can help! There are two things you can do to help 1sentence.org become the best website it can be:

  • Spread the word! The buttons on the left let you share on Facebook or Twitter. If you know anyone interested in writing, but haven't really started yet, let them know about this project!
  • Give me your opinion! What do you think of the entire concept? Do you like how everything works? What else would you like to see? Any comments or suggestions will be much appreciated! I can't promise everything will be implemented, at the beginning or ever, but all ideas are welcome and will be considered!

Thanks for reading!

story:
Editing of the Short Films “Luz, oscuridad y silencio”, & “Lobos tendidos en la playa…”


    In June and July 2015, we had the opportunity of filming Luz, oscuridad y silencio, ("Light, Darkness and Silence"), in Valparaiso ,Chile, and Lobos tendidos en la playa… ("Seals Lying on the Beach…"), in Rocha, cost of Uruguay. These are two poetry films based on the books with the same title, that the Colombian writer Eduardo Bechara Navratilova wants to bring to the big screen.


    En los meses de junio y julio de 2015 tuvimos la oportunidad de rodar las  producciones de Luz, oscuridad y silencio, en Valparaiso, Chile, y Lobos tendidos en la playa…, en la costa de Rocha, Uruguay. Éstas son un par de películas de los libros de poemas del mismo nombre, que el escritor colombiano Eduardo Bechara Navratilova, quiere traer a la pantalla grande.



The productions:

"Light, Darkness and Silence"

   Set in Valparaiso and composed of three sets of poems, "Light, Darkness and Silence", has the gravitational pull that seems to touch everything in the post dictatorship Chile: a country which is still breathing over its open wounds. 




Poems "6" from "Light", "5", from "Darkness" and "1", from "Silence", are examples:

               “A human being under the light

               is an actor,

               a murder suspect,

               a rock star,

               someone being tortured,

               a woman giving birth,

               a corps under examination”


               “Darkness is darkness

               in the teenager

               that walked through it

               without noticing the cliff…

                Darkness is darkness

               in the teenager

               that resisted

               electrical whips

               and is damaged for life”


               “Silence is a powerful weapon

               white noise where

               birds

               sing their disappear,

               the absence of language,

               a numb heartbeat

               where glances drown.


Las producciones:

Luz, oscuridad y silencio 

 Compuesto por tres poemarios Luz, Oscuridad y Silencio, y con el trasfondo de Valparaiso como escenario, tiene ese peso gravitacional que parece impregnarlo todo en el chile post dictadura, un país en el que aún se respira sobre las heridas abiertas.
 


Los poemas 6 de Luz, 5 de Oscuridad y 1 de Silencio, ayudan a ejemplificarlo:

               “Un ser humano bajo la luz

               es un actor,

               un sospechoso de homicidio,

               una estrella de rock,

               un torturado,

               una mujer pariendo,

               un cadáver en su autopsia…”


               “La oscuridad es oscuridad

               en la adolescente

               que caminó en ella

               sin advertir el paso en el vacío…

               La oscuridad es oscuridad

               en el adolescente que resistió

               látigos eléctricos

               y quedó averiado de por vida…”


               “El silencio es un arma poderosa,

               un ruido blanco en el que los

               pájaros

               cantan su desesperanza,

               la ausencia de la lengua,

               un pálpito mudo

               en el que se ahogan

               las miradas”.


"Seals Lying on the Beach…"

   "Seals Lying on the Beach, Dancing Penguins and the Life of Other Animals", is a journey through the essence of life, nature's renewal and its cycles: birth, life and death. The scenes of seals, tortoises, penguins, birds and other animals, that show the different stages of decomposition, accompany sets of poems that point out how newly born beings take substance from dead ones, the same way other beings will take from them once they have died. 


The beach is the Universe in which everything becomes dust, where everything intertwines and matter passes from one being the other. Poem "5", from "Other Conversations With the Sea", provides an example:

                   “This world is the place

                   where we all

                   are matter

                   that never

                   stops changing…

                   Microbes, animals,

                   insects,

                   and human beings

                   mutate

                   from one to the other”.


Lobos tendidos en la playa…

   Lobos tendidos en la playa, pingüinos danzantes y la vida de otros animales, es un viaje por la esencia de la vida, la renovación de la naturaleza y los ciclos del nacimiento, la vida y la muerte. Las tomas de leones marinos, tortugas, pingüinos y aves que muestran los distintos estados de descomposición, acompañan una serie de poemas en los que se indica cómo los seres que nacen toman de los que han muerto, así como, a su vez, algún otro ser tomará de ellos cuando mueran. 

La playa es el universo en el que todo se vuelve polvo, en el que todo se hermana, y en el que la materia va mutando de un ser a otro. El poema 5 de Otras conversaciones con el mar, lo ejemplifica:

                   “Este mundo es el lugar

                   donde todos somos

                   materia que nunca

                   cesa de cambiar…

                   Microbios, animales,

                   insectos

                   y seres humanos,

                   mutamos

                   los unos en los otros.” 



   With the help of Colombian film director, Alvaro Ruiz, author of shorts like "Daybreak", who is close to filming his first feature film: "The bullfighters girlfriend", the set of poems "Light, Darkness and Silence", that on paper may be abstract, under his lens become more revealing and suggestive. Filmed on the beaches, the port, the neighborhood of Cerro Alegre and center city Valparaiso, the movie poses the question on cruelty, how people may get lost in the underworld and how silence can be able to cut like a sharpened knife. Alvaro says: “We have all experienced the absence of a reply and feel identified. Valparaiso inspired Eduardo to write the poems, and they became the foundation for this movie”.

   Con la ayuda del director colombiano Álvaro Ruiz, autor de cortos como Amanecer, La trilogía del abrazo y Tierra caliente, próximo a rodar su primer largo: La novia del torero, los poemas de Luz oscuridad y silencio, que sobre el papel pueden llegar a ser abstractos, detrás de su cámara logran un sentido más real y sugerente. Filmada en las playas, el puerto, el Cerro Alegre, el centro y demás locaciones de Valparaiso, la película plantea la crueldad del hombre, la forma en que se puede perder en los bajos fondos y esa ausencia en la que el silencio puede llegar a rajar como cuchillo. El propio Álvaro Ruiz, dice: “Todos hemos vivido una ausencia. En ese sentido nos sentimos identificados. A Eduardo, Valparaiso le inspiró los poemas que luego se volvieron el telón de fondo para hacer el proyecto”.


Poetry and cinema

   Although poetry and cinema have gone hand in hand since the beginning of early cinema, and D. W. Griffith´s silent movies or feature films from Jodorosky may be very poetic, on the words of Alvaro Ruiz: “The project is innovative in the sense that it is an experiment which has been done in very few occasions. The production arises from the poems and sticks to the poems. It doesn’t build an independent story from them. One thing is to have poetical images and another one to build from the text and create something new that respects the text. It also allows the creation of another product which comes out of the poems. In this way, the set of poems acquires another life which reaches another public through new technologies: people are used to reading audiovisual language. The result is not a representation of the poems, but rather an interpretation. The public has to find its own interpretation based upon the construction that comes from mixing the images and the words. With that, the spectator starts becoming part of the film and fills the blanks in "Light" and "Darkness", both somehow a little bit abstract. "Silence" is more narrative, since it states the absence of the reply. The poetical voice talks to another person who is represented by a woman in the movie”.


Poesía & cine

   Si bien la poesía y el cine han estado emparentados desde  el inicio del séptimo arte, y las películas mudas de D. W. Griffith pertenecientes a las primeras etapas del cine o producciones como las de Jodorosky, pueden ser muy poéticas, en las palabras de Álvaro Ruiz: “El proyecto es novedoso en el sentido en que es un experimento que se ha hecho muy poco. La producción parte de los poemas y se circunscribe a los poemas. No arma una narración independiente a partir de ellos. Una cosa es que las imágenes sean poéticas, y otra, partir del texto y crear algo nuevo que respete el texto. Además permite crear, a partir de los poemas, otro producto. Así se les da otra vida que se trasporta y le llega a otras personas, valiéndose de las tecnologías de hoy en día, donde hay gente acostumbrada a leer el lenguaje audiovisual. El resultado final no es una representación de los poemas, sino una interpretación, en la que el público tiene que encontrar la suya propia, basado en lo que construye la mezcla de imágenes y palabras. Con ello el espectador se va volviendo parte de la obra y llena los vacíos en los casos de Luz y Oscuridad, que son abstractos. Silencio es un poco más narrativo en vista de que plantea una ausencia. La voz poética le habla a otro que está ausente, y dentro del rodaje está representado por una mujer”.



We need you

   So that the films can enter their production and postproduction stages, we need your help. The crowdfunding will help pay the money invested in the shooting, the edition, the design, the composition and recording of the music, the color adjusting, all other technical details, and all and all, will help the movies come alive, allow people to see poetry through an integration of genres, will help increase the exposition of poetry and break the stereotype thinking that poetry is only for poets, may be boring or that its public is to narrow. Once the production reaches its final stage, the movies will be sent to different festivals like Cannes, Sundance or Karlovy Vary, among others.

This project arises form a personal concern, but the objective is to be able to continue producing new poetry films: from the success of this production depends the production of other films made from books and poems from other authors, that can be taken to the big screen and help built the interdisciplinary bond. Help us. Become a sponsor, have a direct influence in the strengthening of poetry, and be a participant in a project which aims to take poetry and different poets to cross their own boundaries.

Thank you very much.


Te necesitamos

   Para que los rodajes puedan entrar a su etapa de producción y postproducción, necesitamos de su ayuda. Lo recaudado servirá para que se pague la inversión del rodaje, la edición, el diseño, la composición y grabación de música, la corrección del color, algunos otros detalles técnicos, y permitirá la visualización de la poesía a través de una integración de géneros, aumentará su exposición al público y ayudará a romper el estereotipo de que la poesía es sólo para los poetas, que puede ser aburrida o que su público es demasiado restringido. Una vez acabada la producción, las películas se enviarán a concursar a festivales como Cannes, Sundance, Karlovy Vary y otros.

Este proyecto es una inquietud personal, pero el objetivo es poder continuar haciendo otros nuevos: del éxito de esta producción depende la producción de nuevos rodajes de otros poetas, cuyo poemario o libro, pueda ser llevado a la pantalla grande e ir ampliando así el nexo interdisciplinario. Ayúdenos y conviértase en un patrocinador, tenga una injerencia directa en el fortalecimiento de la poesía y vuélvase partícipe de un proyecto que pretende llevar a la poesía y a diferentes poetas, a traspasar sus propias fronteras.

Muchas gracias

darkness

story:
Pat LaMarche's experiences working with the nation's poor make her uniquely suited to answer the tough questions about how welfare, social services, inadequate education and societies other challenges effect the economy and the nation as well. As a journalist and award winning broadcaster Pat has spent more than two decades studying and reporting on poverty issues both in the U.S. and abroad. During her 2004 Green Party Campaign for U.S. Vice President, Pat took to the streets to uncover the lives of the homeless in what she called the "Left Out Tour." Pat traveled the nation living in homeless shelters and on the streets. The book she wrote about those experiences is called, "Left Out in America; the State of Homelessness in the United States."

Broadcasted from her bed (yes, still in her jammies) LaMarche will discuss her political truths. 

A community based project driven by the need for uninterrupted true discussion regarding the 2016 presidential race. A daily news segment by the one and only Don Morgan, broadcasting live from his bed in San Antonio, Texas! With support from people all over the nation, every morning - from 7am to 8am- you will be able to tune in and listen to unfiltered discussion. Listener participation is encouraged! Call in with your thoughts and opinions on some of the most pressing issues facing the nation today.

story:
Project Summary

Hello All,    

               I have decided to create this Indiegogo project to attempt to accomplish a few things. Before travelling this past summer, I brainstormed about different ways that I could document my travels. I knew I would want to keep record of what was sure to be an amazing adventure, I just wasn't sure about the best method for completing said task. 

            Within the first few rumbles of thunder, I wrestled with the idea of filming the whole adventure. I soon tossed this idea off the deck after researching editing and production costs. Also, I feared that it would ultimately take away too much from the experience or the trip if I was constantly fiddling with a camera. When you focus all of your attention on capturing amazing events, it can sometimes leave you unable to experience those amazing events. So a film was not the path I was willing to go down for this particular adventure.

           Clarity finally came at the eye of the storm, when I had the idea to journalize all of my experiences in a notepad. A simple idea, but a clear one non the less. This was certainly not the end of this thunderous brain storm. During my summer travels, I eventually decided that I would edit and collectivize my journal entries into a physical book, for family, friends, and me to recollect, remember, and reminisce . This book is a piece of me, and I am excited to share my experiences with others on a much richer level than what social media allows.


         The idea of designing a crowd-funding campaign to raise money to accomplish my goal of self-publishing a book didn't come to me until the book neared completion. I decided on the idea that I would try raise enough money to publish one copy of the book for each of the amazing people who pledged to my campaign and the shipping costs for the books. Any extra funding made in the process of this project will go directly to the creation of further travel journals.   I have yet to see the northern half of this great country, so this summer I plan to travel around the northwest part of the continental 48 where a majority of our nation's national parks lie. I have 19 states left to see not counting Hawaii or Alaska, but I digress.

        The final, and most important goal of this project is to inspire. Inspire to desire. Desire to travel, desire to experience new sights, sounds, tastes, and smells; Desire to live. Most importantly, desire to inspire others to do the same. Variety is the spice of life, and I want this book to remind me, as well as all others, to always be in search of new and fulfilling experiences as well as exercising artistic expression.  If this project inspires even one person(even myself) to travel even a little bit more, than I will feel completely accomplished and fulfilled!

        I hope that we can all make this project happen and I hope that others find new and inventive ways to turn their dreams into reality.

Project Budget

  • $1,600 for the printing  and shipping of 200 paperback books
  • $600 for shipping of individual books to 100 people
  • $150 for professional, outsourced editing
  • $150 for cover art

Risks & Challenges

         The only real risk of this project would be me not pressing that continue button at the end of the project setup, but if you are reading this, it means that I pressed that button!

          The main challenge of this project will be the process of shipping all these books out to everyone. I have done a solid amount of research about the Indiegogo website, have two parents who work for the postal service, and a sister who has shipping knowledge. Also, this website allows me to simply ask you for your address. So the toughest part of this project is taken care because of the fantastic design of this website!

           The next challenge is deciding the proper website to publish my book. I have spend a good amount of time researching the right outlet to make this idea a reality. inquiring about quotes, and shipping costs, and have decided on a website to publish with, but am unable to state their website name on my project page.

         The last challenge to be completed is the final edit of the book, which is nearing completion and final cover, which is being designed by my good friend Frank Consoli.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

          If you do not have the appropriate funds to support my project with a monetary expression, that is completely understandable. If you don't have the money, but still want to help the cause, please share a link to my project on any form of social media you desire. Every little bit of exposure helps!

        -Also make sure to send positive vibrations my way. It would be of great assistance!

Thank you for all your support!

                                                                  - Dan Edson-
