story_txt:
En busca de poetas es una iniciativa que busca reivindicar y enaltecer la poesía latinoamericana contemporánea, a través de un viaje de veintiséis mil (26.000) kilómetros desde Ushuaia, Argentina, hasta Caracas, Venezuela, pasando por pueblos y ciudades escogidas de Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay, Bolivia, Perú, Ecuador, Colombia y Venezuela, con el objetivo de descubrir poetas inéditos y editados, documentarlos y publicar una serie de antologías de poesía latinoamericana, realizando un aporte concreto y significativo a la literatura contemporánea. In Search of Poets is a project that looks to restore and honor contemporary Latin American poetry. It entails a 16,250-mile journey from Ushuaia, Argentina all the way to Caracas, Venezuela, with stops in selected towns and cities of Argentina, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay, Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, Colombia and Venezuela. The goal is to discover unpublished and published poets, record them and publish a series of contemporary Latin American anthologies, thus fulfilling a specific and meaningful contribution to contemporary literature. Ushuaia, Tierra del fuego, Argentina La antologíaDespués de 4 años y medio de viaje, el Proyecto iniciará su serie de publicaciones por países y regiones de Latinoamérica. Nuestra primera antología: “Breve tratado del viento Sur - Antología poética de la Patagonia argentina”, reúne la voz de más de ochenta (80) poetas inéditos y publicados.La poesía de la Patagonia argentina está llena de aullidos del viento, grandes extensiones, estepas y horizontes abiertos. Es una poesía introspectiva marcada por un fuerte sentimiento de soledad, lejanía y aislamiento, con temáticas sociales como la pobreza y el hambre.Esta antología es la materialización de la búsqueda que se viene desarrollando. Reúne la poética de una región y muestra el trabajo de poetas que merecen ser conocidos y leídos más allá de sus fronteras. Hablan de un tiempo y un lugar que merecen ser guardados en nuestra memoria. The AnthologyAfter the four and a half year trip, the project will begin its series of publications classifying each according to the country and region in Latin America.  The first one, “Short Treatise of the South Wind – Poetic Anthology of the Argentinian Patagonia”, collects the work of more than eighty (80) published and unpublished poets.Argentinian Patagonian poetry brims with the howling of the wind, the images of widespread areas and open horizons. It´s an introspective poetry marked by a strong sense of loneliness, remoteness, and isolation, treating social themes such as poverty and hunger.This anthology shows the completion of the search being developed.  It brings together the poetry of a region and shows the works of poets that deserve to be known and read beyond their borders. They speak of a given time and place that deserve to be stored in our memory. Nicolás Romano y Eduardo Bechara, Ushuaia, Tierra del fuego, Argentina Estrecho de Magallanes / Strait of Magellan LA CIUDAD SIEMPRE LA CIUDAD Los pájaros vuelan otra vez sobre la ciudad heladalos meses y las semanas pasan veloces y crueles.Ni los viejos resplandores asoman ya.¿Hubo gloria antes de la decadencia?¿Las aguas son las mismas aguas?Aquí todos los santos días se escribe una gran historiade miseria y vodevil.  THE CITY ALWAYS THE CITY The birds fly again over the frozen citymonths and weeks go by fast and cruel.Not even the old shinings glow now.Was there any glory before decadence?Are the waters the same waters?Here all the holly days a great story of misery and vaudevilleis writen. ANAHÍ LAZZARONI Anahí Lazzaroni en su casa / at her home / Ushuaia, Tierra del fuego Los autoresLos más de ochenta (80) poetas incluidos son de diversas edades. Cada uno tiene sus temas afines de acuerdo a sus propias vivencias. Están conscientes de su entorno, de las injusticias que ocurren y de las situaciones que podrían ser mejores. Como lo dijo Eduardo Bechara: “El poeta acepta el desafío de vencer/ la injusticia con belleza,/ de encontrar lo que duele/ y mirarlo de frente,/ o lo que a veces no termina/ de entender”. Maritza Kuzanovic en su oficina / in her office / Rio Gallegos, Santa Cruz, Patagonia The authorsThe eighty (80) or more poets vary in age.  Each one has his/her own theme depending on his/her own experience. They are aware of their environment, the injustices that take place, and the situations that could be better. As Eduardo Bechara said: “The poet accepts the challenge to defeat/ injustice with beauty, / to find what hurts/ and look at it in its eyes/ or what some times can´t be fully/ understood. Con / with Julio "Mochi" Leite, Alejandro Pinto & Fredy Gallardo, Río Grande, Tierra del fuego  La editorial Escarabajo editorial fue fundada en Colombia en el año 2006 con el objetivo de promover y publicar nuevos talentos literarios. Ha apoyado el proyecto “En busca de poetas” desde sus inicios, como una forma de generar cultura literaria, enaltecer y generar su aporte a la poesía. PublisherEscarabajo Publishing House was founded in Colombia in 2006 with the goal of promoting and publishing new literary talents. It has backed up the project In Search of Poets since the beginning, as a way to generate a literary culture, honor, and make its contribution to poetry. Ultimos títulos publicados / Last published titles:"Ayer terminará mañana", Santiago José Sepúlveda Montenegro, septiembre 2013"Pensión de animales", Pablo Silva Olazabal, agosto 2013"El azar y la pérdida / Le Hasard et la Perte" (Edición bilingue / bilingual edition), Stéphane Chaumet, mayo 2013"Dejemos hablar al viento", Nicolás Dávila, poesía, marzo 2013"Las maravillas de Alicia", Eduardo Bechara Navratilova, febrero 2013 Ver libros en / see books in: http://escarabajoeditorial.com ¿Por qué necesitamos de la campaña?Para iniciar el ciclo de publicaciones e imprimir mil (1000) copias de la antología, necesitamos recaudar DIECIOCHO MILLONES DE PESOS ($18´000.000.oo) M/CTE., aproximadamente SEIS MIL QUINIENTOS DÓLARES (US$6.500), para cubrir los costos de impresión y gastos relacionados de un libro de quinientas (500) páginas. Hay que recordar que Indiegogo toma un cinco por ciento (5%) de lo recaudado. Why crowdfunding is needed?To start the publishing cycle and print the one thousand (1000) copies of the anthology, around EIGHTEEN MILLION PESOS ($18,000,000.00), approximately SIX THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($6,500.00), are needed to cover printing costs and other related costs of a 500-page book. We must remember that Indiegogo charges a five percent (5%) fee on contributions. Con / With / Liliana Ancalao in Comodoro Rivadavia, Chubut, Patagonia Camila Vallendor / poeta inédita / non published poet / Ushuaia, Tierra del fuego Impacto ¿Por qué es importante el proyecto? ¿Qué lo hace único?La poesía latinoamericana está viva, cambia, se renueva constantemente. Es importante documentar sus cambios, darle espacio a las nuevas voces y escribir la historia de todos como continente. La poesía debe dar cuenta de las circunstancias actuales, debe dialogar con nosotros y con lo que sentimos de forma directa. Al reunir todas estas voces se cuenta la historia de la región.Esta primera antología materializa lo que nos propusimos desde un principio: fomentar la lectura de la poesía latinoamericana contemporánea, unificar al continente en torno a ella, y hacer visibles a poetas que deben ser tenidos en cuenta y reconocidos. ImpactWhy is this project important? What makes it unique?Latin American poetry is alive, it changes and is renewed constantly. It´s important to record its changes, make space to new voices, and write our history as a continent.  Poetry must shed light on current circumstances, chat directly with us and our feelings. The gathering of all these voices tells the history of the region.This first anthology is the culmination of what had been planned from the beginning: promote the reading of Latin American contemporary poetry, unite the continent around it, and make poets, who should be noticed and recognized, visible. Graciela Cros en su casa / at her home / Bariloche, Río Negro Tierra del fuego Otras formas de ayudarSi te resulta difícil ayudarnos con una contribución económica, existen otras formas de ayudar. Comparte esta campaña con las personas interesadas en la poesía y en proyectos como este. Entre más personas lo conozcan, más estarás ayudando. Gracias por apoyar la poesía latinoamericana. Other ways of helpingIf it´s difficult for you to help us with a financial contribution, there are other ways of helping. Share this campaign with people who are interested in poetry and projects like this one. The more people know about it, the more you help. Thank you so much for supporting Latin American poetry. Lago argentino / Argentinian Lake / Chaltén, Calafate, Patagonia Medios en los que ha salido el proyecto / Media where project has been advertised:  Entrevistas / Interviews / TV & Internet AkaBOOM, “Entrevista a Eduardo Bechara”, Asunción, Paraguay, mayo 2017:

story:
#RepresentationMatters

"You can't be what you can't see."  

Kids are often told and encouraged to be whatever they want to be. And kids base their aspirations on what they know and are exposed to. However, our culture and media hasn't done the greatest job at exposing kids to positive and diverse role models. And often times children are exposed to negative and confusing images at a young age, impacting their idea of a positive and diverse role model

In fact, studies show that stereotypes negatively impact girls as young as five years old, which affects their lifelong ambitions. It’s also around this time that kids begin to develop their self-esteem. And while boys and girls report similar levels of self-esteem at age five, its young’s girls self-esteem that plummets by age 12.

In addition to the negative messages girls receive that impact their self-worth, women’s contributions and successes aren't often recognized and celebrated. And since women's contributions aren't mainstream, stereotypes are created. Such stereotypes are found everywhere in our culture and children’s stories are no exception.

Only 10% best selling picture books features a lead female and only 14% of children’s books show people of color.

This has to change.

Our girls deserve better and need sources of inspiration so that they can see and do something they didn’t dare dream was possible. Because if girls don’t see a culture that highlights and champions bold + mighty women, it becomes harder for girls to dream big and be bold + mighty. Now more than ever, it’s important to send the message of kindness, acceptance, and equality to our youth. And for those reasons...

 Adventures with Luna and Friends was created!

 

The Mission

Adventures with Luna & Friends aims to spark the next generation of changemakers. We do this by creating educational content that empowers young girls to be bold +  mighty and bring boys as allies.

Because we can’t leave our young boys out of the picture! It’s not only girls that need a source of inspiration to be bold + mighty. It’s just as important that young boys be part of a culture where they see women and young girls portrayed as powerful and fearless leaders. And for all  boys and girls to see themselves reflected in our media. We want to model what strength and leadership looks like for kids in Preschool-1st Grade.

The idea of Adventures with Luna & Friends first came to me a few years ago, when the following thought crossed my mind -- "why don't we have more books and games that empower girls and in a way that's fun for both kids and parents?" And since kids love to color, I also thought, "what if coloring books could help send a message of kindness, acceptance, and inclusion?"

So in December 2016, we launched our first educational tool, the A-Z coloring book, “Color with Luna.” The coloring book is a creative learning tool that builds a girl’s self-esteem through the power of images and words. Throughout the coloring book, girls are described as Confident, Leaders, and Mighty. Equally important, the coloring book is inclusive as it celebrates kids off all abilities, ethnicities, and cultures. 

Who is Luna and Friends?

Luna is a young girl who is intelligent, brave, and curious. She takes you on adventures while introducing you to her friends along the way. Luna's friends are unique and celebrate their strengths. And they celebrate their friendship by supporting and learning from each other.

#BoldandMightyKids

Since launching our first coloring book, Adventures with Luna & Friends has put on several events for kids throughout the DC Metro community. We’ve had singing and reading time with craft making activities at public libraries, coloring book stations at community festivals hosted by the Children’s Museum Explore! and participated in several fairs, festivals, and pop-up bookstores in the DC Metro area. And we are currently working to put on father-daughter art workshops.

What's Next?

We have a great vision for how can Adventures with Luna & Friends can continue to inspire kids to bold + mighty in 2018.

Next year, we plan to publish our first reading book and a second coloring book!!

Reading Book
We'll build off of our A-Z alphabet adventures by inviting kids to learn about fearless and trailblazing women. We'll highlight bold and mighty women in sports, science, music, art, and film. Kids will not only learn about women's contributions throughout history, but also learn about various cultures around the world. This will help kids have a global awareness and understanding of other cultures. All while joining Luna and Friends on these adventures. 

Coloring Book
The second A-Z coloring book will continue to inspire kids to be bold + mighty with activities to encourage them to create, think, and learn. We'll expand the vocabulary in the coloring book that will help inspire and empower kids to see themselves as multifaceted, as well as build a healthy self-identity and self-image.  

And that's not all!

The reading and coloring books will also be translated from English to Spanish. Kids will be able to learn, practice, and build their Spanish vocabulary with Luna & Friends! 

Our team is eager and ready to get to get to work and bring these ideas to fruition. But we won’t be able to have the kind of impact we envision without YOU!

Your Support and Impact

Adventures with Luna & Friends started with a zero budget, with only our time and whole-hearted commitment as investment. And as Adventures with Luna & Friends grows, your support could be a turning point for us!

Your investment  will be the catalyst to launch our next initiatives. And these books will only be made possible thanks to your contribution. Ultimately, we want to create educational animated series of Adventures with Luna & Friends!!

How the Funds Will Be Used

The $15k will be used for:

Character development for the reading and coloring book - $3,500

Graphic design and illustration for 3-months - $3,000

Printing and publishing of the books - $3,000

Social media and marketing for 2-months - $2,000

Legal and operating costs - $2,000

KidScreen Summit and BookExpo Conference registration - $1,500

About the Founder

I’m a champion for women and girl’s empowerment. Through my life’s work in women’s leadership and empowerment, I realized that this work needs to be started at young age. The values of resiliency, leadership, and boldness, need to be cultivated at a young age.

Kid’s view of the world is influenced by the media they consume which impacts their self-esteem and identity. I know this firsthand because growing up as a Latina, I didn’t see a lot of diverse role models or their stories reflected n the media. If such women were featured, they were the exception, not the norm. And while we’ve certainly made significant progress in efforts to build a more inclusive culture, there’s still a lot of work to be done.

I was also told from a young age that little girls shouldn’t be bossy as well as what was and wasn't "appropriate” for boys and girls to do. Unfortunately, as an adult, the laundry list of what women should and shouldn't do has only grown. I’m here to help break down these pervasive stereotypes that hurt young girls and boys. As well as build a supportive community that encourages kids to dream big and live by their own rules. 

I am committed to making Adventures with Luna and Friends a source of inspiration, education, and fun for ALL kids and I need YOUR help! 

Together we can create space in our world where both boys and girls are able to dream without limits.  

Other Ways You Can Support

Besides contributing financially, there are other ways that you can help make an impact with us!

Please spread the word by sharing this IndieGoGo fundraising page on your social media pages and e-mail your friends about this campaign! Tell your family members, friends, colleagues, the teachers of your kids, grand-kids, nieces, nephews, and any other bold + mighty kids you may know!

Join us on social media! Post links to this IndieGoGo fundraising page and our Adventures with Luna & Friends site, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter on your social media. This will make a HUGE difference! The more people who learn about Adventures with Luna and Friends, the better chance we have of meeting our goal!

And use the hashtag #colorwithluna when posting about this campaign on social media!

Website 
http://www.colorwithluna.com

Instagram 
https://www.instagram.com/colorwithluna

Twitter 
https://twitter.com/colorwithluna

Facebook 
https://www.facebook.com/colorwithluna

 

Special Thanks <3

Since I've launched Adventures with Luna & Friends, I've received tremendous support from family and friends. For that reason, I'd like to recognize some of these individuals (there are of course too many to list)! Thank you all for your ongoing support, encouragement, and friendship!!

  • Shanell Oliver (S.Oliver Pictures) for capturing all these beautiful moments during the events
  • The crew at DoubleR Productions, for creating this wonderful video for the campaign
  • Christine -- for your wonderful support and to Jasmin -- for allowing us to capture your amazing and shinning personality on camera
  • NewEbbitt BNI friends, for your unconditional support and friendship. Who knew that I would look forward to early morning Thursday meetings?!
  • To my LBAs, Awesome Women Entrepreneurs group, InnovatorsBox friends, Explore! Children's Museum, Petworth Arts Collaborative, CHAW, Lighthouse  Yoga, The Women Behind the Business, Duende Bookstore, and Elsie. Your support means more to me then you'll ever know
  • To my abuela, mom, and sister, for continuously teaching me what it means to be a fierce, butt-kicking woman
  • Elise and Brian -- the besties, here's to our 10+ years of friendship full of our very own adventures, support, and love :)
  • The Thriving Creative Group, for encouraging me to continuously step outside of my comfort zone
  • Jullian, my boo, my love, best friend, and partner in crime.  Thank you for everything that you do, from stuffing 500 coloring book packs with Luna tattoos, joining me at festivals no matter how hot it was, or how many mosquitoes you were surrounded by, thank you for your never ending support and belief in all that I do
  • To all the parents who everyday try to raise bold + mighty kids
  • And last but not least...

To all the kids --
You are why I do this, everyday you inspire me to bold and mighty
<3 <3 <3

Because if girls don’t see a culture that highlights and champions bold + mighty women, it becomes harder for girls to dream big and be bold + mighty. Now more than ever, it’s important to send the message of kindness, acceptance, and equality to our youth. And for those reasons... Adventures with Luna and Friends was created! The MissionAdventures with Luna & Friends aims to spark the next generation of changemakers. We do this by creating educational content that empowers young girls to be bold +  mighty and bring boys as allies.Because we can’t leave our young boys out of the picture! It’s not only girls that need a source of inspiration to be bold + mighty. It’s just as important that young boys be part of a culture where they see women and young girls portrayed as powerful and fearless leaders. And for all  boys and girls to see themselves reflected in our media. We want to model what strength and leadership looks like for kids in Preschool-1st Grade.The idea of Adventures with Luna & Friends first came to me a few years ago, when the following thought crossed my mind -- "why don't we have more books and games that empower girls and in a way that's fun for both kids and parents?" And since kids love to color, I also thought, "what if coloring books could help send a message of kindness, acceptance, and inclusion?"So in December 2016, we launched our first educational tool, the A-Z coloring book, “Color with Luna.” The coloring book is a creative learning tool that builds a girl’s self-esteem through the power of images and words. Throughout the coloring book, girls are described as Confident, Leaders, and Mighty. Equally important, the coloring book is inclusive as it celebrates kids off all abilities, ethnicities, and cultures. Who is Luna and Friends?Luna is a young girl who is intelligent, brave, and curious. She takes you on adventures while introducing you to her friends along the way. Luna's friends are unique and celebrate their strengths. And they celebrate their friendship by supporting and learning from each other.#BoldandMightyKidsSince launching our first coloring book, Adventures with Luna & Friends has put on several events for kids throughout the DC Metro community. We’ve had singing and reading time with craft making activities at public libraries, coloring book stations at community festivals hosted by the Children’s Museum Explore! and participated in several fairs, festivals, and pop-up bookstores in the DC Metro area. And we are currently working to put on father-daughter art workshops.What's Next?We have a great vision for how can Adventures with Luna & Friends can continue to inspire kids to bold + mighty in 2018.Next year, we plan to publish our first reading book and a second coloring book!!Reading BookWe'll build off of our A-Z alphabet adventures by inviting kids to learn about fearless and trailblazing women. We'll highlight bold and mighty women in sports, science, music, art, and film. Kids will not only learn about women's contributions throughout history, but also learn about various cultures around the world. This will help kids have a global awareness and understanding of other cultures. All while joining Luna and Friends on these adventures. Coloring BookThe second A-Z coloring book will continue to inspire kids to be bold + mighty with activities to encourage them to create, think, and learn. We'll expand the vocabulary in the coloring book that will help inspire and empower kids to see themselves as multifaceted, as well as build a healthy self-identity and self-image.  And that's not all! The reading and coloring books will also be translated from English to Spanish. Kids will be able to learn, practice, and build their Spanish vocabulary with Luna & Friends! Our team is eager and ready to get to get to work and bring these ideas to fruition. But we won’t be able to have the kind of impact we envision without YOU!Your Support and ImpactAdventures with Luna & Friends started with a zero budget, with only our time and whole-hearted commitment as investment. And as Adventures with Luna & Friends grows, your support could be a turning point for us!Your investment  will be the catalyst to launch our next initiatives. And these books will only be made possible thanks to your contribution. Ultimately, we want to create educational animated series of Adventures with Luna & Friends!!How the Funds Will Be UsedThe $15k will be used for:Character development for the reading and coloring book - $3,500Graphic design and illustration for 3-months - $3,000Printing and publishing of the books - $3,000Social media and marketing for 2-months - $2,000Legal and operating costs - $2,000KidScreen Summit and BookExpo Conference registration - $1,500About the FounderI’m a champion for women and girl’s empowerment. Through my life’s work in women’s leadership and empowerment, I realized that this work needs to be started at young age. The values of resiliency, leadership, and boldness, need to be cultivated at a young age.Kid’s view of the world is influenced by the media they consume which impacts their self-esteem and identity. I know this firsthand because growing up as a Latina, I didn’t see a lot of diverse role models or their stories reflected n the media. If such women were featured, they were the exception, not the norm. And while we’ve certainly made significant progress in efforts to build a more inclusive culture, there’s still a lot of work to be done.I was also told from a young age that little girls shouldn’t be bossy as well as what was and wasn't "appropriate” for boys and girls to do. Unfortunately, as an adult, the laundry list of what women should and shouldn't do has only grown. I’m here to help break down these pervasive stereotypes that hurt young girls and boys. As well as build a supportive community that encourages kids to dream big and live by their own rules. I am committed to making Adventures with Luna and Friends a source of inspiration, education, and fun for ALL kids and I need YOUR help! Together we can create space in our world where both boys and girls are able to dream without limits.  Other Ways You Can SupportBesides contributing financially, there are other ways that you can help make an impact with us!Please spread the word by sharing this IndieGoGo fundraising page on your social media pages and e-mail your friends about this campaign! Tell your family members, friends, colleagues, the teachers of your kids, grand-kids, nieces, nephews, and any other bold + mighty kids you may know!Join us on social media! Post links to this IndieGoGo fundraising page and our Adventures with Luna & Friends site, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter on your social media. This will make a HUGE difference! The more people who learn about Adventures with Luna and Friends, the better chance we have of meeting our goal!And use the hashtag #colorwithluna when posting about this campaign on social media!Website http://www.colorwithluna.comInstagram https://www.instagram.com/colorwithlunaTwitter https://twitter.com/colorwithlunaFacebook https://www.facebook.com/colorwithluna Special Thanks <3Since I've launched Adventures with Luna & Friends, I've received tremendous support from family and friends. For that reason, I'd like to recognize some of these individuals (there are of course too many to list)! Thank you all for your ongoing support, encouragement, and friendship!!
Shanell Oliver (S.Oliver Pictures) for capturing all these beautiful moments during the events
The crew at DoubleR Productions, for creating this wonderful video for the campaign
Christine -- for your wonderful support and to Jasmin -- for allowing us to capture your amazing and shinning personality on camera
NewEbbitt BNI friends, for your unconditional support and friendship. Who knew that I would look forward to early morning Thursday meetings?!
To my LBAs, Awesome Women Entrepreneurs group, InnovatorsBox friends, Explore! Children's Museum, Petworth Arts Collaborative, CHAW, Lighthouse  Yoga, The Women Behind the Business, Duende Bookstore, and Elsie. Your support means more to me then you'll ever know
To my abuela, mom, and sister, for continuously teaching me what it means to be a fierce, butt-kicking woman
Elise and Brian -- the besties, here's to our 10+ years of friendship full of our very own adventures, support, and love :)
The Thriving Creative Group, for encouraging me to continuously step outside of my comfort zone
Jullian, my boo, my love, best friend, and partner in crime.  Thank you for everything that you do, from stuffing 500 coloring book packs with Luna tattoos, joining me at festivals no matter how hot it was, or how many mosquitoes you were surrounded by, thank you for your never ending support and belief in all that I do
To all the parents who everyday try to raise bold + mighty kids
And last but not least...
To all the kids --You are why I do this, everyday you inspire me to bold and mighty<3 <3 <3

story:
What is The Mindset Triangle?

Hi I'm Stu and a 37 year old Personal Trainer from Birmingham. I have been living with depression and anxiety for most of my adult life, but always hid under the stigma blanket. Once diagnosed about 7 years ago and accepting it, I started to live alongside it. This is when The Mindset Triangle was born. For me to stay on a level and minimizing the time I spend in the dark side, I live my life by this triangle. If you can remember back to your schools day when you were taught the fire triangle you will know that for the fire to burn you need 3 elements Oxygen, Heat and Fuel. Well its the same process with The Mindset Triangle but for me to function I need Healthy Eating, Sleep and Exercise. 

This campaign is to share the knowledge and help people live their life by the triangle and reduce the stigma of mental health in the UK. Myself and Henriette, a photographer from Birmingham who's Dad lives with depression, have collaborated to write a book to demonstrate how easy it is to live a healthier lifestyle to give you a healthier mindset. This book will be full of healthy recipes to easy 20 min workouts and tips and tricks that I use to deal with every day life. We have also interviewed people who live with mental health and talked to them about what they do to balance themselves in a day to day life. 

We're on a mission to reach as many people as possible. By you pledging your support and sharing our campaign, it will help The Mindset Triangle to share this formula nationwide; reducing the stigma associated with mental health and giving people the guidance to really improve their lifestyle and mind.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In this campaign we are looking to raise £10,000. This money will be split to publish and print the book and market it so we can touch as many people in the U.K as possible as follows ; £3500 to publish, £4000 first print run, £1500 Marketing and advertising and £1000 to run workshops through the uk. 

We have some very exciting pledges for you to put your hands on and the support does not stop with just the book. For every pledge that is bought you will receive a signed copy of the book. You will also be enrolled onto the online members area where the support will continue with workouts and recipes. We have teamed up with charities across the UK so you will be able to pledge and we can donate these books to a mental health charity of your choice.  These charities can distribute The Mindset Triangle book to their service users. Or maybe you need a kickstart so why not spend the day with Stu. Shopping, cooking and having a workout to put you in the right mindset to hit that triangle.


The Impact

The impact could be huge and we want to make this as big as we can. 12 men a day take their own life in the UK. For every 1 completed suicide another 20 attempted suicides. These numbers need to come down and for that to happen we need to remove the stigma blanket that is suffocating many men living with mental health in the UK. This can be done by making a community of like minded people sharing cooking ideas or working out together and being there as a support for each other. It is OK not to be OK and talking about it helps.

Please show your support by becoming a pledger to 'The Mindset Triangle' campaign, Every donation: no matter how big or small, goes a long way to help. You can also do your bit by sharing the campaign on social media, passing it on to friends and of course tweeting us your #TagTheTriangle picture.

We really appreciate your help, and welcome you to become part of this exciting journey...

 

Stu's Story

"I have suffered with depression and anxiety for many years now. I'm not sure when it started, maybe I have always had it but it has been masked by other factors.  One thing for sure - It got worse as I have got older, when stress levels are raised by having more responsibilities. You may be asking what's the point in me shouting out? It's because for years I have been hiding behind bravado because of the stigma that is Mental Illness. The MALE PRIDE trying not to show weakness as a man, be the man of the house that is expected of a father or husband. I want to let other people know that it is okay to be depressed and to talk about it to lighten the load.  It's not just a matter of cheering up. The phrase  "You just need to cheer up" still rings around my head after it took weeks for the wife to convince me I needed to see a doctor and for me to sit there and dig deep pushing the male pride aside and relay the feelings I have had, still have and the dark moments; for him to take a deep breath look me in the eyes and say " you just need to cheer up " hit me like a bull hits a red flag.

Its been a fair few years since that doctor and now I can feel the feelings and counteract them with positive stuff. Exercise and pushing my mind and body in different challenges is my way. There are 2 reasons for this.  1 being that the body releases the natural chemical endorphins when you exercise which gives you a buzz of importance and happiness.   The 2nd would be the commitment of a challenge and raising money for a charity keeps me focused and if you can get a world record like we did in 2011 even better.

When I have a low day the best way for me to destress is to get on my bike. Only a cyclist knows how a dog feels with its head out of a moving car. The wind in your face, endorphins rushing around your body creating positive thoughts, the wonderful view of the countryside on a summers morning and the coffee and lump of cake you will inhale half way through your cycle is a great feeling.

Where is the dark side? you may ask. It's the place you go to when depression gets you by the short and curlies. There's nowhere like it. It has a gravitational pull where the duvet on your bed weighs about 20 stone and you just have no motivation to do anything apart from beating yourself up and finding every negative thought you have in the grey matter upstairs.

Whenever I have been there I can never put my finger on why I have the thoughts. I look back at what I was like a few years, back before diagnosis and to be honest it's amazing that I have come out of the other side. Self harm and suicidal thoughts were a constant battle and happened quite regularly and I couldn't understand why. Always on the search for someone or something to blame but could never find the answer.

I am completely different now and that has all came down to acceptance that " I'm not wired up right" and that taking the tablets isn't such a big deal. Believe me though when I first got the tablets I hated taking them and didn't think they did anything - until I'd forget to take them for a couple of days and really notice my mood change. In laymen's terms my brain doesn't make enough of the right chemical and the tablets replace this. Simples. Don't get me wrong I didn't get a prescription for the drugs straight away I was completely against it. I first went on a psychodynamic therapy course of 12 weeks at the doctors, which worked great to put a lot of things to bed from the past when I was a kid.

What I am trying to say is you have to make the first step. I'm lucky to have an amazing people around me that could see that I wasn't happy even though when asked the generic answer is " I'm Fine". Don't be scared to get help or ask for advice. I punished myself for years. All jazzyhands and smiley stu outside and then a mess when in my own company.

Dig deep, kick that duvet off the bed stick on some trainers and walk round the block. Set a positive goal for something in the future that is achievable."

story:
Summary

Greetings everyone! I am Abdi Latif Ega, author of Guban - a novel exploring the lives of a plethora of characters from all walks of life in postcolonial Somalia, as she revolves around its region, continent and world.

I am currently in the process of writing my second novel, Musa. The work is a chronicle of the American dream through the gaze of an African immigrant.  He yearns to relocate far away from the pressures of institutional racism, back to Africa, after years in North America. A  return  back might be in order! 

Musa is a work that aims to explore the difficult realities we so often confront in our "modern" existence: displacement, exile and the ever-present, looming large NOSTALGIA!  This also includes my own experiences for over two decades in the US, with not too in-frequent returns.

The work endeavors to be critical, independent, and free of institutional restrictions that  so often come along with their funding - funding that is hardly granted to independent voices. It takes a village to nourish free thought; your individual contributions through crowdfunding will do just that!

What We Need & What You Get

The funding will allow me to continuously work and finish the novel, Musa. Such an endeavor will entail the following:

  • 1 year of  sustained writing that includes research, writing, travel, and base cost of living.
  • The research will require immersion through travel to these "modern" cities.  This includes interviewing a myriad of African immigrants, returnees, and their families.
  • The anticipated funding of $20,000 will aid in the writing of Musa, and will be allocated as follows:
  1. $5,000 - Travel (within major metropolitan American cities as well as one major  African city) and transportation.
  2. $12,000 - Upkeep for minimalist living requirements for an entire year.
  3. $3,000 - Technical resources, research costs (interview pay, access to certain documents, e.t.c), and emergency funding.

The Impact

Your contributions will help bring a voice that will be an authentic recounting of an African immigrant's life in the United States - in all its living glory, both good and bad.

Your sponsorship will ensure a critical narrative and an honest appraisal of the immigrant's many realities - an alternative narrative to the oft-monolithic mainstream immigrant story of "rags to riches." 

Risks & Challenges

I consider myself a cultural worker and I tell everyone's stories. The risk I face daily is being overwhelmed by the various mainstream publishers whose sheer size and capacity are always in favor of what they assume will be good for the marketplace. In doing so, the mainstream publishers drown out the non-contrived voices of independent writers.

This is where your contributions will make a vital difference. In aiding independent voices, you foster independent thinkers and allow them to speak truth to power.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your indulgence. Please be sure to share with friends and family, both far and wide!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! I'm PT Sheldon Low of Orinda, CA. I've been practicing physical therapy for 35-plus years and have my own practice called Orinda Physical Therapy, where I focus on treatment for backs, necks, shoulders and migraines.

Over the last six years, I've perfected a manual therapy technique that is effective in eliminating migraine headaches. It involves decreasing nerve impingements at the source. Eight to nine percent of the U.S. population (so, 38-40 million people) suffers from migraines, and I'm hoping to spread my technique and help decrease the devastating headaches that affect so many people.

In a recent self-funded case study, about 80 percent of patients treated with my technique showed significant improvements, including many to the point of taking less medicine, feeling less pain, being more physically functional or being cured completely.

I'm asking for donations for the writing and publishing of a book that will allow migraine sufferers and clinicians to learn the technique, treat themselves at home and patients nationwide, and get rid of the pain once and for all. Please consider donating to help us push this forward as quickly as possible and improve the health of millions of people. Thank you!

What We Need & What You Get

My team is asking for $75,000 in funding to be put towards the writing, editing, publishing and distributing of a book detailing this breakthrough therapy technique, as well as to fund past and future case studies.

Every dollar donated (whether the entire goal is met or not) will go to paying for and expediting this process so we can get the book into the hands of patients and clinicians as soon as possible and help them treat this debilitating condition.

There will be a few donation levels for this project, with perks ranging from acknowledgment in the book, to free copies, to private physical therapy sessions.

The Impact

As mentioned initially, 38-40 million Americans suffer from migraine headaches, so chances are you or someone you know is affected. Migraines can completely debilitate a person, leading some to even consider self-harm.

Patients I've worked on in the past have had pain reduced significantly, which has allowed them to return to working regularly, re-enroll in school, and spend more, healthier time with family, to name a few.

This is my first crowdfunding campaign and I'm excited to bring the community in to help me conquer a disease that affects so many people in such a painful way. More than three-quarters of patients in my therapy technique case study felt significant improvement after just a few visits, so I really believe this could change the way migraines are treated in the future.

So far, we've received support from leading experts in the field, and have already seen an overwhelmingly positive response from viewers who saw a CBS news story about the project. You can see that video clip here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5OWa8wNCYq8

Risks & Challenges

As with any book-writing project, I realize that the process may take time. Obstacles will appear along the way in terms of editing, re-writing and publishing. To combat this, I've put together a team with backgrounds in writing, editing, publishing, social media and web design who all share a passion for the project and its ultimate goal of easing the pain of migraine sufferers as soon as possible.

We are completely dedicated to this project and its expedited release. If any roadblocks do appear, we will keep the community updated on our timeline and plan to solve the issue quickly and move forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that not everyone will be able to contribute financially, and that's just fine! The best thing you can do without donating is to share this campaign with all of your friends and across social media accounts - I guarantee it will reach one or more people who could be helped by a novel technique to migraine treatment!

The wider word is spread, the more donations we can get, the more awareness we can raise, and the faster we can help get this book written and distributed. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out to your personal and social media communities!

story:
Heart of Light is a fantasy steampunk illustrated novel.

The story begins a thousand years ago in the Drachnian kingdom during the first iron war, when Iroh (known in his time as The Iron King) created 9 powerful war machines called "The Nine Gods" woven with the souls of his Nine Drachnian Warlords in hopes to finally stop the dreaded war.

Outmatched in the battlefield the nine mechanical gods eventually ended the Iron war.

But in the night before the gathering of the Nine Nations in Galderos to discuss peaceful solutions in the Drachnian Kingdom. The nine gods began killing everyone they have all sworn to protect - and no one knows why. Betrayed and wounded Iroh used an ancient artifact known as the "Moonstone" to trap the human souls of the nine gods inside the stone. 

Then as the last soul was sealed inside the Moonstone the light flickered and the Moonstone . . . vanished. Leaving the Iron King lifeless.

Years, decades, a millennium had long past since that historical night. Rumors became myth; myth became legend. For more than a thousand years the location of the Moonstone that holds their nine souls remained . . .unknown.


Untill . . . A faint sound of a heartbeat.

THE IRON LAW

In the mechanical world of Galderos, soul mechanicks like Mika have skills that combine animal souls into machines. 

Known as "Soul Weaving", with gloves of metal and light. A soul mechanick weaves the threads of life into the iron core of the machine. Forging war machines, vehicles or gadgets that help their masters do their bidding. But with such a dangerous skill, there is a strict code to obey. An ancient law that forbids mechanicks of all rank from disturbing the balance between life and nature. Known in the council of mechanicks as "The Iron Law". This sacred law was created a thousand years ago after the entrapment of the Nine Gods, to prevent history from repeating itself.


The Five Iron Law:
1: You shall honor the souls you weave.
2: You shall never weave the soul of a human being inside a machine.
3: You shall never combine machinery with any human flesh.
4: You shall only weave the souls that have ended their life naturally.
5: You shall depart a soul in peace if it exists in torment.

Summary

That was a sneak peek of what the book holds. I hope you are all thrilled after reading it as much as I was writing it! “Heart of Light” revolves around the story of Michaela Paige Reininger a.k.a Mika, a young soul mechanick who travels around the world of Galderos with her father Gustav, inside their moondust powered vehicle known as "The Scarab".




  • I am an animator and game designer in Hong Kong. In my free time I write short stories poems and novels. An aspiring writer. :)

  • I created this novel to dedicate it to a dear friend of mine who is suffering from a terminal illness. I wish to finish the novel before anything happens to her. I want her to read the world I created for her and I wanted to remember her whenever I or anyone reads the book. I wish to give her immortality as a parting gift. :)

  • “Heart of Light” has a unique storyline and a well-detailed and thought-out world populated by unique characters. By funding this project you may be contributing to a next best seller for all ages to enjoy and hopefully cherish.

Why it is special:
  • The book contains 1 full page image of each scene in a chapter plus other small spot illustrations that brings the world of Galderos to life.
  • Characters with interesting backgrounds and mysteries written in the past.
  • A unique world with laws and systems only found in this book.
  • As you progress in the story discover the 5 classes of machines that exist in the mechanical world, like the Primadon-class war machines woven with the soul of a land mammal in its iron core - and many more!
  • Uncover the secrets in the past of who the nine gods were and why they betrayed their oath on that faithful night.
  • As you progress in the story you get to learn the art of "Soul Weaving", an art form that allows soul mechanicks like Mika to weave the soul of an animal inside a machine.

What the Project needs

All fundings will be used for:

  • 45 detailed graphics for the illustrated novel.
  • Time dedicated to writing the novel.
  • An animated Youtube book trailer to be released this summer.
  • Marketing campaigns.
  • Editors and Agents to help promote the book.

Set Milestones

  • USD 5000 - allows me to hire a voice actor, sound designer and video editor to work on the Book trailer. 
  • USD 7000 - allows me to work with my artists to finish all detailed graphic images of the book.
  • USD 3000 - allows me to hire my editor to layout and make sure the writings on the book are in top quality.
  • USD 5000 - the remaining amount will then be used for marketing campaigns

What you get for supporting the Campaign

  • Be the first to read the book before its release!
  • Exclusive contents in the book!
  • Artworks of you and the characters!
  • Be part of the world as one of the characters in Galderos!
  • A copy of the book on its release day!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also support the book by following it in Facebook to be up to date with latest graphics, quotes from the book and other interesting promotions!

https://www.facebook.com/TheNineGods




The Team


I already have two people helping me with this project (Artist and Editor).
Together we are trying to bring the world of Galderos to life. Even with my own busy day job as an animator I will still do all that I can to finish the book and even if the worst should come, I will still continue this project with all the resources that I have to deliver a good reading experience to all of you.

If you can't afford to contribute financially, any sharing would be highly appreciated! Facebook, Tumblr, Reddit you name it!



You may also preview any contents of the book (Chapter sneak peaks, artworks and character/concept designs) in the gallery tab above. I will add more contents as the campaign goes on.

I hope you're all as excited about this book as I am.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR INTERESTS AND SUPPORT...:)

story:
What is Lash?

Lash Magazine, formerly known as Isis Magazine, is an intersectional, feminist publication at Emerson College founded by three women in 2013. We are focused on promoting social commentary and healthy dialogue about feminism, relationships, and popular culture, online and in print. We feature personal essays, articles, fictional stories, and rants, as well as art that ranges from photography to poetry.

After years of challenging the prevailing societal norms of patriarchy, heterosexism, white supremacy, and classism on our campus through the web, we are trying to create our first ever print edition. An inclusive feminism is necessary in the world and perhaps more possible than ever before. By creating a platform to express ourselves, we believe we are providing an example of counterculture that can help inspire radical change in our society.


What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for contributors to this campaign to incrementally help us reach $1,700 so we can print several hundred copies of our magazine to serve to our peers. As you can see, we've planned exactly how much a quality magazine will cost us.

In addition, contributors who donate $10 will receive a link to a digital copy of the magazine as soon as it is complete. Those who contribute $25 can receive a physical copy mailed to them if that's what they'd prefer and we reach our fundraising goal. Any funds we make beyond our goal will go toward costs related to Lash Magazine, such as the website, and toward our next issue. 

The Impact

Lash Magazine has been a vehicle on our campus for students to talk about reproductive rights, sex positivity, issues of body image, racism, sexism in the media, labor rights, sexual orientation, polyamory, and even their own experiences of sexual assault. As a result, at even our most fledgling stages, our articles have been talked about in the Boston press, including BostonInno and boston.com, on social media, and referred to on Autostraddle. 

We believe that our growth can continue to inspire debate, change minds, and fight for the intersectional feminist cause.

Risks & Challenges

We know that we have a short period of time to fundraise and that our goal is a difficult one. As mentioned above, if we do not meet our fundraising goal, the costs will be used to supplement the magazine, including the preparation of a print issue for the following semester.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please spread the word about our campaign. Share our Facebook page.  The world needs more young voices sharing their perspectives and personal stories. The world needs more comprehensive understandings of gender, sexuality, and race that break down binaries. We can all do our part to shift the cultural paradigm and bend the moral arc of the universe to its rightful place.
